review.reviewText: Hotel Breakfast quite pricey but service was excellent

Fantastic. Great price. Great location. Fantastic room. Best sheets and bed.

review.reviewText: great location and beautiful common areas. Rooms need a dresser with drawers

It was good overall. We upgraded to a suite since the deluxe room was very small. The suite was comfortable and beautiful. The concierge was always busy and had a long line of people waiting for service. One time I called the concierge and the answering machine replied. I had to leave a message since no one answered.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: We arrived at and were upgradged to a beautiful 2 room suite complete with fireplace and 2 lRge sofas with desk.  The king bedroom was very comfortable!  The spa type bathroom even had a heated toilet seat!

review.title: Elegant hotel, clean and in the heart of downtown.
review.reviewText: My family and I enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco and walking distance to Union Square.

review.title: Absolutely beautiful!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I love staying here! The hotel is gorgeous but the best part is the gym/pool. Every morning we go to the gym and then play for hours in the pool. It's relaxing and fun and we love it.

review.title: Loved the Palace
review.reviewText: This was a great experience from the valet at the front door to the reception and then to the comfortable room.  Should we travel to SF again, Palace Hotel would be a top choice for our hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and great service.  The concierge was able to get us dinner reservations at a hard to book restaurant.

review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square and a short walk to the Ferry Building.

review.title: The best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This is a historical site that was remodeled in 2015. President Harding died there in 1923.
Nikita Khrushchev stayed there in 1959. BART is just outside on Market. You can be in the airport in 30". The famous SF Cable Car Powell terminal is just 3 blocks away.
review.positiveRemarks: How clean it is. And, for the size of the hotel, you are checked-in in minutes by very pleasant clerks.
review.negativeRemarks: For the size of the hotel, the 8 person jacuzzi is too small.
review.locationRemarks: There are 100 things to do in San Francisco.

review.title: Preserved Charm :)
review.reviewText: It was a grand and stunning first impression and did not disappoint thereafter. Staff was extremely classy and friendly. The Pied Piper lounge was located conveniently which made it so nice. The hotel accommodated our large group. The gym was perfect. Clean, spacious and excellent equipment. Rooms were spacious (except for the bathroom, which was average in size... keeping with the original authenticity). Hotel held the integrity of the old building w/ updated décor. The only complaint I have was I could detect a slight smell of smoking somewhere in my room. But I am hyper sensitive to the smell and I was still ok w/ it.
review.positiveRemarks: Beauty. The fact that they renovated something old and historical. Rates were respectable.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell in room. Musky/smoke???
review.locationRemarks: Location was great!

review.title: Lives up to its name!
review.reviewText:
This hotel exceeded our expectations and we are a family of five! Kid friendly and adult friendly alike.  The pool was amazing, the rooms were clean, comfortable, and beautiful. 
The staff were all very professional and friendly to our entire family. we even remember names like Norman, Scott, Jorge, and Felipe to name a few.  Very service oriented and helpful during our stay.  Will gladly stay again!

review.title: Located in the middle on market street downtown.
review.reviewText: Room some what on the small side and no dresser in the room to put clothes.

review.title: Luxury downtown hotel
review.reviewText: We are a family of 4 and stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is spotless and perfectly maintained. The pool was the highlight for our family and was the reason we booked this hotel. I highly recommend it for that reason. The bathroom and beds are top quality. Our view was not good at all. Our window looked down on an area that was full of garbage, which was a tough site for such an expensive hotel. I assume we got that view due to our lower rate. The food and breakfast in the hotel is very expensive, but there is a Starbucks around the corner. As mentioned in other reviews, you have to pay for internet access. All in all, it is a beautiful hotel, and the pool is spectacular.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide coffee in the room.

review.title: Great location if you know the City
review.reviewText: Wish the room had chests of drawers, but otherwise really great hotel!

review.title: Amazing! Very welcoming
review.reviewText: I went here for my birthday..everyone was so kind and welcoming! Place was beautiful and clean. Def recommend

review.title: Not as expected
review.reviewText:
We checked in a smaller room than the one we booked.
No free internet in the hotel, which is not expected as we paid a lot for our stay and the Internet should have been included.
The hotel lobby is completely open for the public and anyone walking by can just come in and stay in the lobby where sometimes we couldn't find a place to sit.
The overall is a little chocking, not satisfied with this experience

review.title: Stunning hotel in great location
review.reviewText: All the staff were very friendly. We were able to check in earlier as our room was ready. The hotel is very beautiful. My husband enjoyed going to the gym every morning before we ventured out.  The room and bed were perfect. The room temperature was great. The pillows and comforter were refreshing and soft. Upon my return I went shopping looking for pillows that were similar. I loved having breakfast buffet in the garden court. It had the most amazing items that I have ever seen. A large variety and different items that you don't normally see. There was yogurt parfaits, various cheeses, portuguese sausage, fruit, french toast, pancakes, muffins, scones, croissants, sliced bread, bagels, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the bed and room temp. the best. It was walking distance to union square and all the great department stores and chinatown.
review.negativeRemarks: We were disappointed there was no coffee machine in the rooms. We enjoy having a late night coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all the major department stores such as Macys, Saks, Neiman Marcus.

review.title: Classy,  comfortable, convenient
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel.  Stayed their with my girlfiend for a long weekend.  Only knock was our second floor room giving Market Street was noisy at night.  Kept us up one night.
loved this place! recommend this hotel to everyone... love the detail to everything.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText:
SPG hotel has the exception to treat their guess. Free flow of drinking water and late check out.
Staffs are friendly and courteous

review.title: Very Convenient to any location

review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Beautiful hotel and great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at The Palace Hotel with our children very much. A clean, classic, stylish and luxurious hotel; we remarked a few times how comfortable we felt there. We walked to North Beach, Chinatown, The Ferry Building, Exploratorium, SFMOMA, etc. With so much to do in San Francisco, we didn't make it to the pool. We are confirmed "hotel snobs" and this one did not disappoint.

review.title: Beautiful hotel and great location!
review.reviewText: From valet to check out was 5 star experience! Especially the indoor pool but the Jacuzzi is a bit small and was shut down the last day for cleaning.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! especially the indoor pool but the Jacuzzi is a bit small and was shut down the last day for cleaning.
review.negativeRemarks: Jacuzzi is a bit small and was shut down the last day for cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.reviewText: Overall, we would highly recommend this  beautiful property due to the wonderful staff, great location, easy checkin and checkout. indoor pool/jacuzzi and 24 hour room service. The lobby is incredible and the general decor of the rooms is lovely.  However, the rooms could use better lighting and while the beds were comfy, they were small. There were 4 of us in the room (2 adults, 2 children) and we were told 2 double beds were our only option (queen beds would have been perfect). There was also a continuous draft from the large window right beside one of the beds. The pool area is amazing but the temperature of both the room and the pool could have been warmer...a bit chilly in there.  The large jacuzzi is an excellent way to warm up though.
Exceptional hotel.  Everything was very top notch without being overdone.  The staff was extremely helpful and kind.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient and comfortable this is a fantastic Hotel.

review.title: Great location to all shopping and restaurants
review.reviewText: Great location in Union square. Walking distance to high end shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Luxury hotel, lousy accounting and dodgy wifi
review.reviewText: The Palace is a really nice, luxury hotel in a convenient location on Market St in San Francisco. Unfortunately our stay was ruined by two poor policy decisions by the hotel management.  On check-in, I made it clear I was using a debit card and was assured that no deductions would be made during "pre-authorization". This was untrue as $100 was immediately deducted and after we spent more than the $100 on a meal, not only was another $100 deducted but also the cost of the meal as well.  We now had over $300 not available on our debit card. We are assured it will be returned - in 5 days.  So my advice - do not use a debit card in this hotel even when you're told it will be OK.  The second is the Free WiFi fine print. The hotel advertises that free wifi is available. They don't tell you that it is NOT available free to Expedia bookings!! Expedia clients get one hour free wifi - only in the lounge, only for one device per room and only once per stay - seriously.  Free wifi is only available to loyalty program members, corporate clients and people who book directly thru the hotel website.  None of this is made clear anywhere until arrival. Free WiFi should be available in all hotels and for this hotel to gouge its Expedia clients in this way is unforgivable.  If you get caught like we did, persist with your request for free wifi and the staff will eventually provide an access code! Also allow an hour to checkout! Apart from these very sour notes, it was a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambience and decor is incredible
review.negativeRemarks: Poor staff training leading to misleading info at checkin about debit card use.  Free wifi should be available to Expedia bookings
review.locationRemarks: Public transport is nearby and frequent - a lot of good local eateries but many are closed on the weekends as this is the financial district.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: Absolutely gorgeous hotel, staff was on pointe, room was impeccable, everything was just perfect. This is our preferred hotel when we travel to San Francisco. Definitely worth every penny. Would recommend to anybody looking for a real 5 star hotel.

review.title: The Palace has been restored in modern luxury.
review.reviewText: The Palace has been restored in modern luxury without losing it's essential old world taste. Although the rooms are smallish they also have invested in very high quality super comfortable beds!  We enjoyed the wonderful pool and gym as well!
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to Union Spare and the lots of Art Galleries.

review.title: Very convenient location!
review.reviewText:
Good: 
1. Location, location, location! Right at the BART Montgomery station, MUNI, nice restaurants, stores and park.
2. Historical hotel with a lot of charm and details. 
3. Live classical piano music in the evenings.
4. Room is relatively spacious for SF downtown.
5. Quiet room, comfortable beds and crisp bedding. If ask for a room on the inner side, not facing the street, it is surprisingly quiet. Since it is a 8 story building, no view (only street view at best) to speak of anyway.
6. We got early check in at 12:30 pm, pleasant surprise.
7. Friendly staff.

Bad:
1. Water pressure in shower is a tad weak.
2. Shower curtain has mildew and tried to cling to my body :(
3. Water temp in the beautiful pool is cold, makes the pool not so enjoyable.
Nice hotel. I would have like to have a coffee machine in the room.
Great time nice hotel. The breakfast was excellent, pool and gym were nice and clean. The room was well kept and cleaned daily.

review.title: Top hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Top hotel, very well located for shopping and dinning. Pool was a great plus, even better if you travel with kids.

review.title: Nice stays in heart of San fracisco
review.reviewText: very clean room, quiet, comfy bed. great lobby and breakfast is delicious.

review.title: Pretty Hotel that needs staff help
review.reviewText: The Palace is a lovely hotel, that could easily achieve a five star rating with some improvements of the interior staff.  Check in experience was slow, with repeated requests for the same information.  Service at the main garden area was also poor, which is a shame, it is a beautiful room.  Positive notes, the hotel was well maintained, the doorman and valet services excellent, as was the service at the Pied Piper.
review.negativeRemarks: Interior staff.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of San Francisco, so everything!

review.title: Great luxury hotel

I was looking forward to the afternoon tea but was upset that the information I was given wasn't correct, I was told that the tea was everyday from 1-5 however the special afternoon tea was only on Saturdays. Hopefully in the future I'll be able to experience that

review.title: Nice luxury Hotel, Close to everything.
review.reviewText: clean room, comfortable bed, just about right temperature, quiet. breakfast is super good. will go back next time and try their afternoon tea.

review.title: Classy Hotel in a Prime Location
review.reviewText:
The building is probably close to 100 years old.  However, the rooms themselves appeared to have been totally renovated recently. The bathroom had brand new modern fixtures, was of appropriate size and, was thoroughly clean.  The room itself was modern and larger than most hotels
This hotel has a phenomenal lobby called the "Garden Court."  It's about 3 stories high, the architecture is that somewhat elaborate style similar to buildings in Paris built in the late 1800s, and the ceiling is stained glass.

It has been my observation that when you make reservations thru a discount broker like Expedia, the hotel usually gives you the least desirable rooms.  And that was the case with us.  Our room was on the 2nd floor (no high view) and our windows faced an open courtyard (of a gravel roof).
review.positiveRemarks: classy, location, location, location.  There are a BART (ride to/from SFO airport) station and a Muni rail station right across the street.
review.locationRemarks: You're close to Union Square & the Civic Center.  There are umpteen bus lines running along Market St.  One of them took us to the museums in GG Park.

Staff is very friendly; Concierge especially Debbie was very knowledgeable and informative.  Housekeeping did an excellent job with daily maintenance of the room.  The pool was a nice treat at the end of a long day of sightseeing.

Didn't use hotel restaurants so can't comment on dining, but there are lots of great restaurants in the area.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: I treated my granddaughter to San Francisco for her high school graduation gift. It was her first time there and I wanted her to stay in a beautiful hotel, just to impress her a little, lol. The Palace Hotel is lovely and she was impressed! We had a marvelous time making memories together, and I thank you for your courteous staff, and gorgeous, stately building.

review.locationRemarks: This location is very centrally located. Easy access to buses, trolley cars and China town. Ghirardelli shop on site was great for kids sundaes.

review.title: Excellent location, very helpful & attentive staff
review.reviewText: Excellent location, right by the BART and walking distance to the Ferry Building! The staff were incredibly helpful and provided us with all the maps and suggestions we inquired about. They were all very friendly and not pretentious at all (which we really appreciate!) The rooms were beautiful, though not the greatest view. Great high ceilings and bright rooms with all the amenities we needed. Only one downside, I like a lot of counter space in the bathroom, which there was not but there was lots of room to place items and toiletries in the room and on the desk. Very comfortable bed. Clean and comfortable linens. We do a lot of travelling and we had a very lovely stay here and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to SF. Use the Concierge staff-- they are amazing and incredibly helpful!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: More washroom counter space. The people in the hallways were a bit loud and it was easy to hear through the doors. (Though it was not that often).
review.locationRemarks: Location is excellent! Coffee shops, BART and Ferry Building all nearby.

Great Hotel, good staff. surprised the bars didn't stay open after midnight... even on a Friday evening
Nice hotel, very nice style and character, good location.

review.title: Nice hotel in location, clean & kind staffs
review.reviewText: It was my first visit to Sanfrancisco. Location of Palace hotel was fantastic! We got a ride BART from SFO airport to this hotel. The BART station was very near the hotel. Also we could travel most popolar areas easily from this hotel; union square, china town, North beath, Fisherman's warf, Pier 39, ....The room was very clean and guiet, and I feel like luxuary! But I feel that breakfast buffe in this hotel was somewhat expensive.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, excellent room
review.reviewText: Although I live in the Bay Area, I had a late night event in SF and thought it would be nice to overnight nearby, and maybe get up on a Sunday, hit some museums, maybe stroll the waterfront. I chose the Palace for its proximity to Yerba Buena Center (so I wouldn't have to park twice) and grabbed a rate that included parking. Was thrilled to discover the rooms have been updated beautifully. Had no view but as I was arriving late and leaving relatively early, I didn't really care. It was super quiet. I ordered a room service dinner which came FAST and HOT and was actually delicious (how often can you say that?) and ran off to my work event. Got back and relaxed in a hot bath. The next morning I slept in, on their luxurious sheets and beautiful pillows, enjoyed a workout in the beautiful workout room, which overlooks the indoor pool (next time: bring a suit), then strolled around the corner to one of the best spots in SF for breakfast - The Grove - inexpensive and terrific. For those who have never been to SF, the Palace Hotel has some stunning restaurants, the Garden Court and the Pied Piper Bar, but if you aren't in the mood, there are some good options, for much less money, within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rooms, and lovely people - from the doorman, to valet, to the check-in desk, to the room service.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the new Museum of Modern Art, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, Union Square. Catch the street car to the Ferry Building.

review.title: convenient!!
review.reviewText: It is veryy easy to visit anywhere from the hotel. It is near the Union Square, Montgomery station, cablecar station and Ferry terminal. It is not a new  one but clean and gorgeous. The staff are very friendly.  We want there again and again.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise of drainage.
review.locationRemarks: Go shopping to Union Square, take a cable car, go for a walk to the Ferry building, go to Oakland bu Bart.

review.negativeRemarks: The only downfall is the Parking, but the valet staff were awesome.
review.locationRemarks: We had a fabulous time at the Giants game and the Farmers Market at the Ferry Building.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, centrally located
review.reviewText: Accommodating team members, lovely building. Ask for a room away from the fitness centre as the door bangs all day.

photos.caption: Garden Court (grand finale of "The Game" and visited by an endless list of luminaries

review.title: World class hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is an immense hotel that manages to offer a feeling of intimacy and quiet. Staff at every level and location are very professional, and eager to make guests feel welcome and worry-free. The hotel has a rich history, and I highly recommend guests read about its famous, sometimes infamous, past (available online and in the gift shop). The renovation shows respect for the past with a nod to contemporary style. Guest rooms and public areas are immaculate. The location is in a bustling area of downtown, but this is an ideal location for seeing this area on foot, as well as having easy access to all outlying areas of SF.  I did use the garage, and my car was always available without delay.

Beautiful court garden restaurant
Great location
Room is small with no view
-------------------------------

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good environment & very comfortable,   Friendly service !

review.title: A very nice hotel convenient to downtown
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week and enjoyed our stay very much. All of the staff are very pleasant and extremely helpful
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Right downtown on the flat part of San Fran. Handy to restaurants, shopping and transit

review.title: Pleasant Surprise at Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The facilities are beautiful.  They do not contstruct hotels like this anymore. The rehab of this queen hotel was done tastfully mixing the historic nature of the hotel with nice modern touches.   Everything was first class during our entire stay.   All staff was extremely friendly and alway said good morning, good day, or good evening, regardless of what else they were doing.     Great location near BART station and walking distance to many sites for exploring.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the amenities, the staff everything was top notch.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds, although very nice, were a little too hard for my tastes.
review.locationRemarks: BART Station at the steps of the hotel easy walk to Embardeaco, convention center, china town.   Great restaurants nearby.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in the financial district, easy walking distance to a lot of shops and reataurants, friendly hotel staff, nice condition

review.title: Love The Palace
review.reviewText: Third stay here. Close to high end shopping and The Embarcadero. Somewhat noisy street side.

This hotel has a prime location and extremely helpful staff. The exercise facility includes updated cardio equipment, free weights and movable benches, plus one set of TRX straps, so you could actually get in a variety of different kinds of workouts if you wanted to. You have to pay a fee for the internet, but the wireless connectivity worked during our entire stay and was relatively fast. The room was more than comfortable and had been modernized. Plus, the Pied Piper makes excellent cocktails.
Great lobby, nice location, good food and excellent beds. We really enjoyed it.

review.title: Heart of San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: This was an amazing experience!!! First time to San Francisco... We found The Palace online and seeing it in person was even better... Not knowing what to expect I was very impressed. The staff was very wonderful and kind! It was a Beautiful Hotel. I love that it was right in the heart of San Francisco. Walking distance to all the attractions, views were awesome, close to Bart!
review.positiveRemarks: What's not to like!!! Staff was awesome! Rooms were spacious and very clean and very comfortable! The pool and hot tub were fantastic! I loved robes
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing in my opinion! What they are doing is great! This is a 5 star
review.locationRemarks: Downtown in the District! Walking to Fisherman Wharf! Bart entrance was literally in the front of the hotel.  It was awesome!!!

review.title: More or less 5 Star
review.reviewText: Many places in SF are shabby for the value. But the Palace is a great place, and would recommend it over paying nearly the same for a beat up place like many are in the City. I only can say I would hope they get more modern on the "tag and ding" styles many hotels had 10 years ago. Meaning; the Wifi is an added price to a 5 start room? and small things like Espresso are outlandishly expensive and added to the breakfast you paid for (premium cost). When I go into a 5 star hotel I expect to pay, and I did. For me I would rather have everything packed into the base fair + breakfast cost, and not have silly things like a coffee and wifi added later.
review.negativeRemarks: sales tagging
review.locationRemarks: great location with metro at the side door step.

review.reviewText:
Weekend away.
I went for a Dad/Daughter weekend away with my daughter who wanted to stay in a 5 star hotel.  This was a homerun.  We had a great time, loved drinks in the lobby, the breakfast, as well as the staff.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a pricey tag!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, rooms and bathroom were a little small. Fresh linens every day! No microwave or coffee maker. It did have a refrigerator though.

review.title: Such an exclusive hotel!
review.reviewText: Great historic hotel, excellent location, room fantastic & staff very professional + great service

review.title: Excellent hotel but should work in better parking
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant experience. We recommend to our friends

review.title: Picked hotel for location to all shopping, restaur
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful.   Experience was good.    Room was very nice but suggest a chair and ottoman otherwise you have to lay on the bed to relax.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm and attn to detail
review.negativeRemarks: See above comment

review.title: Staying at the Palace
review.reviewText: Arrived at the hotel at 3:30 on April 8th to check in and there was only 2 employees available to check in a line of approx 20 people. When I was checking in I was informed that they did not have a room with a King bed for us even though that is what I reserved and paid for. They tried to offer me a room with two double beds and I asked what compensation would be given. I was informed there would be no compensation since I booked with Expedia there is nothing they could do. I showed them my reservation for a King bed with parking and explained to them that I would like what I paid for. Then I was informed that oh yes a room with a King bed is available but not for over an hour as it was not cleaned yet. I explained that we wanted to go to our room to rest and get ready for the SF Giants game. I was told that we could use their locker room to change and they would then hold our baggage. I refused that. After being at the counter for over 15 minutes the clerk said he would give us a room with double beds temporarily and then when we returned after the game at 11pm we could then have our room with the King bed. I am very disappointed that at check in time our room was not ready and the clerk made me feel that being an Expedia customer means I am not important, that I am less of a customer to the Palace. I am very disappointed and do not know if I will return again.
review.negativeRemarks: Treat all guests equally important. Be prepared for our arrival at check in time.

review.title: Hotel near union square and shopping malls
review.reviewText: Excellent time to spend weekend shopping and at the same time to relax.

My husband and I spent our 50th anniversary in San Francisco and Napa. Our stay at the Palace was perfect for the occasion. The hotel location was perfect to access the wharf and Union Square.  The hotel was beautiful and all the staff every accommodating. We will stay there against n.

review.title: Amazing Hotel & Staff - 98% There...
review.reviewText:
The staff is 5+ star all the way.  Always courteous and helpful.  Great room, extremely comfortable beds, and I'm coming from a Temperpedic, so I'm a bit of a bed snob!  Great location too.  The only complaints I have is that the pool was a little cold, and the hot tub chemicals caused a rash / burn on my legs that I had dangling in for 15 minutes.  The next day I only stayed in the hot tub for 10 minutes and I was fine.  I think the chemicals were way too strong for that first day.
I would highly recommend the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, Piers, Academy of Sciences, The Exploratorium (I could have spent all day there), Golden Gate Bridge, Muir Woods, Napa Valley (1 hour away).

review.title: Excellent!!!!
review.reviewText: The staff is incredible excellent. I will recommend this hotel. Love It
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the lobby, the courtyard and the tea time in the court yard
review.negativeRemarks: The Pool does not match the quality and architecture that the hotel has.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to Union Square

review.title: Nice! Close to Moscone center
review.reviewText: All is  good in hotel except sound insulation! We heard a lot of different activities in the hall which disrupt our sleep .

review.title: You must stay here!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is gorgeous and perfectly located! The Grand Atrium is like something out of a movie and will make you very happy - you can enjoy tea and cocktails and listen to music in the evening.  It's a very luxurious space with old-world charm and style!  The rooms are also great - tall ceilings, crazy comfy beds, and plenty of space.  The pool is great for kids and adults - there's a dome over it so you feel like you're still part of the city.  My daughter loved the Ghirardelli shop that is accessible through the hotel, the concierge was very helpful, and the food was delicious - free coffee until 10 in the lobby was a bonus. In that area, recommend Bodin one block over for breakfast, and The Grove down a block and around the corner - so yummy. The Asian Art Museum down Market Street was a gem, and almost all the buses run down Market Street in front of the hotel so you can get to the Legion of Honor (awesome!) and to Golden Gate Park (Tea Garden and Science Museum were terrific).  Easiest to get a Clipper card at Walgreens - can use it for the cable cars ($7 each) and the bus ($2 something). And when you're done with all that fun stuff, you can head back to your glorious hotel lobby for a beverage to rest a bit before heading to Chinatown for dinner - also within walking distance.  Enjoy!
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby - it's fabulous.  The location - it's perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee makers in the room might be nice!
review.locationRemarks: In that area, recommend Bodin one block over for breakfast, and The Grove down a block and around the corner - so yummy. The Asian Art Museum down Mar

review.title: Luxurious hotel which will make you comfortable
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel facilities - Pool, gym, lounge area, bar, shops

Comfortable bed - best I've ever slept on

Large Rooms

Friendly Staff
review.positiveRemarks: Room, facilities, staff, valet parking service, lounge room, bar, shops
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi should be free along with valet parking
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the financial district, walking distance of the shopping mall, Union Sq, bars and restaurants

review.title: Great location, friendly staff, beautiful facility
review.reviewText: Very pleased with our choice to stay at the Palace Hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary.  Very convenient and within walking distance to many destinations near and in the downtown area.  Very friendly staff from the door personnel to the room cleaners.   Awesome experienced at a reasonable price!
review.negativeRemarks: They should include free wifi.  You would think it would come standard with all of the other amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient and close to local transportation.

review.title: Perfect hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is perfect for anyone new to the San Francisco area. The location in Union Square is within walking distance of everything you need and the hotel itself is gorgeous.

Nice location, good customer service, impeccable style.  Nicest hotel we have stayed in during any of our tripswich to SF.  Avoided room service or eating in hotel, pricing seemed extravagant, but they did offer complimentary coffee in the morning.  Used the pool several times which was nice, except very shallow.

review.title: A gem in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Best hotel experience. Staff all very attentive, hope to go back again soon- I felt like I was in a Palace!

review.title: Very comfortable beds
review.reviewText: Beautiful facility.  The common area lounge was magnificent

review.title: Excellent hotel; perfect location

We did lots of walking and took advantage of the hop on hop off bus tours. Alcatraz was great. We ate an awful lot of San Francisco chocolate!! Our favourite restaurant was Joe's Crab Shack. I bought some very funky glasses at SEE.   We could easily have spent a week.We'll be back
review.positiveRemarks: Architecture, mouldings, doors, history, location, the garden room, paint colours, bed and linens, swimming pool

pier 39, the Aquarium, Alcatraz Landing
Union square, Big Bus terminal

review.reviewText: Very convenient location. Friendly hotel staff. Room service was top notch. They've even folded out stuff that was left on the couch.
Overall we were very pleased with the hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very quiet. The hotel is well situated and is close to many restaurants and shops.
review.negativeRemarks: The only problem we had was with the shower - the temperature control was broken.

review.negativeRemarks: Room 773 faced windows of another building.
review.locationRemarks: The San Francisco is a world class city. Take your pick of activities.

review.title: Great view and remodeled room!
review.reviewText:
Our room was very nicely remodeled and had a great view. My only complaints would be we had to ask hotel staff several times for a few items that took 3 hours to deliver. The robe I requested had a huge stain on it and all of the towels and wash rags were so stiff! I would recommend using more fabric softener. The room we stayed in was right off of the elevator and was extremely noisy. We heard every single person coming and going. 

Other than that we had an amazing stay!
One of the best hotels in San Fran worth the price. Pool is wonderful

review.title: Nice Hotel for getaway

TV didn't work in room and had to call maintance to fix. Crying baby next door two nights of stay. Didn't get too much sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The consierge ladies were very helpful to us.
review.negativeRemarks: For a five star hotel, consider having a floor for families with children. we were woken up two nights at 3:30, 4:30, and 6:00 due to a crying baby.
review.locationRemarks: Lots! Take Uber!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall we had a fantastic experience! Get back early if you're walking, there are tons of homeless around openly using drugs. Not the hotels fault, but it can be a little sketchy in the evening. Our room was very clean, a nice beautiful bathroom, and the staff was accommodating to our requests. The downstairs lobby was a great place to grab a dessert and drink. We loved this hotel and will come again!
Beautiful Hotel, Staff very courteous and helpful....great location

review.title: Beautiful hotel, yet very disappointing
review.reviewText: Booked 1 king bed room 2 months in advance; given 2 queens instead. No one ever picked up the phone when calling concierge. Was asked to leave the one & only lobby of hotel bc I bought ice cream from Ghirardelli's, which is attached to hotel side entrance.
We had a great time in San Fran. The hotel started it off right, even better than the photos. Staff was great, room was clean. Would stay again!
Staff good service, agreement, Large indoor space.  Everything was good.
review.negativeRemarks: no
review.locationRemarks: nearby ferry buliding.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: Easily one of the most beautiful hotels in SF. One big problem... Market street. It's so disgusting and dangerous, it  makes it hard to want to stay at this hotel.

review.title: Not maintained as a luxury property...
review.reviewText: From check-in we experienced issues.  The lamp was missing in the room so we had to feel our way around to turn on lights since the wall light wasn't connected to anything.  The TV movie channel didn't work and the TV shut off every 15 minutes and then turned back on at a different channel.  The next morning when we went to take a pass the faucet leaked out a black oil we were told was a result of resetting the hot water.  It was oily so we had to shower since there was black oil everywhere in the tub.  Called the guest services line and was bounced back and forth and waited for 3 times of 10 rings.   The maids left wash clothes only 1 of 4 nights.  Despite multiple calls we never got the TV repaired.  I would never stay at this property again. Or recommend to anyone.  Poorly maintained, under-staffed and poor service response.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: I had never stayed at the Palace Hotel before and really had no idea what to expect.  The hotel was beautiful, the staff was so nice - not pretentious at all - and extremely helpful and responsive to our needs.  Although I was not there with my whole family, I don't think the experience would have been different with children, the staff really makes you feel very very welcome.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, spots to eat are within minutes, bart drops you off in front of the hotel.

review.title: Great stay, wonderful location
review.reviewText: The Palace hotel is wonderful in every way. Close to BART station, the staff are all friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping was impeccable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location!!!  Centrally located between downtown and financial district.
review.negativeRemarks: Better hair dryers in rooms.  I know, petty but it is important particularly when everything else is STELLAR.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby, Ferry Plaza, shopping, fisherman's wharf, the ball park.

review.reviewText: It's so so. We are not very luck. The water is stop that night.

review.title: Window to nowhere..
review.reviewText: We booked a room overlooking market street and after traveling all day to get there we went straight to bed. In the morning i opened the curtains and seen we were looking at a brick wall!? Check in was weird, parked the car no one was there to valet or take the bags. Never going back to this hotel again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, super close to all locations, the concierge was extremely helpful our room was beautiful. The only down side was the room was split by a door and we could hear everything next door. But other then that it was amazing

review.title: Walking distance to all of our destinations
review.reviewText: The hotel location is good for getting around the city, reasonable access to transit. The hotel is beautiful. We had some concerns about things that were not quite right in the room that needed maintenance, not maid service [leaky tub faucet, grumbling not-turnoffable fridge motor]. But overall a good experience, and a beautiful place. The breakfast buffet is one of the best that I've ever enjoyed, they even had a few gluten free muffins. The Garden Room was splendid for relaxing after a long day trekking through the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Elegance and full experience of a top hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: if a guest says the fridge has a bad case of indigestion and gas just swap it out, don't subject the guest to a second night of listening.

review.title: Amazing

center of the city.
above average friendly staff. 
beautiful chandeliers and decoration.
just absolutely a beautiful experience.

review.title: Concierge was very friendly and helpful.
review.reviewText: Of course they rotate, but women concierge we talked to was very friendly, helpful, offered great tips, things to see and do; highlighted maps and tips, breakfast places... GREAT service! Valet guys at the front were great with car service and gas stations routs, directions (they worth extra tips!); Parking a bit pricy ($90); Front Desk on the other hand was almost rude, dismissive and snobby. Our room was clean and comfortable (some after spray on framed picture glass- but I am being picky..); my son loved their shampoo; fridge is very noisy, but has an OFF switch (which is great!);
review.negativeRemarks: front desk stuff needs sensitivity training and attitude adjustment
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq. shopping, great walk to main ferry terminal.

review.title: Not the best
review.reviewText: This hotel is a 5 star and shouldn't be. The room smelled, was very small, not clean and super noisy. We were told we had a view yet the bars on the windows were so high you couldn't look down and the only thing you have a view of was a building. They charge $52 plus 14% tax to park your car overnight! No coffee maker in room so you have to pay the ridiculous price of their coffee. EVERYTHING was outrageous! We went into the Pied Pyper Lounge and had burgers for a whopping $40 per person. I would have expected more hospitality coming from a 5 star. We won't be back!

review.title: Beautiful and exceptional.

Beautiful, clean and very courteous staff. 
They really treat their guests with a lot of attention, making them feel very important. 
Food at the restaurant was delicious. Certainly staying there in my next trip.

review.title: Fancy hotel that nickel and dimes you on everythin
review.reviewText:
Nice room, nice location, nice $60 per night Valet charge (self park option at the hotel not an option), nice $15 per night Wi-Fi charge (I think even Motel 6 offers that for free now)...
Breakfast with your significant other will run you about $90 at the hotel, and if you want a pot of coffe brought to the room (you cannot make your own in the room), well that'll set you back $23 plus tax, plus delivery charge, plus tip...

review.title: Disappointed they imposed $15/day wifi service.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was excellent. The pool and lobby areas are beautiful. Very disappointed they would charge for wifi in your room.
review.negativeRemarks: Include free wifi service for all rooms
review.locationRemarks: union square, BART / Muni access

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText:
The concierge on our second day was not particularly helpful or knowledge. I called guest services from the room and asked if I could get a coffee machine brought to my room, she said no. She informed me that the hotel provided free coffee in the lobby until 10:00 am. I went to the lobby to find the coffee station lacking cups. Six of us standed there waiting for cups for over 10 minutes, after we had been told cups would be on their way. Two of us took the initiative and walked over to the Garden Court to get cups ourselves. 

Later in the day, I asked the lady cleaning our room about the coffee situation. She brought us a Keurig later at no charge. Why guest services didn't provide this service? Other than that, the hotel was fine. I must admit, for the price paid and what I was expecting, the Palace did not deliver.
We stayed here for our first experience in sanfrancisco! Beautiful historic hotel. High ceilings and very comfortable beds! We enjoyed it.

Hotel is very nice, rooms are nice and the front desk folks were great, But don't waste you time going to there hotel bar. Staff was very short tempered with the guests. My girlfriend ordered a drink that was not very good, when I complained to the bar tender he said there was nothing he could do and reused to take it off the bill.
So for the rest of our trip we would go a block away at the Four Seasons for the bar.

Lovely experience, I would recommend this to anyone. We will go back to this hotel for sure.

review.reviewText: The hotel is an old but nicely renovated, with character like the old style stair case.  The pool and sauna are a bit small.  Location is very convenient, the yellow line BART train to the airport is right outside the hotel side door.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient, and beautiful.  Staff are polite.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has lots of shopping, museums, theater, parks, and serves by bus, train including the train to the airport,

review.title: Great hotel, poor service
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, especially for the price and location... but poor service levels are a huge problem here.  I have now had several instances where retrieving the car takes 3X longer than they tell you (like 45min, not 15min)... or simple things like coffee delivery takes 40 minutes, not the 10 they tell you on the phone.  If you arrive between 3-5pm for check-in, you should be prepared to be in a long queue to check in.  The staff is actually really nice and friendly, but they either don't have enough or their processes are bad.

review.title: Amazing Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with amazing common areas (the lobby is stunning), very comfortable rooms and sleep friendly beds.  It is also perfectly located in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Trouble with check in process.  We were told it was due to Expedia and how they booked the reservation.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close to hotel -- bars, restaurants, great public transportation, Union Square & comedy clubs (checkout Cheap Therapy - great comedy).

review.title: Great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Fine.  Comfortable, convenient, courteous, efficient; the ingredients of a fine hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I'm glad they kept the painting, The Pied Piper, in its namesake bar.  I hope the buffoon who tried to sell it is manager of the Lagos Comfort Inn.
review.negativeRemarks: Future remodels should try to celebrate the style of the original, not hide it behind a contemporary facade.
review.locationRemarks: Boulevard Restaurant -- excellent!

review.title: None
review.reviewText: Heater was not working.  No more palace hotel in my life.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff should be more nicer.
review.locationRemarks: None

review.title: Not a true 5-star but a nice hotel
review.reviewText: I treasure my 5-star hotel stays, this was not one of them. Nonetheless, it is a comfortable hotel with a pleasant staff (some more attentive than others). Disappointed that afternoon tea is only served 1 day a week (the advertised "signature tea" is not afternoon tea).
review.positiveRemarks: Mattress and pillows in the guest room were second to none (probably the best thing about the hotel).
review.negativeRemarks: The public restrooms in the lobby were dirty. Restaurants were overpriced given the level of service in most cases.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to Union Square and within walking distance to the pier.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a very nice stay, not excellent or 5 star.  I was surprised that they do not have coffee maker in rooms, except by request, then it was excellent.  They charge $15 per day for internet in rooms and free internet in lobby was not very fast.  Work out facilities are excellent with many machines, shower rooms, apples, and lockers.  Pool is beautiful and excellent for kids as it never gets deeper than 4ft.  Hot tub was out of service on last day of stay, otherwise it was excellent.   Large flat screen tv has plenty of viewing options, but would turn off and on automatically from time to time without warning.   Food in the hotel restaurants is very expensive, but so are most in SF.  There is a Market street entrance to hotel that is only 15 feet from the Montgomery BART station so that is very convenient if you intend to use BART system during stay.  I'd certainly stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: See above

review.title: Beautiful hotel, nice stuff, but facility lacking
review.reviewText:
I chose to stay in Palace hotel because of it's old-style beauty and particularly it's nice indoor pool. I'd love to bring my daughter to swim there. 

Indeed, the hotel is beautiful, every corner is carefully taken care of. The hotel stuff is very friendly. Valet parking is so easy. We settled down very smoothly. Room is relatively small, but bed is comfy, and I appreciate the warmed toilet seat. 

However, the second morning when I came down to the pool, I found the pool water is on the chilly side, warm enough if one wants to do laps, but not really warm enough for one to stay. The jacuzzi has no water in it. This is really friendly for kids. Another family just came out of the pool, and the kid told me the water is freezing. At that point I decided to give up the idea of swimming in the pool. This is a big bummer, especially for my daughter who was looking forward to swimming in the pool.

review.title: No complimentary wifi
review.reviewText: In this day and age, when wifi is free at McDonald's and low end hotels, it amazes me that the Palace Hotel feels it's reasonable to charge anything for wifi, let alone $15/day. Sorry, but that's excessive. On top of that, the tv in my room didn't work properly...it would turn off spontaneously every few minutes.

The hotel and staff were wonderful.  The hotel was beautiful and food was delicious.  The room was spotless.  The only problem was that there was construction going on across the street, which wasn't the hotel's fault, but the construction started at 5:00am on Sunday morning.  My daughter and I awoke to drywall, flooring, and debris being thrown into a large dumpster behind a truck.  Very frustrating, we weren't able to get back to sleep.  We were told that we were upgraded to a room with a view and that sometimes when you have a view there is noise, I didn't ask to be upgraded and would have much rather had a room with no view that was quiet and would have allowed us to sleep in later than 5:00am.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, staff, and cleanness were second to none.
review.negativeRemarks: Informing guests upon check-in that there is a possibility of contrustion going on around the hotel and that we may be awoken by construction noise.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, fine dinning, Fisherman's Wharf, and many other tourist attractions.

review.title: Don't stay anywhere else
review.reviewText:
This is probably our 6th time staying at the palace, and there's a reason we keep coming back.

The rooms have been renovated and they have combined old with new, trendy with classical. The bed and bedding are amazing, we had dinner reservations but didn't want to go out.

We love staying at the palace.

review.title: SF Stay
review.reviewText: Great staff, very helpfull and friendly.  Could do better parking as $60 per day is expensive, but there are other alternatives for parking around the area.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.reviewText: Very charming hotel, very nice staff and one of the best hotel I stay
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless

review.title: comfortable elegance
review.reviewText: I would have liked to have had the choice of a mini bar or coffee and tea which was not offered. For the price it would be expected that wifi was available cost free. These small things can make a difference.
review.negativeRemarks: provision of a mini bar and wifi
review.locationRemarks: I was able to walk to everything with little effort, but if I chose to could access a tram easily.

review.reviewText: Love the staff, excellent service.  I will go back.  soundproofing the rooms would be great.

review.title: Not a five-star hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are small.  Hotel feels like a convention center.  Staff is not anywhere near five-star helpful.  You can do a lot better in San Francisco.

review.title: it was a very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: it was close to everywhere i needed to be. Had a nice bar/restaurant with a very friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: very organized and well lit with a great ambiance

review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel.  I loved the pool and main lobby.  So well kept for how historic the building is.

review.title: Central and convenient
review.reviewText: All was good staff was attentive at directing and suggestion.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in the center of town.
review.reviewText: Elegant hotel reminded me of the Plaza Hotel in New York City.
review.negativeRemarks: The only issue I had is that we did not have TV reception during my five night stay.  Although the staff did try and fix the issue, they had no luck.
review.locationRemarks: We took a trolley to Fisherman's Warf, and a ferry to Sausalito.

review.title: Love The Palace Hotel!
review.reviewText: We had the best stay. Beautiful hotel, great rooms, amazing breakfast, clean gym, nice pool, etc. We loved it and can't wait to go back!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful hotel, great rooms, amazing breakfast, clean gym, nice pool, etc. We loved it and can't wait to go back!

review.title: Elegant and convenient downtown  hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel close to shopping and all downtown amenities.  Courteous and helpful staff.  Recent upgrade is evident.  Very good athletic facilities.  Room (and bathroom) were small, which is increasingly standard for larger cities.  Features of room were good (desk/lights/plugs!)  but a bit odd that there was only closet space with no drawers, which seems like an oversight in a recent renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: room amenities.

review.title: Plush hotel in the middle of it all!
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is located in the middle of the Financial District, close to trendy restaurants, shops, the mall, and transit all within a short walking distance.  The hotel is beautiful. The beds are very comfortable. From the moment we arrived the Staff were very attentive and accommodating. We will definitely stay at The Palace Hotel again!

review.title: Beautiful classic hotel with some issues
review.reviewText: I love grand old hotels and was excited to stay here. The hotel is beautiful - they don't make them like this anymore.  This was rated a 5 star hotel so my expectation were high. Unfortunately I was disappointed with staff and noise. When we pulled in to park the car, the valet was with a car that was taking up the two curb spaces. While we waited 10 minutes for the car to leave, the valet could have just had them pull ahead 10 feet. When we checked in, there were two staff at desk and no customers. We waited almost 5 minutes to be recognized, and then helped. Wjhen we got to our room, which was at very end of very long corridors, the key did not work. Had to go back to desk where they said they had written wrong room number. They fixed it but no apology. As for noise, our 6th floor room during the night was terrible. All night there were people outside shouting and breaking bottles and I was awake much of the night. Maybe if they had better windows the noise would not be a problem.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were well done and comfortable. Nice modern touches without losing the history, old world feel.

review.title: Great Location but room service needs work
review.reviewText: Great location, took forever to get fresh towel. Need to hirer more staff. Valet parking charges are overrated
review.negativeRemarks: more staff, cheaper valet
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Comfortable bed, great location!
review.reviewText: Located right on Market at Montgomery, we took BART from SFO airport, got off at the Montgomery stop and walked up the stairs to the hotel, super convenient. We were in town for a Giants game and were able to easily walk to AT&T Park. The Ferry Building is a short walk away, as well. The staff were friendly and helpful, the beds were comfy and the pool is pretty amazing. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The property is located well, close to shopping and fine dining. The rooms are small and the restaurant choices in the hotel are limited and fair at best.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms ready upon arrival. Sealing of windows in room as it is an old hotel and warping has occured on the wood windows. Add another restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and fine dining.

review.title: Perfectly Peaceful
review.reviewText: The hotel is gorgeous! The staff was pleasant, helpful, and engaging. Our room was beautiful and quiet. We had the best sleep we've had in quite some time. We will definitely stay at The Palace again.

review.title: Very nice hotel and very clean
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip and it was great. The room was very clean and the staff was very helpful. Defiantly a place I will stay again

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
Loved out stay there. Clean rooms and friendly staff. 

Only one issue. The fridge is loud at night and the service crew said there is nothing they can do aside from turning it off.

review.title: nice hotel right in the city
review.reviewText: Traveled from Australia to SanFran to see ACDC in concert. Hotel was right in the business district and we walked to AT&T stadium. Hotel location was close to everything !

review.title: Underwhelmed
review.reviewText: We loved the look of the hotel and the room. We just found the people at the front desk, luggage hold desk, and cleaning staff to be surprisingly below the line for customer service. The room was beautiful but we realized quickly it wasn't cleaned adequately. Bathroom shower was dirty found personal items in the room that were not ours. Lots of complaining at the front desk when we were waiting in line and not stellar staff response.  Again very nice hotel just weak customer service!

review.title: On market street
review.reviewText: Old hotel. Service ok not special. Decor ok. Main floor not very secure from street people.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Spotty service - not consistent. Attention to detail was lacking. Staff could improve in their demeanor.
review.negativeRemarks: Make the guest feel special and that their requests are honored. No follow through on several occasions
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, exploring, Union Square, walking,

review.reviewText:
Really nice loved the view from our room 😁
I would defiantly stay here again

review.title: Pleasant stay at this hotel
review.reviewText: Nothing significant to criticize. nice and opulent interior mainly in common areas. May  be a perfectible insonorisation in the room we had assigned.
review.positiveRemarks: The interior luxury design, location and confort.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Good, pretty much quiet area compared to other hotels we stayed at in the past.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of shopping!!!
review.reviewText: I just stayed at this hotel over the weekend and I was so impressed. It's blocks from a huge mall and walking distance to shoppers paradise. Prada, Louis Vuitton, Goyard, Gucci, etc. I have stayed at really wonderful hotels and this adds up. Its right on the corner of Market St and you are not far far from any major tourist places. If you need a driver ask for Wolly he was very kind and knowledgeable if you want a tour of the city. I would go back in a snap and don't forget to eat there in there beautiful Palace dining room. The buffet was expensive but nice just due to the ambiance. It literally feels you are eating in a Palace.

review.title: What more can I say.
review.reviewText: From check-in to checkout, this hotel and it's staff are outstanding. So much so, we already booked our room here for when we return for the Christmas holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, great employees, a classic hotel. Beautiful.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is just steps away or a readily available Uber or taxi or Muni/Bart. Leave car at home.

review.title: Weekend get away
review.reviewText: Front desk check in is too long. Breakfast buffet is expensive but very good.  Orange juice is fresh squeezed

review.title: Attractive hotel with no soul or customer service
review.reviewText: When my plane was delayed, I called the hotel twice to make sure a suitable room was reserved for me since I had pre-paid.  Two client service people confirmed that they had a great deluxe room reserved and I would be welcomed at the front desk as soon as I arrived.  However that was the beginning of a string of awful service errors.  The front desk person, claimed to not know of my arrival.  She gave me to a tragic room overlooking an air conditioning monster unit and a brick wall.  I then returned to the front desk. She  unfortunately had no room to give me.   She assured me that she was hand-choosing a great room for me and I would be moved first thing in the a.m.  She told me not to unpack my bags. In the a.m. I was dismayed to learn no room was arranged   I spent 2 hours in the morning being told a manager would be calling me back.  No calls came.   Hours later I went to the front desk.   A person named Easton was very helpful and had a suitable room for me, but he seemed unable to get it cleaned for hours.  I was finally moved into the room at 230pm.   A full day had passed.  Easton assured me that he would make it up to me.  I never heard anything from him. There continued to be multiple customer service failures, worst of all a rude manager named Casey who was insulting and distorted anything I said.  The manager Allison was sweet yet powerless to provide any meaningful way to make up for the lost first day.
review.positiveRemarks: The valet and housekeeping staff were very nice and helpful. The interior hotel community areas are gloomy yet elegant.  My second room was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs to focus on customer service as their number one priority vs. their last.
review.locationRemarks: The location is terrific. The rooms have a great design.   None of this makes a hotel work without customer service.  THIS IS EMERGENT FOR THE PALACE.

review.title: Great location with easy access to everything!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stayed at Palace Hotel because it was in the center of great shopping and restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were also very impressed of how clean and comfortable our stayed was. We enjoyed everything and would love to stay at another of their luxury collection hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the staff who were very friendly and always willing to go far and beyond to help you. I also liked the architecture of the building.
review.negativeRemarks: NONE!
review.locationRemarks: The location was superb, easy access to most of the main attractions, such Golden Gate Breach and Pier 39. Loved it!

review.title: Great choice!
review.reviewText: Luxury hotel. Clean, comfortable, great location. Exceeded our expectations.

review.title: Good location but super thin walls.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is walking distance to union square and short driving distance to piers n fishermans wharf.  The only complaint I have is the walls are very thin.  You can hear your neighbors.

review.title: First year anniversary 😀
review.reviewText:
My wife and I had the best time , the staff was great and so helpful . They where down to earth can't say enough about the staff. The palce was incredible,we had a wonderful time in the pool, coffee and tea in the main room relaxing. walking distance to everything. We left with smiles thanks to your staff😀. Thanks again 
Lobos family

review.title: This was a pleasant surprise!
review.reviewText: Fantastic accommodations!  Amazing food and ambience!
review.positiveRemarks: The main sitting area.  Live music was great and very relaxing.
review.negativeRemarks: Suggesting that reservations are recommended for the Sunday Brunch.  Extend the "brunch" segment into the afternoon

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: The accommodations and amenities were first rate with every detail meticulously accounted for. Staff was courteous, knowledgeable, helpful and available yet unobtrusive and the location was central to most areas.  I highly recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor was spectacular, and the pool and gym are a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps there is something, but nothing I can come up with.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and restaurants and access to many areas of interest.

review.title: Decent hotel, paid for a Delux room got a handicap
review.reviewText:
Worse SF hotel
Stay ever , I paid for a regular room and upgraded to a deluxe room, and they put me in the handicapped room which door will open automatically and close automatically which I couldn't control and many other awkward things I made a very uncomfortable for me

review.title: San Fran Lux
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my visit to The Palace Hotel. Very beautiful features throughout the entire hotel. I love the location. Within walking distance to everything you need!

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, nice room, pool is a plus, kind of on the high end of price though

review.title: treatment not the same when you book Expedia
review.reviewText:
This was my girlfriends first trip so wanted it special but Since I booked through Expedia they would not give me my normal gold elite upgrade even though I heard them giving others at the desk when I was there, Shan who checked me in would not do it and Julian the manager later comped our champagne and $100 but would MUCH rather had been treated better instead of "booking through Expedia customers "

Theyput U.S. In the smallest room and it did not even have a dresser and the closet was so small you could only hang very few items. Zero view and you can see directly into others rooms and they yours.

The concierge was worthless except they did arrange car and champagne at a cost but extra details about our trip like excursions and things to do were basically here's a map figure it out yourself. Now I know why concierge will probably go away as the Internet has the answers but it still always nice to have personal service and a local opinion to where to go but they never answered phone and always had to wait for call back. 
Terry at the front desk was willing to get us late check out so he and Malia at the concierge were the only ones who did a good job

review.title: Beautifully remodeled hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay. Very courteous staff, beautiful room.

review.title: Its Nice
review.reviewText: Nothing particularly special about this hotel except the staff goes above and beyond...... It was a nice 20 minute walk to AT&T park and that is why we stayed there.

review.title: Beautiful downtown hotel close to everything!
review.reviewText: Old world elegance in the perfect downtown location within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and the sights

review.title: Elegant, Beautiful, Comfortable, Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Palace Hotel. The entire staff from the bellmen, front desk, concierge & maids were all outstanding, helpful & very friendly. The one exception was the hostess at the Garden Court on Monday morning. One of the reasons we booked the Palace Hotel was to have the brunch on Sunday. When we discovered that the Garden Court was under renovation and would not re-open until Monday we dediced to have breakfast there on Monday. We arrived at about 10:15 & there was one family in front of us. We all waited about 10 minutes until the hostess came to seat us. She seated the group ahead of us and then came back and told us that the restaurant was closed & was no longer serving breakfast so we could come back for lunch or tomorrow. Wow, we all arrived at the same time, waited for her to  seat us & then were told we were too late when she just seated the group in front of us. There was nobody else waiting and my husband & I were dumbfounded. She was quite cold and had no intention of providing anything close to good guest service.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except the Garden Court hostess. The concierge & bellmen were extremely helpful and the front desk very pleasant and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Train the Garden Court hostess to be more consciencious of her guest service.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to public transportation, restaurants, China Town & North Beach.

review.reviewText:
Extremely pricey.
Food there was so so, but $40 for a hamburger that I can get for $10 at a diner and much better.
Our waiting was too lonf and wasn't  offered any discount  or credit.

review.title: Great Hotel !!!!!
review.reviewText: We came in and was immediately impressed with the beauty of the main parts of the hotel. The staff at check in could not have been more helpful. The concierges on all occasions were exceptionally helpful as well. The room that we stayed in had been recently renovated and was truly gorgeous. All in all a really remarkable hotel. I would say it certainly earned its 5 star rating.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This was our first time in San Francisco.  I did my research before booking and was trying to decide whether to stay down by Fisherman's Wharf or in the city.  We ended up choosing the Palace Hotel for our stay and I'm really glad I did.  It's a beautiful hotel, clean, and the staff was really friendly and very helpful.  It's in a really great location, walking distance to Chinatown, the Ferry Market, Coit Tower.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the location of the hotel the best.
review.negativeRemarks: The food, the quality for the amount you pay isn't worth it.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, Coit Tower.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: This is not only a beautiful place to stay, it is centrally located to many great "tour-isty" spots.  The BART system is easily accessible right outside the hotel's door, which was very convenient when we went to an Oakland A's game one night. Chinatown is close by, along with many great restaurants & shops.  It's a bit of a hike to Pier 39, but certainly doable.  Extremely pleased with the accommodations & hope to stay there again someday.

review.title: Helpful staff; extra $$ for bad wifi.
review.reviewText: Convenient location, friendly and helpful staff. Lots of traffic noise throughout the day and night. We could also hear the television and kids in the next room. Wifi was mediocre at best, especially considering we had to pay an extra $30 for 2 days of it.  Pricey parking. Clean, updated rooms.
Great experience. The staff was great and welcome.

review.title: Well situated in the city, close to all.
review.reviewText: Fantastic experience!  Walking distance to just about everything, close to transportation.

review.title: Waste of money- fresh coat of paint not enough
review.reviewText: We made reservations here based on the pictures and the new renovations. Our room was sparse and had only one uncomfortable chair. I had paid for an upgrade but the additional space in the room did not mean anything since there was no furniture to fill it. I went and asked for a change/furniture and was told that there was nothing to be done. That meant the only place to relax was in the bed. In the morning the coffee was cold and I asked the woman at the restaurant for hot coffee and was told that the coffee on the electric burner was only for people in the restaurant. Internet was expensive, parking was expensive and the people working there truly didn't care. Go to another hotel (as a side note, we travel a lot and this is my first review ever).

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText: In addition to being a very nice, clean hotel the customer service was some of the best I've ever experienced. We had our car broken into and suitcase stolen prior to checking in. The front desk sent up a bottle of champagne and some chocolates to say sorry. The bellman were also incredibly kind and helpful. Great place

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText:
I think this hotel has to be the best we've ever stayed in, & we've stayed in hundreds all round the world!!  Everything about the Palace says "opulence" but without losing its friendliness.  We stayed 4 nights (2 adults & 2 children), & the only very tiny criticism is that there is no drawer storage space in the room, so we ended up "living out of suitcases" for the 4 nights.  Also a full- length mirror in the bedroom (& not just in the bathroom) would have been very useful.  Apart from these 2 very minor suggestions, I can not fault the Palace.  I can not comment on the food, as we did not eat there (regrettably our budget wouldn't stretch that far!), but we did use the pool, which was fabulous too! 

Great location- 5 minutes walk to Union Square, so easy for City bus tours, loads of places to eat & shopping close-by too.
 
Many thanks for a wonderful base for our San Francisco visit.
review.negativeRemarks: See above re. drawer space & mirror
review.locationRemarks: Good central Downtown location.  Plenty of places to eat (we mostly used the food court in the Westfield Centre) & good for shopping.

review.title: Hated to leave
review.reviewText: The hotel has been lovingly renovated. Our stay was comfortable and hope to return soon.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very expensive valet parking at 59.00 per day NOT happy !!

The room is too small and there is not even a single drawer inside the room where you can place your clothes. The location is superb as it's located right on the BART line and is centrally located in the CBD, however, there is no view. Most of the hotel staff are excellent from face to face handling to telephone answering manners are very good. The concierge is one of the best in town in my view and there are mostly well trained and are extremely enthusiastic. The breakfast buffet tend to be ordinary and the breakfast venue, despite beautifully renovated, tend to be a bit crowded.
lovely quiet room in a great location. Spectacular public spaces
review.negativeRemarks: check in line a bit long

review.reviewText: Enjoyed my experience at the newly renovated Palace. I like the new design of the renovation and the customer service was really accommodating. Didn't get a chance to have tea at the beautiful foyer though, will have to try that next time.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Amazing, amazing, amazing. Right when you walk in, you feel like you're in a whole new world. Beautifully designed and decorated and very clean. Hotel staff very accommodating and friendly. Overall great experience, will return

review.title: A dream come true in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel was an extravagant and luxurious experience.  It exceeded all my expectations in convenience (2 blocks from Moscone Center), comfort, great service, beautiful pool and elegant rooms.  The lobby and garden room are breath taking.  My girls loved swimming in the pool in the early morning, as it took a few days to adjust to the time difference on the West Coast.  We all loved a late night hot fudge sundae at the Ghiradelli Chocolate shop located on site. Parking was included in our room rate, so it made keeping our car very convenient. Everyone at the Palace Hotel took customer service seriously, from the doorman, valet and concierge. Coffee and high quality hot tea in the lobby was also a nice treat each morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Great service, convenience, comfortable rooms, free parking, beautiful pool.
review.negativeRemarks: I honestly can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby Moscone Center, short walk to cable car stop, short walk to Ferry Building with farmer's market, shops, etc.  Buena Vista Gardens.

review.title: Beautiful Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Great stay.  Staff was extremely helpful and the Palace is a wonderful property.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff, the rooms and the architecture of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Only one gripe that was there was noise from running water sometimes coming through the vent.

review.reviewText:
The room was a little smaller than I anticipated and the "courtyard" view room looked down on a roof covered with gravel.  Bathroom sink & tub weren't cleaned thoroughly as there were hairs in both.
Otherwise, the hotel was fine.  Beautiful indoor courtyard, very friendly staff and great location.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: We were allowed to check-in very early. We were also allowed to use the pool and locker room after we checked out to go to a Giants game. The Concierge arranged for reservations at three very good restaurants. The bell guys took good care of our bags while we were at the game and dinner before we had to catch our flight home.
review.negativeRemarks: I would get an interior room next time. It was a little noisy.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the ferry building for a picnic and to the game at AT&T Park. Close to shopping, the financial district, and pretty close to the water.

review.reviewText: Very stately old building, nice room, decent amenities. It took hours for a delivery to arrive that I had told them had arrived hours earlier.

review.title: great for business or vacation
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very close to shops, Trolly terminal, embarcadero area, and walking distance to china town/Italian district. Hotel staff are great (good tips on food from concierge) and the hotel is very nice. When I stayed there was refurbishment going on (lots of drilling in reception), but that's nearly done. No hint of it from my room. I've stayed here may times and this is the first time there's been work going on.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and general feel of the place.
review.locationRemarks: It's central for everything. An ideal location, unless you want to stay down at fisherman's wharf. You can walk or trolly there easily.

review.title: Opulent setting and excellent friendly, service
review.reviewText:
We knew the San Francisco Palace Hotel was beautiful from its website and from the reviewers' comments online. But even the photos on its website don't do the hotel justice.
In reality, the Palace was much more grand, enchanting and old world than we had expected. 
We were thrilled with the ambience, the location, and the service!

The staff were particularly friendly, professional, and helpful.
They were always courteous and went out of their way to offer assistance.
