This we noticed as soon as we got out of the shuttle … greeted by the doormen, then the bellhops, the front desk staff, the concierge on evening duty … and even the chamber maids who spoke to us despite being busy with their rooms. The servers in the Pied Piper and the Garden Court were also excellent and attentive.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent service, rich history and beautiful furnishings and ambience
review.negativeRemarks: Website photos do not do the hotel justice
review.locationRemarks: French Quarter, Union Square, Shopping, Cable Car, excellent restaurants, Chinatown, Farmers Market, access to transportation to all parts of the city

review.title: Perfect hotel In the heart of financial district.
review.reviewText:
I was happy with the accommodations. However as a Expedia perks member I didn't get any upgrades or ability to add the room stay on my SPG profile. 

They are undergoing renovations.

review.title: Classic and very centrally located
review.reviewText: The Pied Piper bar is great.  good energy and fun.  We have been coming to stay at the Palace for almost 20 years.  It has never failed.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was newly renovated, classic decor and very friendly help
review.negativeRemarks: Need more power plugs in the room.  Need a mirror outside the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Its SF, if anything there is too much

review.title: Great staff!
review.reviewText: Every staff in each area was courteous & professional.  There was some minor inconvenience due to renovation but my experience with all staff more than made up for it!
Absolutely stunning hotel with history.   Recommend highly to anyone staying in San Fran.

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of the city!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is an amazing experience by its self. Historically fascinating and every room has a beautiful view of San Francisco. A absolute must see is the bar in the hotel, it has a old school feeling and is very charming atmosphere.

review.title: Beautiful, but costly!
review.reviewText:
I had to order room service one evening because the restaurant was full.  I ordered a bowl of onion soup, one appetizer and an $8 glass of wine.....$52!!!!  
Other than that shock, the hotel and staff were very nice.  Will probably not stay there again, because I feel I get better value for my dollar with my Hilton's.
review.locationRemarks: It is right downtown SF, so you are close to everything.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel in an excellent downtown location. The hotel has a great nostalgic vibe of the early days in San Francisco. Quality of the rooms is good, very nice beds. Service was excellent and staff was very attentive. Easy to walk to lots of shopping, restaurants, and emberkadero. Only downside of Market Street is all the homeless people that are literally sleeping everywhere, which gives the area a trashy image. Not much the hotel can do about this, but you deal with it every time to step out in the streets.

review.title: Historical and  luxurious
review.reviewText: When you walk through the doors into the Palace you feel like you've stepped back into the Gilded Age. Although the original Palace burned down after the 1906 earthquake and this one dates to 1909, it still has the feel of a grand hotel from the 1800s. The ambiance is balanced by the fact that the hotel is completely modern. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms are well laid out with accessible tubs. The Garden Court is spectacular. They've managed to balance keeping the hotel up-to-date without compromising the historical feel of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Up to date with a wonderful sense of history.
review.negativeRemarks: Better highlighting of the history
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is on Market Street close to transit (Muni) with easy access to all the tourist hot spots: North Beach, Chinatown, Nob Hill, Castro, etc.

review.title: Fancy ladies night!
review.reviewText: My sister and I booked the room to celebrate our mom's 60th bday.  We had an evening of fun booked in the city... not only was this hotel's location perfect for downtown affairs, but it was sooo beautiful!  We drank champagne in the beautiful room and were greeted with lovely hotel staff every step of the way.  A definite winner!

review.title: Some Disappointments
review.reviewText: I have stayed in this hotel previously and had a great experience.  However, on this visit our room was in a different part of the hotel with very small, fairly unadorned rooms.  We could hear every noise made by the neighbors, including the screaming kids several rooms away.  I'm sorry, but it did not make for a pleasant experience.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the shower was great.
review.negativeRemarks: An option to make coffee in the room.

review.title: Amazing....
review.reviewText: I loved staying at this hotel. The ceilings are beautiful!!!! I was amazed at the grandness of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in the rooms and hallways.

review.title: great christmas getaway
review.reviewText: From the moment the bellman met us to the moment we checked out the staff fulfilled our every request.  They were courteous and very accommodating. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas and put us in a very festive mood.
review.positiveRemarks: The gingerbread house was a culinary marvel.  It was just amazing. I've never quite seen any so elaborate.  Thanks to the pastry chef who created it.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Within walking distance to all of downtown.  Just a few minutes walk to Union Square, the Embarcadero, Westfield Mall, and more.

review.title: The amazing Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel (particularly at Christmas ) is just stunning. My few complaints are 1) if Best Western, Travelodge can offer free WiFi, and their room rates are half what the Palace Hotel is, why do they charge $29 PER DAY for in-room internet WiFi?? 2) again with the aforementioned places, why does the Palace Hotel not offer coffee in morning to its guests???
review.negativeRemarks: See above. And more eating options

review.title: Family Christmas Vacation.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel but the rooms do need some updating.  Their was paint peeling from the ceiling in the entrance to the room.  The front desk did acknowledge that they did plan to do renovation in the near future.  However, I would stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the lobby and the main restaurant are very beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Room updating.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located on Market Street adjacent to Union Square and a short trolley ride to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Christmas in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
Amazing hotel, great location with easy access to the vintage trollies and BART. Beautiful dinning room, great food.

Met my 3 beautiful daughters there for our Christmas celebration.

review.title: Hotel Elegance
review.reviewText:
The hotel is lovely and unique due to its history. Would not change anything. We do not need anymore modern hotels. 
Convenient taking the Bart to the hotel. Close to Union Square and 101 Embarcadero. 
Staff was very curteous and helpful as where and what to do. Recommended very good restaurants. 
Would definitely come back
Do not change its personality.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect and the hotel is really beautiful
Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  Went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect.

review.title: Grand hotel but stinky rooms!
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful, grand hotel centrally located to many San Fran hot spots.  The main lobby is gorgeous with its atrium and architectural detail.  The staff was courteous and friendly.  I had read previous reviews mentioning that the rooms had a certain odor, but I decided to chance a stay at the Palace anyway.  Upon checking in, I was provided with a room on the 4th floor and was immediately taken back by the odor in the room.  It smelled like a chain smoker had just left the room.  The internal phone system also seemed to be inoperable, as calls to the front desk, guest services, etc. requesting a room change were met with a busy signal. After schlepping my bags back down to the lobby, I was provided with a new room on the 8th floor.  This room was better but also had an unpleasant odor.  I couldn't tell if the carpets needed replaced or if the odor was HVAC-related.  The hotel is so fabulous overall, it's a shame that room odor is still an issue.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful architectural details in the common areas of the hotel.  Ghirardelli shop on the corner of the hotel was wonderful!
review.negativeRemarks: Phone system needs fixing or upgrading and room odor needs to be remedied.
review.locationRemarks: The location is within short walking distance to Union Square, China Town, many corporations and reputable restaurants.

review.title: Nice Hotel on Market Street.
review.reviewText: Very nice upscale Hotel on Market street. The hotel staff didn't inform us on check in of the pool being under construction. There was no signs outside the pool indicating anything was wrong. Another guest informed us about the pool not being open.. We booked the hotel because of the pool. The room was excellent and clean and staff was good except for information on pool. I would stay here again. Just ask more questions when booking.
review.negativeRemarks: Communication of Staff to guests about the amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Location had a nice affordable restaurant just up the street on the same side that served breakfast and lunch.

review.title: I love this hotel but I really missed the pool.
review.reviewText: If I had known the pool was closed I would have stayed sonewhere else. This was by far my worst experience at this hotel due to a fire alarm when I was trying to nap (just unlucky) and an unfortunate situation at breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel, but major issues with pool area.
review.reviewText: Got a great rate on a room here and decided to surprise my fiance with a "staycation" here and brunch in their world famous "Garden Court" the next morning.  Checkin went flawlessly, and our room was large and comfortable with an amazing king size bed!  We headed up to the pool area for a dip and we were completly shocked to find that their were MANY guests drinking out of glass beer bottles and glass cups as well as toting glass liqour bottles. I have no issue with the drinking, but everybody knows you don't bring glass in a pool area, and it was even posted on the rules. After swimming for about 15 minutes we heard an inevitable shattering sound of a glass breaking and the guests made no attempt to clean it up or alert staff and just kept partying.  I was completely disgusted, went back to my room and called the front desk to alert them of the issue.  They said they would promptly take care of it and thanked me for calling. 2 hours later we went back up to use the pool facilities again to find the broken glass still there, as well as multiple empty glass bottles strewn around the area.  Disgusted we went back to our room changed for dinner and headed down to talk to the manager. She apologized profusely and explained they were in transition of a staff switch over but admitted that was no excuse. She sent us up some champagne and gave us late check out, but this doesn't fix the amount of neglect on their part and unsafe conditions they left the pool in for hours.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This is my third time in San Francisco and my 2nd in this hotel. It's really nice!

review.title: Giants World Series 2014 Victory Parade!
review.reviewText: I've had this Hotel on my list if historic hotels to stay. What better time to do it than watching the 2014 World Series San Francisco Gians victory parade. Had front row view from the comfort of my luxurious room. Although I wished I was on the lower level floor. My fault, was too excited to think straight.

review.title: Elegant older hotel
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for a family wedding and stayed at the Palace during the weekend that the SF Giants were playing in the World Series.  Our booking was last minute and the room rate was extremely high.  The room was tiny and instead of a closet, had only a small wardrobe that was not adequate to hold our clothes and shoes.  Don't think I've ever stayed in a hotel room that didn't have a closet.  The bathroom had sufficient electrical outlets but the only outlets available in the sleeping area were lodged up under the desk and you had to crawl underneath on your hands and knees to get to them.  The connection between the shower head and water pipe appeared to be stripped and the shower head just hung there loosely and could not be adjusted.  I understand the laws of supply and demand but paying the price we had to pay for this room was unacceptable and just morally wrong.  We had two additional rooms that were reserved earlier (with better pricing) for other members of the wedding party and their rooms were nicer and more in line with the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Modernization of facilities, more electrical outlets conveniently located, larger bathroom counters and modern fixtures.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is downtown San Francisco so there is an abundance of restaurants and shopping nearby.

review.title: Great hotel, the best in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. good food, nice personal. very close to the airport, nice bar and friendly people.
review.negativeRemarks: like the floor #4 better than #3
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants, shops, historical places

review.title: 5 star with 2 star amenities
review.reviewText:
First time in San Fran, did not get enough up to the minute info in the room re: hotel & local amenities. No mini bar, huge disappointment, concierge said mini bar only available in suites, so made to feel like I was staying in second class room!  Went to the bar for a cocktail, staff where to busy to be welcoming! Had the signature cocktail, terrible. 
Enjoyed the breakfast buffet, had to have coffee cup, plate etc.. replaced because of lipstick stains & hair!
Delicious blintzes & poached eggs, potatoes not nice, pecan sticky buns great.
Asked for a car to my next hotel, door man told driver I was going to the airport and took a tip. 
Would have appreciated the concierge offering me an up grade to a suite, regardless of price instead of suggesting I go to the local "corner store" for any amenities I might need.  First night, coming from the other side of the planet, tired and in a strange city?  No thank you, very disappointed by the hotel reputed to be the best in town. 
Went to hotel W for my next few days in town, incredible, loved it. Going to New York in January, hope they have a hotel W! 
Sincerely, L McCullough.

review.title: Most luxurious stay in SF
review.reviewText: Great room. Most comfortable bed, quiet room. Staff was very friendly and Pied Piper(bar) legendary.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Wish we would have gotten a bigger tub but it was the last King bed room so we settled. Only got one bath robe too. Other than that hotel was amazing all around. Very clean and enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: Dinning area was amazing. They had live music. Acomodated us so we could arrive at 1am. Nice people
review.negativeRemarks: More bath robes. Bigger tub would have been nice.

review.reviewText: Very friendly, comfortable and convenient! We truly enjoy our stay every time!!

review.title: Nice hotel close to  Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a top notch hotel  very clean , staff are very friendly and polite. We will definitely stay here next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: The Valet Stole a pair of sunglasses from my car
review.reviewText: don't valet your car - my sunglasses were stolen. they only have to drive it across the street but that is enough to lift articles from your car. the reason we valet is to avoid this sport of thing

review.title: It was amazing!
review.reviewText: Kids loved the pool, I love the gym!!! It was walking distance to town square and shopping center. Very nice and helpful staff.
Great hotel and service ! Will be back. Awesome location !

review.title: Beautifully Appointed and Close to Everything
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel and is walking distance to many sights and attractions.  It is close to the public transportation, so if you are sight seeing, you will have no trouble getting around. The hotel itself is gorgeous with stunning architecture and details.  The rooms are nicely appointed with very comfortable beds and pillows.  The hotel staff is exemplary, from the moment you check in at the front desk to the concierge to the bell men, to the housekeeping staff.  They go out of their way to make sure your stay is wonderful!  I want to give a special shout out to Rueben who checked us in upon our arrival.  He asked if we were celebrating anything for our trip, and I told him we were celebrating my daughter's birthday. It was our mother-daughter weekend away!  When we returned to our room that evening, after a day of sight seeing, Rueben had sent up a lovely bottle of chilled champagne, cheese, crackers, fruit and chocolate covered strawberries!  He also left a Happy Birthday message on the phone for my daughter.  It is this hospitality and attention to detail that make staying at the Palace so unique and special.  There are many hotels in the City of San Francisco, and I have stayed at many as our company has an office in the City and I have to travel there frequently.  But, in my opinion, none compares to the Palace.  You will really enjoy your stay and we will be back!  Customer service can be lacking in some establishments, but not at the Palace!
review.positiveRemarks: HOSPITALITY, Beautiful hotel with class, soft beds, customer service was off the charts, beautiful architecture, the STAFF and their attention to deta
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Farmers Market and the Embarcadero are walking distance.  You can also walk to Little Italy for an awesome Italian meal.  BART and buses are right the

review.title: convenient location and beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: easy to find through the crazy traffic in downtown San Francisco.  attentive staff took care of us efficiently.  very convenient location - close to public transportation and shopping.  very safe area.
review.positiveRemarks: room was lovely and beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Tradional hotel, modern amenities, near transporta
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel, fabulous Garden Court, lovely swimming pool, lots of rich history
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wi-Fi in the room.  Why do expensive hotels charge for wi-fi, and motels never do??
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from BART and muni, close to shopping and good restaurants, Embarcadero

review.title: Brilliant hotel. Great staff. Great location.
review.reviewText: Fantastic stay in San Francisco at the Palace. Lovely staff, the most comfortable beds in the world, fantastic location. Thoroughly recommend.

review.title: Classic hotel from 1875
review.reviewText: Right in the heart of the financial district, within walking distance to Fisherman's wharf and right next to a BART station. Had the highest ceilings I have ever seen in a hotel! We were very happy with this hotel.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Comfortable bed. Nice gym. Excellent location. Okay price.

review.title: City Luxury
review.reviewText: This was a one night stay that I thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel is a good walking distance to city sights and activities.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and service were excellent. The ambience in the dining room is just lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Tea making facilities in the room. Complimentary coffee is available downstairs at breakfast time for guests.

review.title: Disgraceful service to call it luxury collection
review.reviewText:
Queue to check in at reception - inspite of empty counters at reception
Housekeeping had not cleaned the room which was allocated to us
Had to wait to get an alternate room
Terrible Front office staff
review.positiveRemarks: Has history to the building, but starwood is making a mess of it obviously
review.negativeRemarks: Service
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.reviewText: Excellent! on every aspect..from check in until we left. Great location and the staff was top notch! would stay again next time in SF!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, terrible front desk
review.reviewText: We had had a long flight and were excited to stay at a nice hotel.  When we arrived the service at the front desk was terrible.  He had extreme attitude and was not helpful.  He had made an error and refused to fix it.  The hotel is beautiful and the other staff we encountered were amazing.  Nice clean room.
review.negativeRemarks: Costumer  service
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great shopping, Can walk to Pier in about 15 min.

review.title: Great Value for the Money
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Palace for 2 nights when in SFO for a business trip.   Happened to be the same week as my birthday and the woman at reception noticed this giving me a free room upgrade and a free drink in the bar.  Nice touch.   Staff was incredibly helpful and friendly throughout my stay.  The hotel is older but has been nicely remodeled.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable.  I liked that I could open the windows and get fresh air.  Lobby bar (Pied Piper)
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint was the in-room Wi-Fi.  Needed to pay for this and then when I did, it barely worked.  Ended up sitting in the lobby to do email.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART when you're coming from SFO.  Tons of good bars and restaurants within a few blocks

review.title: The Palace "ROCKS"
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was great.  Paul was the AWESOMEST!  He really made our trip so much fun.  We always had to stop and look for him.  Very helpful with a delightful personality.  I truly think the Palace is the best place to stay in SF when you're on vacation.  Close to everything you want to see - most of it walking distance which saved on the pocket expenses and a way to see more of your beautiful city.  Thanks for making our trip so memorable and hope to see guys again.  Best Wishes and continued success.  Jodi
review.negativeRemarks: Free coffee and donuts
review.locationRemarks: Great location - walking distance to most of the things to see

review.title: Gorgeous Hotel
review.reviewText: Love every moment of my staying. Enjoyed the garden court, pool, jacuzzi.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, easy walk to Union Square, China Town.
review.locationRemarks:
Walked to R&G Lounge on Kearny, great chinese food. Walked to Union Square, had tea at Macy's Tout Sweet.
Walked to China town for breakfast.

review.title: Weekend away
review.reviewText:
Overall we'd a lovely time in the hotel but I've had better value for money elsewhere.

Pro's - Location is fantastic. We came in on the BART from the Airport and it was really easy to get to. It's also really easy to make your way to many parts of the city as it's so central. The hotel building itself has a lovely reception/ open area when you arrive. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms likewise.

Con's - The walls between the room are quite thin and each morning I woke up with either the noise of people talking when walking by or from the room next door. We got the towncar at (8:30pm and no traffic), our journey was less than a mile and it was $20 which we both thought was expensive, though the door man advised us afterwards this was standard. The room itself was not the largest room I've stayed in but it was fine for what we needed, though the pillows were superhigh and definitely higher and more uncomfortable than anything I've come across in a hotel before. 

We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as other reviews had turned us off, however, the room did look beautiful.

Overall, it was fine for the 3 nights we were there, we both agreed we wouldn't be staying there on our next visit though as we felt there are better hotels available for the money we paid.

review.title: Nice hotel & stay, but check-in issue
review.reviewText:
Very beautiful hotel in nice location, and overall a nice stay. However, had an issue with front desk clerk not allowing the other adult occupant to check-in until I showed up with my ID, which forced the family to be sitting in the lobby for an hour because I had to drop them off. I specifically put that request in the reservation with the other person's name. The front desk would not allow her to check in until I got there, despite even showing a hard copy of the Expedia confirmation. The clerk told her it must not have come across on the reservation and he could not use the hard copy. When I got there and spoke to a different clerk, I was told it was in the reservation. 

So I don't know if it is an issue with Expedia reservations, or if it is an incompetent front desk clerk...probably a poor clerk, since when I asked him what kind of view the room had, he told me it was a view of the "courtyard", which turned out to be a roof with some gravel and a vent several stories below, with windows of other rooms across the "courtyard" just a few yards away. I'd consider going again if I got a really good rate (as I did this time), but I'd look elsewhere first.

review.title: Birthday stay
review.reviewText: I have not had better service at any hotel stay, anywhere .

review.title: Beautiful historic hoteli
review.reviewText: I like very much the old welll preserved hotels. L'atmosphère de luxe et d'abondance, du temps où l'élégance, la beauté et la classe comptaient.

Beautiful hotel for a great rate approximately 3 blocks walking distance from Union Square. I didn't realize valet parking was $59/day. I took a cab to Fisherman's Wharf which was $40 round trip.  So it really depends on what you would like to do most.  I could have stayed at Sheridan Fisherman"s Wharf, parked across the street and walked a couple of blocks to The Wharf for what it spent staying at Palace Hotel.

review.title: Good experience.
review.reviewText: Concierge was excellent regarding delayed baggage issue.

review.title: Nice to be back
review.reviewText: We were married at The Palace over 12 years ago. They have always been a first class operation and they did not disappoint this time. We wanted a quick 4th of July getaway and chose to stay at The Palace as a little treat. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do (Broadway show "Once", SF Zoo, fireworks, Children's Creativity Museum, Opera at the Ballpark, hike at Land's End). Service was great. Hotel is still beautiful. Only complaint is the price of overnight parking ($60/night).
review.negativeRemarks: Price of overnight parking
review.locationRemarks: FiDi, SOMA, Ferry Building, Yerba Buena, Metreon, MOMA, AT&T Park

review.title: beautiful hotel, great location
review.reviewText: the hotel has a BART station right at the corner. Union square it's 3 blocks away. Wonderful restaurants in the hotel and 5 blocks away the best vegan restaurant "millennium. Beautiful, clean rooms

review.title: 4th in San Fran
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a three-day 4th of July weekend at the Palace in San Francisco. Wish we were still there!
review.locationRemarks: Good location, across the street from Bart, walking distance to Union Square

review.title: The perfect hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Perfect location and always the perfect experience!  We love this hotel for many reasons.  The staff is very helpful and treat you amazing!  The beauty is exceptional, it's like walking back in time.  Breakfast was excellent and loved our waiter.  Can't wait to return.  Five star all the way

review.title: Great location, beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The location is perfect, with easy access to a variety of places, depending on your interest. The hotel itself is beautiful and very pleasant.

review.title: Great, well appointed hotel for our Anniversary.
review.reviewText:
The Palace is one of San Francisco's finest and oldest, all refurbished.  People take tours here just to see the splendor from the gilded age.  Even if you're just walking by. stop to see the spectacular and huge Garden Court Dining area, all leaded glass and chandeliers.  Also see the famous Maxfield Parrish very large painting of the Pied Piper hanging over the bar in the Maxfield room.  Paula loves the Market Gimlet cocktail here.
  A breakfast for six in the Garden Court at $36 for the grand buffet cost more than our room.  We thought it well worth it for the splurge.
  Walking distance to Union Square shopping, the Moscone and Yerba Buena Centers, SFMOMA, and a BART station at the doors.
  We came for our Anniversary on July 4th, and had a delightful time.  We got an early check in and because we're on the Starwood Hotel list we were offered a check out as late as 4pm.  
  Everyone in the hotel made us feel like royalty.  We stayed here about 5 yrs ago, but everything is spiffed up and seems grander.  No coffee maker in the room, but very good free coffee in the lobby.
  Our inner room was large with great bed, nice bath and very quiet.

review.title: Lovely, historic property.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a busy holiday weekend here. Our room was quiet and very comfortable. Good location for touring the city. Can't wait to go back!!!

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: Nothing special about this hotel. Location was good.
I was thrilled to be able to stay at such a nice hotel at such a great rate.  Beautiful architecture, friendly staff, can't say enough....

review.title: Comfort, Quiet, Beautiful, Convenience
review.reviewText: The hotel is an amazing experience from arrival to departure. The architecture alone is stunning. We had a room on the 4th floor (same level as the pool/fitness area) so that was really nice. Be sure to enjoy complimentary gourmet coffee and tea in the gorgeous Garden Room each morning (until 10am). The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room (bed and pillows) were extremely comfortable. Aside from a few late night revelers in the hall late Sat. nite early morning 2-3 am it was very quiet. Convenience-shopping, eating places, Target/Starbucks, St. Francis church all within easy walking distance. Ghirradelli ice cream shop is on the first level of the hotel for a treat! Montgomery Station is literally right out the front door...so hopping on the BART or Muni lines are a breeze!  Wonderful stay! Would definitely go back again!
review.negativeRemarks: Hot tub is very small and not in the best working order.
review.locationRemarks: A good quick, organic meal at Super Duper (grassfed beef burgers and organic veggie burgers) wonderful garlic fries.

review.title: Excellent hotel right down town
review.reviewText:
Beautiful accommodations
Extraordinary Grand ballroom
Hotel staff exceptional
Would highly recommend
great location. beautiful old world charm. comfortable beds. very accommodating and attentive staff.

This is our third stay at the Palace Hotel, I would not go anywhere else. My only "complaint" is that the bathroom was too small... really though should that make or break a hotel experience? No... And we love the Pied Piper Bar...and the hotel is located in a goo space near the public transportation...

review.title: Beautiful Hotel.
review.reviewText: Last minute trip to San Francisco and found this hotel on Expedia. Beautiful hotel. Great location. Rooms very comfortable with the exception of the pillows, they were huge and uncomfortable. Wi-Fi was available in room for $ 8.00 per hour and valet parking cost is $ 59 a night. A must when you visit is to have a drink in Pied Piper bar, very cool mural. Facility is beautiful, the entrance had a beautiful bouquet of roses, must have been a gross of roses. Absolutely gorgeous.

review.title: overnight stay
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel was wonderful. Very relaxing. Hotel staff were very attentive.
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to shopping, dining and Embarcadero
review.negativeRemarks: include breakfast
review.locationRemarks: within walking distance to the Embarcadero and ATT park.

review.title: Lovely old Hotel
review.reviewText:
It really is a very lovely place, and my only gripe is the lack of electrical outlets near the beds.... in this day and age, we need easily 4 outlets per bed, and easy access so we don't have to move the beds or furniture to get at them.
Other than this the lack of ice machines in the halls was a bit disappointing but the hotel is otherwise really lovely....
review.negativeRemarks: parking rates are ridiculous.. $48 for just one overnight? and electrical outlets need to be more accessible and more plentiful near the beds

review.title: Great location, great hotel.
review.reviewText: Hard to find anything to fault at all with this hotel. Fantastically well located and very impressive architecture, plus very good staff.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Beautiful building but disappointing overall. When I arrived the front desk didn't listen to a word I said and was not pleasant at all. The room was nice, but for the amount of money they charge I would've expected much nicer. I could hear everything in the hallway. 

Wifi was $15 for a day... I paid sooooo much for the room and I can't believe they charge that much for WiFi. 

Never staying there again. SF has many chic hotels that a much better and offer better service.

review.title: Beautiful hotel,great location. Great indoor pool.
review.reviewText:
Our std double room on 2nd was a good size for 2 adults & 2 children 10 and under.
High ceiling made room feel larger. Bathroom was a little small but adequate. Beds were comfortable. Children loved the indoor heated pool. Was very quiet at night. Valet parking was pricey but worth it. Great central location.
Didn't eat at the hotel restaurants as there was plenty of choices nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Re-tile the bathrooms, make sure the complimentary coffee pots are filled especially in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance (not in heels) to Ferry Building, Union Square.

review.reviewText: I love staying at the Palace. It's always fantastic.

review.title: Lovely staff.
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel with lovely staff at front of hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Gratefully received a late checkout however received knocks on the door on three separate occasions to confirm we were departing prior to agreed time.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Very nice big room with great service and atmosphere.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very nice usual high prices for food and drinks though. Unfortunately no coffee making facilities in the room and the room lacked information on the hotel amenities; evidently this information was on the in room TV. Room had safe and a fridge.

Superior rooms were fairly small for the cost and the room we were first given faced a wall!, but reception changed the room for us to a non wall view room.

Hotel is very conveniently place right by the Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) service (Montgomery Street station). We used the BART from the airport. Just under $18 return trip per person and takes about 30 minutes.

The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Union Square and the same to the Powell Street Cable car turnaround. (tip: walk up two blocks up Powell Street from the turn around to beat the crowds and get on the car quicker). Both Routes from here go to Fisherman’s Warf. $6 p/p single trip.

Did not find many family restaurants near the hotel but there was a very good food court in the Westfield shopping center (lower level) just down the road by Powel Street.

All in all a good hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee making facilities in the room
review.locationRemarks: Near to Union Square and the cable car stop at Powell Street.

review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in great location. They need softer pillows in the rooms as the pillows in the rooms are plump and rock hard, but when we called the front desk, it was no problem and they brought different pillows up to the room. Overall, very satisfying.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows in the room need to be softer. Also, the mini-refrigerator was loud and kept turning on and off and prevented sleeping for awhile.

review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is very exceptional with staff who provide great customer service. The junior suite was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Last but not least, location was accomidating for shopping and dining. Overall my experience was comforting and would definately recommend this property to family an friends.

review.title: Super loud vent and paper thin walls
review.reviewText: The vent was making super loud noises all night and the people in the room next to use where so loud. The walls are paper thin u can hear everything . Also the floors in the bathroom had hair on them. We paid a lot for this room I wish the hotel offered something for our inconvenience .

review.title: Close to downtown and public transportation
review.reviewText: Pleasant. Had time to enjoy myself in and out of room. Checkout time is flexible alps which made the stay even more enjoyable. Would highly recommend.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown. The hotel has a concierge devoted to helping with places to go, things to do and places to eat.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a great city to walk. This beautiful charming historic hotel is ideally situated in the centre of the city close to shopping and major attractions.

review.title: Wonderful my second stay at hotel
review.reviewText: Very close to transportation and shopping. Accommodations were excellent. Staff very helpful and efficient. Would definately stay again. But would like to book through hotel.

review.title: Grand Belle Epoch Hotel, tastefully restored
review.reviewText:
Grand lobby and Palm Court. Very comfortable rooms. Great Montgomery and Market St location...easy to walk to shopping and restaurants.

Wished the check in desk was better staffed, though the desk staff are very professional and pleasant.

Great last minute rate on Expedia.

review.title: Excellent location, very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Nice indoor pool and sauna. The hotel staff greeted us with chocolates at check in. The lobby is beautiful.

review.title: Noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in!
review.reviewText: Room was clean and staff was ok but it was the worst night sleep I have ever had. Got in at midnight for a work trip and was placed on 2nd floor Market St. I was awaken at 5am by a jack hammer pounding through the room for a few hours. After that stopped, housekeeping banged their vacuums up against the walls and slammed the garbage cans in the hall at 8am. Worst night sleep ever in a hotel.

review.title: Very nice . Parking is an issue in the area.
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, good location and friendly staff.
Parking is an issue in all San Francisco .

review.title: Brilliant for business or pleasure
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this hotel for both business and pleasure. It's a great location on Market, but close enough to walk (or run) down to the Embarcado, China town and Union Sq. Valet parking was convenient and quite, but there's plenty close self park options with in/out privs. if you prefer.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotels looks great and the beds are really comfy. It's got a huge dining room, filled with light, that's much better than working in your room.
review.locationRemarks: Check out Roy's @ 575 Missions St. and Tropisueno @75 Yesrba Buena Ln.

review.title: Not a Hotel...A museum with a real history
review.reviewText: The most beautiful place I have ever been. Could stay in the garden court from morning till night. Friday nights are great at the pipers bar..Wonderful birthday
review.positiveRemarks: Museum and a real feel of SF history
review.locationRemarks: YOUR IN THE MIDDLE OF THE CITY

review.title: Great Location. Bart stop right in front
review.reviewText: Room could of been cleaner when they came to clean everyday. Had to ask them to re vacuum

review.title: Horrible Expirience
review.reviewText: Unfortunately I expected a phone call from a supervisor in charge on the morning shift that I never got. I couldn't get there on time because of an accident and neither the staff from Expedia or from the Hotel fulfilled his promise to call me and fix the problem after several calls that I did in advance. I don't think I ever book again with Expedia or The Hotel

review.title: Great part of the SF
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is a grand old hotel that has been perfectly maintained. The location is perfect, in the middle of everything, the Ferry Building, Union Square, Cable Cars, Financial district, China Town, etc. Staff is incredible friendly and rooms have those great old tall ceilings. We just love this place
review.negativeRemarks: Wish they are a true Porte cochere to make unloading and loading easier, but the staff does what then can.

review.title: A satisfied repeat customer!
review.reviewText: The Palace has always been a favorite of mine whenever I visit San Francisco. The location is unequalled, the staff are very helpful and the ambiance is rarely matched in its grandeur.
review.negativeRemarks: You may want to assign a roving security guard on that long corridor by the lobby outside the Palm Court.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location and staff very accommodating
Great suggestions from concierge

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel would have been better especially for families traveling with children if it had more restaurants or food options inside the hotel.

review.title: False Fire Alarms, Twice!
review.reviewText: There was a false fire alarm on the first night I checked in, around 1am. The alarm noise was enormous, and all guests came down covering their ears. Fire engines came, only to tell us it was the false alarm. On the next morning around 9am, there was another false alarm to wake everyone up. It was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Chinese New Year Parade blocked every corner of the city, disabling us to enter the hotel. We had to stay out and wait for more than 5 hrs.

review.title: Decent hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Decent location. Room service food was terrible - bland and cold. Person taking order could not answer questions about the food and gave attitude. Pillows were brick hard and too large. Asked for replacements and they accommodated. Fire alarm went off on the second night at 2 a.m. and into the next morning. They kept feeling the need to announce updates over the PA system after the alarms were shut off. Most staff was nice. They really push all the Westwood point and membership when you check in. Pretty lame when all you want to do is check in. Hotel was generally okay but nothing spectacular.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel but needs a bit of maintenance...
review.reviewText: The hotel had a great staff, nice rooms, and is clean. However, during the middle of the night the fire alarm went on and we had to stand in the middle of the street until the all clear was given by the SF fire department chief. Then, early in the morning the alarm went off again. There was some problem in the basement which was setting off the alarm - maybe a problem with the gas or electrical system. I view this sort of problem as serious!! Fires in large hotels can be deadly. I strongly recommend the hotel invest the money to upgraded the utilities so they are absolutely fire safe!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff and a beautiful building.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade the utilities.
review.locationRemarks: Right near the financial district and Moscone center.

review.title: That fire alarm though
review.reviewText: I mean. The fire alarm was falsely triggered twice...at night.

review.title: Wonderful Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife tells me she is now spoiled. Great location.

review.title: close to Moscone
review.reviewText: they need to train the front desk staff, room service food was not edible

review.title: Great "pop-up" Weekend - 1 night stay for 8 People
review.reviewText:
Service and accomodations were exceptional. We attended the "Tea" which even the guys enjoyed. After the Cirque de Soleil show (which they arranged the limo) we had a wonderful late night meal in the grill/bar. We said our good byes at the "over the top" Sunday buffett-can only be described as unbelievable and exceptional.

Everything went smoothly because the staff was exceptional. They made many of the arrangements and everything went smoothly.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel rooms were 5 Star. We all wanted to take the bedding home with us. The decor was absolutely luxurious and opulent.

review.title: Took six kids!
review.reviewText: Celebrated a sweet 16. Everyone enjoyed the stay and the staff was excellent.

review.title: Great deal for comfortable hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: Proffesional staff

review.title: Getaway in the City
review.reviewText: We came here on vacation. Our room was compact (2 doubles for a family of 4), but the beds and bedding were comfortable, and the room was reasonably quiet. The tall ceilings and massively thick doors probably help. There was plenty of room in the pool, the spa was always crowded since it's capacity was 4, plus - there was a large sauna to warm up in. The dining room was the best part - beautiful surroundings and great food and service. We would have loved to eaten every meal there, but it was too costly. If you drink tea, the Saturday Tea is a must! It was accompanied by live piano. Great for special occasions.
review.positiveRemarks: Indoor pool/spa & sauna, proximity to public transportation, historical building, beautiful dining room, tea service, great food.
review.negativeRemarks: There were some spots on the carpet, and a hair in the shower soap holder.
review.locationRemarks: Public transportation was literally outside the door; central location to everything in the city. We walked to the Children's Creativity Museum.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText:
Close to trains, tour buses and more
Super staff

review.title: Class through and through!
review.reviewText: Not cheap but worth it!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful bar and lobby, attentive staff.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: excellent location
review.negativeRemarks: tv worked but no local channels, called to have it fixed and it never was
review.locationRemarks: no need for a car, centrally located with excellent transit systems. just about everything you could ask for nearby

review.title: Vintage Hotel, Good Location
review.reviewText: We just stayed overnight at The Palace the night before Thanksgiving for a night on the town. Have always loved this hotel for its vintage, classy feel and it never disappoints. The rooms are smallish, but very comfortable. The shower felt great! Loved that there is a Ghirardelli cafe on the premises, but didn't get to dine on property. The location is great because it's near Union Square but not right on Union Square (less noise). Overall, we would recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in San Francisco and experience part of the history of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, really.
review.locationRemarks: Great location right on Market Street straddling the Financial District and Union Square areas. Lots of sightseeing, theaters and shopping nearby.

review.title: It is just an average hotel.
review.reviewText: The building is at lease 100 year old, but my room looks clean and comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was so expensive, and breakfast cost me $35 for each person.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, financial location.

review.title: Spectacular hotel let down by bad service
review.reviewText: This hotel has so much going for it: its history, its architecture, its location, and its first-class reputation, - but the service was really dreadful. We were given the wrong bill to sign at breakfast on two days running, my friend's steak in the Pied Piper Room was quite inedible, (although it was deducted from the bill after we complained.) There were no robes in our room and no coffee machines. Several times when we approached a member of staff with a question, they skilfully avoided us and walked away. We were late arriving at the airport on our day of departure due to very slow service at breakfast in the Garden Court, and having to wait an unreasonable length of time when checking out. (There was only one attendant at the desk.) We were so looking forward to our stay at this impressive hotel, but it turned out to be a major disappointment.

review.title: Incredible rooms and great history
review.reviewText: We stayed on a Friday night. The building is incredible...rooms and staff were great. Had breakfast at the hotel...expensive but delicious! We took the free tour at 1000 that went through the history of the hotel...we learned a lot and found it very interesting. Overall an incredible stay!

review.title: Quatation marks are missing around LUXURY
review.reviewText:
checking in on Satrday for one night, suite
4 pm - line at the reception - 30 minutes, 3 receptionists at 2 speeds "slow" and extra "slow".
4.30 pm - welcome, but your room is not clean, please go walk around the city - we will call you.
5.15 pm - welcome, but the room is still not clean, instead, we will give you different room, please accept something (we asked to book us a dinner for 5 tonight, as we had buisiness meeting. Manager promised to do so.
5.30 pm - the room... wich part of the word LUXURY contains stains on carpret, cracked and spotted marble, dust on lamps, patched whole on wallpaper? LUXURY MOTEL - is much proper name for this place.
5.45 pm - calling housekeepng wondering about i-pod docking station - not availible. aked how to get - well, it's only for suites, ... but we are staing in a suite - well, if it's not there - it's not there and you will not have it.
7.00 pm - went down to check where is our dinner will be - no Metr'd at the front, restaurant does not take reservations, first come firts serve basis
7.10 pm dealing with the consierge service, trying to get any reservation - checked over 8 places - nothing, finally got Omni hotel steakhouse.
8.00 pm so tired, decided to give it a shot and stayed for dinner at Luxury Palace
8.30 pm everybody at the restaurant is busy with their own thing - nobody cares about customers
Menue is a bit better than at Sizzler's, wine list - Trader Joe's on sale, food is cold, 3rd quality, total bill 400
review.positiveRemarks: Christmas tree at the main hall (which is, in fact, closed for dinner)
review.negativeRemarks: management and, perhabs, all staff needs to read definition of word "hospitality" daily
review.locationRemarks: location is perfect

review.title: Freezing bathroom!
review.reviewText:
The Palace is a beautiful hotel with a great staff. But they need to retrofit their windows, which are ancient and very, very drafty. I stayed there on a cold December night and my bathroom windows were leaky (despite some ineffective inner "storm" windows), so I closed the bathroom door at night. Of course when I went to use the bathroom in the morning it was very cold - 50s? - and unpleasant.

Come on, Palace, for the sake of your guests' comfort and for energy savings, please retrofit!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful facility, great staff, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: See "experience" above.

review.title: Great location, great hotel
review.reviewText: the only bad thing about the room was the noise from the hallway. every time someone would shut a door loudly, we could hear it quite loudly. we could also hear any talking, tray clinking, etc. quite audibly, which was strange. other than that the room was very comfortable- great king size bed with comfortable bedding, great blackout drapes, amazing shower head/pressure/temp, hotel cleaniness was excellent, and hotel staff was very helpful. the best part obviously was the great location to market street in SF. just a short walk from great shopping and the heart of SF. we loved walking to union & shopping @ westfield. we parked in the Hearst Garage on 3rd & Stevenson, which was cheaper than the hotel and only a short walk around the corner ($26 per 24 hours versus $50-60 per night for the hotel i believe). our stay was great and I love San Fran!!
review.negativeRemarks: somehow making the room's doors soundproof for hallway noise.
review.locationRemarks: market street, union center, ice skating, westfield mall

review.title: The Palace!
review.reviewText: The Palace is a gorgeous hotel. The rooms are small, but the ceilings are high, giving the impression of a larger more spacious room. The bathroom was clean, water pressure was abundant and the shower was roomy. It has such an Old San Francisco feel, but clean and updated at the same time. The lobby is very crowded and I was under the impression that we would be able to spend some time hanging out in the lounge area by their huge beautiful Christmas tree, but apparently that is just for private events. Also, the wifi and parking were pretty expensive, but thats to be expected in San Francisco. Overall, the staff was great and we had an awesome stay!

review.title: Great hotel. Close to everything in downtown.
review.reviewText: We had so much fun staying at out hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel with traditional look
review.reviewText: Lovely, comfortable, crispy white linen beds. Our double standart room wasn't big or very fancy but the hotel decor all over makes up for it. We were there on Saturday night after thanksgiving. Christmas tree appeared overnight in the restaurant on Sunday morning. My boys (10 and 7) loved exploring. They went up and down the stairs 20 times and loved looking up in the ceiling.

review.title: Wonderful Thanksgiving Weekend
review.positiveRemarks: The Palance is a beautiful historic hotel with an outstanding friendly staff. This was my 3rd stay in 5 months.
review.locationRemarks: It's in walking distance to excellent dining, shopping and the Ferry Building.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Confirmed my opinion that there are very few first class hotels in San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are very dated, don't even have a mini bar

review.title: Renovation
review.reviewText: The hotel needs a renovation both in the bedroom as well as the common area. Very poor help at entrance and bad valet parking service.
review.locationRemarks: Location is very convenient for downtown Sf shopping

review.title: Lovely, ornate luxury hotel
review.reviewText: Staff overall very good. A level above the service you get at an ordinary hotel. I like the old luxury hotel vibe that it has, the ballroom is a sight to see!
review.negativeRemarks: Minor: carpet needs replaced, plaster corners need patched (room 245?). Staff member who refreshes free coffee needs lesson in manners/service, rude.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF, great location, plenty to do!

review.title: An OK hotel but the soundproofing could be better
review.reviewText:
We got this hotel on special but would have been very disappointed with it if we paid the listed rack rate.
This hotel is centrally located and beautifully presented but there were a few downsides. On check in there was no one to take our bags and our room was quite a hike from the lifts (which was a bit of a problem when lugging bags and a 5 month old baby). There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms (something which I would definitely expect in a hotel of this quality). The concierge said that there was a complimentary tea and coffee station downstairs but that it only operated in the morning. To order tea and coffee from room service would have been exorbitantly expensive. Finally, the sound proofing between the rooms is not brilliant. We had a group of people next door to us who stayed up talking till 2am, which we could hear quite clearly (in return I'm sure that they didn't appreciate our baby crying at 5am).
On the plus side, the crib we requested was in the room on our arrival and they did not charge us extra for it.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee and tea making facilities in the room would be a big improvement. The staff could be more attentive.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is centrally located in what appeared to be a good area.

review.title: Nice hotel that captures the SF Art Deco past
Great location mixed with Old World style
review.reviewText: This beautiful hotel was a perfect place to stay and enjoy our first San Francisco visit. The staff was very accommodating. The pool was larger than most, with a skylight view to enjoy while floating. I would definitely recommend The Palace to friends and family.

review.title: Excellent hotel centrally located to downtown.
review.reviewText: Everyone from the parking valet to the front desk to the concierge to the hotel operator were so pleasant and helpful it was wonderful. I normally spend 200 plus nights a year in hotels and I was very impressed. I will be back!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Excellent hotel in the middle of the town.
review.reviewText: Great hotel - walk able to most of the business destinations in the city.

review.title: Gorgeous historic hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for a business event and loved the historic building. Rooms were on the smaller side but very comfortable and did not feel cramped. Bed amazing! The only negative would be that the wifi in rooms is definitely flakey at times - and expensive if you need - as I did - to purchase the deluxe connection simply to do a webex call.

The overall building is so lovely, it's a treat to be here and breakfast in the Garden Court, while pricey, is just such a lovely way to start the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic building and super comfy beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Great amenities, super location, very helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: hotel interior (including rooms) could probably benefit from a coat of paint and maybe some new carpets
review.locationRemarks: Union square, Fisherman's Wharf, easy access to all attractions with public transport

review.title: Ok but nothing special for the money.
review.reviewText: Old hotel, modest sized rooms for the money. Doesn't even include wifi or have a coffee maker in the room. For the price they charge that is absolutely unacceptable. Full price means full service as a minimum.
review.negativeRemarks: Include wifi!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Beautiful, grand hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel felt like a trip back in time- beautiful and grand. Everything was in good condition, the only drawback is that the room was pretty small.

review.title: mediocre. location is good.
review.reviewText: too old. pillow is too high. Unlike others, there is no other choice. I had a bad neck pain the next day.

review.title: A dissapointment
review.reviewText: I booked the superior deluxe room because the website said it was larger than the standard deluxe. I saw both rooms, very little difference between the two. Definitely not work the extra charge. When we entered into the drab room, (and I mean drab) the was a red basketball size stain on the carpet, right in the middle of the room. I couldnt believe it! I called the front desk and requested a room change which they granted. The second room was a bit better. Better lighting but same drab walls. Although there was no noticable stains on the carbet, the carpet was dirty. The lobby is nice but the rooms are no better than a Motel 6. The gym is very small and severely lacking in equipment. There was only one worn out and dirty workout mat for the entire gym. One last thing, we went down for breakfast at 10:15 only to be told they stop serving breakfast at 10:00. DEFINITELY NOT worth the money.

review.title: Large, roomy hotel in great location
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Palace Hotel. It is large and roomy, the room was very comfortable and quiet, and it is in a great location in downtown San Francisco. I didn't have much interaction with the staff, but those with whom I did interact were very courteous. I did not eat in any of the hotel's restaurants or order room service, so I can't comment on the food. There is a BART stop right in front of its side entrance. The area teems with people (there are many museums and a lot of shopping nearby). I was in other parts of town at night, but still close, and there are countless great restaurants and a lot of enjoyable nightlife in the vicinity. Will definitely stay there again in the future.

review.title: Great hotel and staff!
review.reviewText: Hotel was walking distance to many attractions and was super clean. The staff was friendly and really helpful. I will be back for sure!

review.title: Love. Love. Love.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and it never ceases to disappoint. It's clean, beautiful, and in a good location of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The room is spacious, clean, and love the character of the details.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing this hotel is perfect the way it is.

review.title: Great place to stay in the centre of things
review.reviewText: Such a great experience staying at this hotel. It is a beautiful, gracious, refined place - stunning architecture and classical music playing make it like a little oasis in the noise and bustle of downtown. The staff went out of their way to be extra helpful and I'm pretty sure it wasn't only because my leg was in a cast! We had dinner in the lounge and breakfast in the domed dining room - both meals were superb and pretty good value for money, considering the class of hotel. The room was tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. Altogether a wonderful stay and I would love to go back.

review.title: good location, great staff, beautiful structure
review.reviewText: hotel staff was very nice throughout. room was very clean. bed was the most comfortable bed i've ever experienced in any hotel! wish there was another restaurant that would be a bit more casual.

review.title: Historic hotel close to union square and shopping!
review.reviewText: Lobby is gorgeous and historic. Staff is top of the line! Expensive dining and charge for Internet. Convenient to Union Square and all the great shopping. Also next to financial district and short walk to Ferry building and Moscone center. So great location!! Beds and linens very comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: Dining prices, charge for Internet and rooms should be spotless for price paid.
review.locationRemarks: Next to financial center. Walking distance to union square, shopping, ferry building, Moscone center and Trolleys!

review.title: Great sophisticated hotel in an ideal location
review.reviewText: The rooms were spacious and luxurious. Overall I was pleased with the price and quality of the hotel entirely.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking!!! & coffee on Sunday morning, nice touch
review.negativeRemarks: hot tub was a little too hot
review.locationRemarks: so many options of places to grab a bite to eat.

review.title: Great service, excellent location
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect, great location, service, super clean. The black spot, no parking. If you rent a car, be prepared to pay 25 dlls in a parking lot behind the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Classic, stylish, elegant and discreet.
review.reviewText:
Great comfort, good staff for SF. Location great for tourists, Business folks even locals! hotel Market St entrance is less than 10' from one of the Montgomery BART and Muni subway entrance. The now very upcoming piers on the waterfront via F line trams are easy in under 20 mins, Castro is under 10 mins on Muni, SFO or Walnut Creek are each only 35 mins on BART all literally door to door.

Not a party palace and would give the bars a wide berth. Local area can seem a bit grim at night but not dangerous and where isn't in downtown USA these days with nearly a million homeless folks...

Would return at the right price.

review.title: Helpful Staff, Excellent Downtown Location
review.reviewText:
The Palace is conveniently located on New Montgomery and Market St. Upon our early arrival around 10 am, we were lucky enough to have two rooms ready for us. We were upgraded to the deluxe rooms as those were the only rooms available at the time of our check-in; however, it was on the third floor even though we requested a high floor. Nonetheless we were pleased with the complimentary upgrade.

One of our rooms consistently had a faulty lock that took 2 days and multiple trips to the front desk to fix. Even the engineering staff fixing the lock was frustrated. However, the staff at the front desk along with the engineering staff were very helpful and friendly. We were offered another room but we had friends in the neighboring room so we didn't want to move. After all the trouble, we were compensated with free wifi.

Rooms were decently clean, even for my standards as I am very picky with hotel cleanliness. The beds were very comfortable in my opinion, the most comfortable of any hotel I've stayed at.

Overall, we were very satisfied with our experience at the Palace. The staff there was friendly and helpful; although we could have been a lot more demanding for compensation for the troubles we went through, we were satisfied with the way the staff handled everything.

review.title: Don't miss a stay at this hotel
review.reviewText: What a fine example of a 1920s hotel the architecture is simple but ultra elegant well designed well taken care of. This place should be on everyone's bucket list. All of the staff get a thumbs up as well.The location is good you walk to union square or the finical district in minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: This is one of the finest old hotel I have ever stayed at

review.title: Disappointed!
review.reviewText: After long flight across the country my room was disappointing......yet, hotel staff was quick in making corrections. Unfortunately, a room change was necessary. The several problems with the room could have been handle by proper observation by housekeeping staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Peter Piper Lounge.Main dining room was BEAUTIFUL!!! but.......too expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: HOUSEKEEPING
review.locationRemarks: Location is near perfect

review.title: Long weekend getaway
review.reviewText: There was a group of 4 of us who wanted to get away for the Labour Day long weekend and San Francisco was the destination. The hotel was in close proximity to union square, China town, malls and the wharf. We had a great weekend of sightseeing and we also had high tea at the hotel which was delicious.
review.negativeRemarks: It would have been quite convenient to have an airport shuttle available.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of amenities and things to see around the hotel area including a Ghiradelli chocolate and ice cream shop right in the hotel.

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: After check out, hotel provided a room for those late flight travelers to take a shower.

review.title: Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Palace. The charm of the hotel really made this a destination stay. The rooms are straightforward with no frills but quite comfortable and I love the high ceilings. You can occasionally hear your neighbor which would be my only critique. The staff were very friendly and the hotel overall was quite generous in offering extras as part of our birthday celebration.

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the San Francisco Palace for 3 nights and we loved it. The common areas are wonderful, the staff is very helpful and the hotel is beautiful and close to many main attractions. We loved it and totally recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is very beautiful, clean, and is very well situated.
review.negativeRemarks: I think it is great as it is. Some rooms may need an update in the near future.
review.locationRemarks: Very well situated, in Market, close to Chinatown, the Embarcadero and Union Square. Just perfect!

review.title: first time at the Palace
review.reviewText: I've always wanted to stay at this great institution. The staff was great. The room was a little small and no view. But got a fantastic deal so I can't complain. The location is wonderful. So central to everything. you can catch the F-line, or Bart right outside your door. Walking is a great option. The addition of Giradelli's is a huge plus. Ice cream every night.

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: I wouldn't have wanted to stay at a better hotel. This place is amazing. Staff is friendly and concierge is very helpful and knowledgeable. The architecture and the history of the hotel is amazing. I am definitely coming again and staying at the Palace Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, beautiful architecture of the hotel and cleanness.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in the heart of the Financial District. It is within walking distance from all the shopping areas.

review.title: lots of history
review.reviewText: loved it... lot's of history too... pied piper bar is cool...

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. It is close to a number of attractions in the downtown area in which you can either walk to (if you are in good physical shape) or catch public transportation close by. There is a major BART/Muni bus terminal station right outside the hotel on Market street. There are also street buses and trolley buses that are constantly operating in the area to serve your needs as well. The hotel is very well maintained and the hotel staff and concierge are very friendly and helpful. They answered all my questions regarding location of activities and the best transportation means for getting to these locations. The rooms were clean and very well maintained. If there is one drawback, it's that the walls are very thin and noise can be a problem if you have noisy neighbors. My experience was that once people realized that noise carried relatively easily next door, they made it a point to be more quiet. But all in all, I was very satisfied with my hotel experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, convenience, cleanliness and hotel staff/concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing immediately comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, City Hall, China Town are within walking distance. A major BART/Muni Bus terminal station is located right outside the hotel.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Room -- Small Rooms, Poor Amenities, No View.
Requested House-Keeping to bring dinner plates and it took them 50+ minuted.

review.title: Top notch place!!
review.reviewText:
One if the classiest places in SF for over 100 years! Impeccably decorated and maintained.
Staff were all a pleasure to deal with. Great place to stay!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Close to all the shopping downtown.

review.title: Luxury hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed in Palace hotel years ago. Throughout the years, it has maintained the high standard which distinguishes it from the peers.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed. Welcoming decoration. Garden court. Central location.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the heart of SF financial district.

review.title: Nice location and beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: A quick trip for a game. Hotel is very nice and I got free parking, which was a plus!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything and the Bart station is right outside the door

review.title: I do not recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has very bad customer service; the internet, lobby resturant, and front desk trying to rip me off with car rental.....

review.title: Good location, disapointing as a luxus hotel
review.reviewText: Good location downton SF, but room were not cleaned properly, breakfast expensive and disapointing, WIFI not complimentary. Minibar empty.
review.negativeRemarks: To me - a general upgrade if it should be considered as a luxurious hotel. Also cleaning of the room and include WIFI in the price.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things. Explore SF - downtown, the Wharf and also the regions 10 min. away in cab, i.e. the Mission and the Haights.

review.title: The Palace
review.reviewText: The Palace was a lovely hotel that has been maintained and kept the details from the past. The entry is absolutely breathtaking when you come into the garden room. You can get a tour of the hotel, hear about its past and eat in the famous dining hall area. I loved that the concierge were all so helpful. Chinatsu, one of the concierge, was always helping with a smile and always remembered my name. They were great. It was nice to have a pool at the hotel for the kids to play.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge's were amazing. Chinatsu helped us locate Alcatraz tickets which we could not find. They were all friendly, helpful and knowledgeable!
review.locationRemarks: I loved the location of the hotel, right by all transportation, and in the middle of shopping. I also loved that ghiradelli is right outside your door

review.title: Excellent hotel great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, staff excellent and very accommodating. Wonderful location only a few blocks from union square. Easy access to cable cars down to fishemans wharf. The only cons are parking pricey but ours was included in our package would recommend this, difficult to reach front desk and pool closed at 10p. Overall stay was excellent with excellent service. We checked in and our room was facing a wall requested another room with no issue, done.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were spacious. Beautiful architecture. Traveled with my husband and teenager.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool, spa open later like the gym, past 10p. Wireless Internet included.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants and theaters all within walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Might have expected more for the price, but overall a nice hotel and a great location. Only complaint is that the walls are so thin, you can hear everything going on in the room next door.

review.title: Excellent location, great service
review.reviewText: Historical hotel with the feel of old San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, centrally located, excellent concierge!

review.title: Poor experience at the Palace
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with my family and we were all disappointed. Since it is such a top hotel, we had top expectations but the property did not live up to the hype. Our room, which was on the second floor, had stained carpets, scratched furniture and was sparsely appointed. It was as though the room did not fit with the rest of the hotel. Also, I was annoyed by the internet pricing philosophy, which requires a rather high daily charge for basic access. This results in many guests camping out in the lobby and common areas taking advantage of the free internet in those areas. Management needs to rethink this since the extra few dollars they gather dwarfs the ill will generated by the guests (such as myself) that feel nickeled and dimed to death by this place and the poor atmosphere created by disgruntled internet nomads in the lobby. Finally, the breakfast room is beautiful, but the food quality is poor. Overall, try another hotel....this just isn't worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing for internet, quality of food, cleanliness and decor of rooms.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel! Thank you for letting us keep the room a bit longer. Super location to everything that we did. Would definitely stay with you again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the fact that Bart is right there
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Bart and Muni, AT&T park, lots of great restaurants

review.title: elegant
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely, the service was great. But I wish they provided coffee pots and coffee in each room rather than having a self-serve coffee area in the lobby. And for the price of the rooms they should include internet service. I mean, if your paying hundreds of dollars a night, why not just charge a few bucks more and include that service. I don't like being nickle-and-dimed, especially not at high rated hotels.

review.title: Great stay with kids -
review.reviewText:
The Palace is a big busy hotel with a very helpful staff from bell captains to excellent concierge. Rooms are not super elaborate
but big and nice for sharing with kids. Beds are very comfortable. Only drawback is that hotel does not really have a sitting area in the lobby. Also gym showers were a bit DIRTY. Hotel location is excellent with easy access to Bart, cable cars and bus to the warf.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, very nice staff, comfy bed
review.negativeRemarks: Poor internet even in the lobby. No comfortable lounging area in the lobby is a big drawback. Not a very cozy environment. Gym shower dirty
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Run down "palace" needs update ....
review.reviewText: Spent one night at The Palace.... could be a beautiful hotel, but badly in need of updating. Carpets in room are nasty, furniture and lamps needing replacing.... I am a seasoned traveler and notice these things, so some may not be as picky. When we checked in we were given the room right next to the fitness center ! Asked to be moved to a quieter room and we were accommodated .If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location, then this is it, but not a 4 star hotel... more of a 3 star.
review.negativeRemarks: In room carpets are filthy and in need of cleaning, bathroom could have been cleaner, lamps and furniture in need of update.

review.title: Pretty historic hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is very pretty. Some areas are starting to show wear and need to be replaced, for example the sofas in the concierge area. Rooms are on the small side which is okay, overall furnishings not impressive. Bed was comfortable and sheets were clean. Pool area is nice bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi should be free. Charging for Wifi is a thing of the past. Paint chipping, furniture in rooms nothing special.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, easy walking distance to Moscone Center and China Town.

review.title: Great location, staff
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful property with a very historic quality. The location is great and the staff were outstanding. We'd definitely give this hotel our money again for all the reasons mentioned. The only negative to our stay was the exorbitant rates to get internet access in our room. Charge me another $15 a night for my room, but don't charge for internet in 2013 when there are five Starbucks within 100 yards of your property.
