review.title: There are better options out there!
review.reviewText:
Buffet food was horrible and excessively overpriced. Hotel offered perks and discounts to AAA members yet did not disclose that you had to book at the time you were requesting to have the offer redeemed. Hotel refused to provide the service of free parking to AAA members and was not willing to make any accommodations. Hotel views were terrible. Hotel staff did not make any recommendations to visitors or offer maps. There was car service available to guests to and from hotel or airport or surrounding areas. Concierge was not friendly and displayed a sense of being bothered. There was no hot water, microwave or ice and water available to guests.
I do not mind incurring the expense; but the services provided and quality need to be well worth it!
review.positiveRemarks: How luxurious the main lobby looked.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco. Close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very professional. The rooms were large and clean. Breakfast was delicious in an amazing ballroom. The hotel is close to Bart and everything else needed downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel is beautiful and the beds were incredibly comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel, Comfy and Clean Beds and Bath
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. And the location is great, especially if you're thinking of using public transportation. Every train we took had a stop right outside the doors. The room was really clean. Bathroom was very clean. Free bottled water in your room. A mini-fridge without mini-bar junk in it. We loved this. We bought some soda and put our waters in there. Rooms have really high ceilings making the room feel bigger. The decorations are odd and random but I don't really care about that stuff. Beds were really comfortable. Slept great. My son loved the swimming pool. It was refreshing. I didn't have much interaction with the staff to be honest. They were there when I needed them. I would stay here again without a second thought. Convenient, clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: -Plug ins are not convenient but it's an old hotel so that's to be expected -Have another concierge there in the morning
review.locationRemarks: -All public transit lines are located steps from the hotel so it's easy to get anywhere in the city!

review.title: Good location, nice bathroom and facilities.
review.reviewText: If the room within the tea/coffee maker would be PERFECT. Personally I like this hotel and its convenience. But the night I stayed happened to meet the neighbors fighting and shouting at 2:54AM which was extremely noisy and uncomfortable. I called the front desk twice and the security came finally. If the hotel may react quickly would be nicer. This case also express the wall is thin and you may easy to hear your neighbors behaviors. After all, it's an old fashioned hotel. Over all, I'm happy to stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean and nice location. Concierge was super!!! The lady was always smile and supported lots of useful information. Valuable staff!
review.negativeRemarks: In room tea/coffee maker.
review.locationRemarks: Take a walk to the bay area...windy but always make people cheerful!

review.title: Right in the action
review.reviewText: Old building but fairly well kept. Unbeatable location.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful building in the heart of Union Square. We felt Safe,Secure,and comfortable. The Staff really understands and delivers on excellent customer service.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel is charming, ornate,very clean and beds were very comfortable. Staff is friendly,attentive and seem genuinely happy. Morning coffee was good.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location,we had a city pass and used the Trolly,Cable cars to go everywhere. Public transit stops are just outside building,very convenient.

review.title: Excellent Hotel in San Francisco Financial Distric
review.reviewText: Nice spot to hang your hat in San Francisco's financial district. Rooms are small but everything is perfect as far as amenities here. $60/day parking is the only thing that hit us hard. Take BART and leave your car so you can spend the money on a nice dinner out.
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking and Internet for price charged would even out the price difference vs. a more modern hotel in the area.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping and close to Civic Center.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: The staff are great. The building/room just needs a few upgrades.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom tub was slightly clogged
review.locationRemarks: The location seemed central to all tourist areas.

review.title: The Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace was a beautiful hotel with a nice and helpful staff. My gf and I only stayed for one night but it was pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The interior is very clean and distinguished.
review.negativeRemarks: The closet of the room could've been slightly larger but that's just nitpicking.
review.locationRemarks: It is in downtown SF right across from the Montgomery BART station. It is between Union Square and the Embarcadero (Ferry Building) off Market St.

review.title: Classic elegance
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is a San Francisco icon located in the heart of downtown. To say it is beautiful is an understatement. It rivals the Waldrof-Astoria in New York. Dining in the Palace Court Retaurant is a dream but reservations are a must. This hotel is very satisfying.
review.negativeRemarks: Return the classic Maxfield Parrish painting to the bar.
review.locationRemarks: There are several parking structures within 1 to 2 blocks if you don't want to use the hotel's valet parking.

review.title: This is a luxury hotel...good location.
review.reviewText: I have stayed here before & always been pleased. Our room was very clean...the staff at check in was very professional & friendly. You are right on Market street so the location is good....a short walk to Union Square....Macy's, etc. Bart station is close by. Our bed was very comfortable...slept very well. Our room was on the small size, but fine for us. Not much of a view....just rooftops. It was a hot weekend in SF, we turned the air on low in the room & were very comfortable. My only issue is that the hotels charge for wifi in the room...The Palace is not the only hotel to do this....we did not use the wifi so for us it didn't cost us anything. But I am surprised in a city like SF, that there is a charge. NIce that there is an alternative parking rather than the hotel valet. We used the parking garage right across the street for a little less than the valet. Was very easy access. We did't eat or visit the bar on this trip, so can't review food . I have eaten in the dinning room before...Sunday brunch....was very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Location....hotel is beautiful....every one is friendly and helpful. Room was clean...comfortable bed. Rooms are quiet...check in was easy.
review.negativeRemarks: the wifi charge that all the hotels are charging is silly in a city like SF
review.locationRemarks: short walk to union square....the bart station is close by....

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall the room amenities were great! Mini Frig convenient. Room walls are thin. Heard every word of person in the next room.

review.title: Loved the hotel.
review.reviewText: We arrived at Dubrovnik late in the evening, on a rainy night, and were apprehensive about where we would be staying. However, the Kazbek Hotel lived up to our expectations and more. We were extremely pleased by the cleanliness, the room, and the service.

review.title: The location is extremely convenient!
review.reviewText:
Overall it's a pleasant stay.
The location is very convenient and the room is quite neat.
But the phone in our room is not working, and the carpet was a bit wet when we got in the room.

review.title: Classical elegance with NO snobbery
review.reviewText: We returned after having spent a honeymoon night there. Our fond memories were not mistaken. It's breathtaking beautiful and gracious. On this occasion we brought our daughter and hope to have more family memories now. We look forward to another visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Everywhere there is attention to detail. The pool and workout rooms were a surprise, and the staff there were inviting.

review.title: Beautiful, well located hotel
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Staff very helpful, very beautiful lobby and pool. Rooms were a bit small but comfortable. Great location.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: My mom and I stayed at the palace for 2 nights, the hotel was big and super clean. I really loved the lobby, very elegant...

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, palatial and comfortable! I highly recommend this property as a wonderful place to stay.

review.title: Beautiful Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful historic hotel, that has been very well maintained considering the age. We enjoyed our 1 night stay.
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Luxury hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: Great location - about 3 blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Downtown setting: pros and cons
review.reviewText:
Beautiful grand lobby, but its public accessibility had me a little on edge for my own security. Approached by a stranger in the lobby trying to con me for money; I didn't see anyone monitoring access to the elevators/ rooms.
You should balance the central downtown location of this hotel with the downside of its accessibility to the general public and the attending safety concerns.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Disappointed thought it would be a lot nicer, however the rooms were old and small.

review.title: There are better options
review.reviewText: Low on staff. Looked much different than pictures. Very small room. No coffee or dryer in the room.

review.title: Very Nice histroic Hotel.
review.reviewText: The only thing bad was the $59.00 for parking per day I felt was a little high. The alternative was walking to another lot. Pay for the parking. The other lot is close but, you pass through an ally where we passed a group of people smoking dope and looking like trouble. We ate dinner one night in the bar/restaurant and the food was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: no coffee in room.
review.locationRemarks: okay

review.title: Excellent place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel! Pool is gorgeous and great place to stay if you have kids! We loved our stay!!!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Walking distance to everything.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel + Great Service + Great Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and great service from staff. The valet, front desk, maid service was all great. The room was not very large, but it was comfortable. The high ceilings and large window made the room feel larger. Location was also great, close to shopping and restaurants. I would stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Room was very nice and clean. Only stayed for one night, but would definitely go back. Very close to Union Square and Lower Nob Hill.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The only thing that would have made it better would have been having free Wifi in our room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, large room, comfortable beds, very nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No free Wifi, ridiculously expensive parking.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for us.

review.title: Great hotel in Finanical District
review.reviewText: Room and location were great. The air flow in the room was hard to regulate. Seemed the thermostat was on some sort of sensor and would always reset when you left and not keep air ciruclating.

review.title: Worst experience ever
review.reviewText:
This was maybe the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The decor inside is stained and dingy. The service desk was horrible. The room was missing a hair dryer and I needed toothpaste. After 5 unanswered calls to the front desk, they answered and said it will be right up. 30 minutes later, out of frustration I head down. I told them what I needed and said someone would bring it to the lobby. 20 minutes later I went back up to have the desk clerk say I will be right back. Another 10 minutes and I had a thing of toothpaste. No hair dryer.

By the way, there was NO hot water in my room and I called at least 4 times to which the response was "we are sending someone up" 2 nights with not a drop of hot water.

I will never stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Best Hotel experience ever!!!
review.reviewText:
Best, comfortable, nice staff guide, luxury interior and exterior, historical, and everything was excellent!

Best recommend place for trip to San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Very good location. Close to downtown. Room was handicap accessible. Good bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Older room.
review.locationRemarks: Great,

review.title: Great Luxurious Hotel in the center of San Fran
review.reviewText: Very Nice Hotel in the Heart of San Francisco, old classy style which makes the stay to a memorial one. Not to say that of course rooms, pool and food is fantastic.
review.locationRemarks: Center of San Francisco

review.title: Beautiful hotel with historic feel
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel!! The lobby is unbelievable and the rooms feel like old San Fran. A little outdated rooms but part of the old charm. Pretty good location.

review.title: Great city get away with a nice indoor pool.
review.reviewText: The only bad thing I must say about The Palace is that their food is horrible. I haven't one thing good to day about any of it. And, don't waste your money on the high tea. Beautiful room but, not worth the money. Service in the restaurant makes me think that everybody is in the food service union and doesn't need to care really; their position is safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Food
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: They offered us early check-in and late check out which is UNHEARD of! Extremely accomidating,beautiful premises,comfortabale bed. It's all good.

review.title: Overrated!
review.reviewText: Pretentious and way overrated! Room quality was comparable to a Holiday Inn Express. We even upgraded our room and you do not get what you pay for. No ice machines, parking $60/night, bathroom small, etc. We know it is San Fran but it was "The Palace Hotel"...did not get what we expected.

review.title: Great Palace Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great Staff, makes you feel comfortable and welcome.
Great location.

photos.caption: Christmas Tree in Garden Court of Palace Hotel, San Francisco (Dec 2012)

review.title: Beautiful historic hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Wonderful service and beautifully appointed surroundings. We showed up very early (well before 11 am) and were accommodated with a room well before regular check-in time, especially well-received since we had been up since 3 am that morning travelling. Excellent location, just a few blocks from the bustle of Union Square, with easy access to Chinatown. Hotel food was excellent, some of the best I've ever had - I especially recommend the french onion soup and the wonderful bacon-wrapped scallops in the grill. Some spotty service at the grill, due to an overworked staff - that could stand improvement - but overall, a very satisfactory experience. I would stay here again and again.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely old world feel to the atmosphere - very elegant and well appointed. Also, location, location, location!
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes, toiletries were not replaced in a timely manner, and wait service at the Grill was spotty.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent access to downtown San Francisco - walking distance to Market Street, Chinatown and beautiful Union Square.

review.title: Luxury and convenience
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel that's convenient to BART and MUNI and trolley. In fact, it's right outside the door! Restaurants nearby. The staff is very helpful. Room service 24 hours and very expensive. The Pied Piper pub is lovely. Only wish the hotel had complimentary coffee in the morning for the price we were paying and had given all 3 of us those cushy robes to wear, instead of only one for the room... But would stay here again!

review.title: The Palace is up to snuff!
review.reviewText: It's a very nice Hotel. My only beef? My flight was delayed so I got in later than expected and checked in around 4-4:30. My outbound flight was then also delayed, so I asked for a later checkout time, and was only extended until 1pm. I know most (all) Hotels now have an 11am or noon checkout, but too many also have a 2:30-3:30 check in. I thought rooms were based on 24-hour periods of time, as stated in most of their agreements. SO, this one item seems not only unfair, but a bit "Unbecoming". Otherwise it was a pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices of "extras" -- I mean, Seven-Bucks for a bottle of Fufu Water? Please. Though there was regular bottled water provided in the Bathroom for free
review.locationRemarks: The Best. Easy access to all point SF.

review.title: Christmas At The Palace
review.reviewText: I would love to start a new Family tradition Christmas at the Palace we truly felt like Queen's and Kings.Memories I can take with me forever
review.negativeRemarks: The Lobby needed o be updated big time
review.locationRemarks: Perfect Location

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: The hotel is so good. Especially, the location of hotel is pretty good for traveler.

review.title: great hotel for exploring san francisco
review.reviewText: the hotel is fantastic. it is only a 4 star hotel, but when you walk in it feels very much like a 5 start hotel. the concierge staff was top notch and the hotel's location could not be better. i would've liked a better view, but that cannot always be helped. if and when i go back to san francisco i will undoubtedly be staying here again.
review.positiveRemarks: the concierge staff was more than helpful. also, it was centrally located within the city which was ideal.
review.negativeRemarks: we had sunday brunch at their Garden Court and the service wasn't good for $90 a plate.
review.locationRemarks: centrally located and right next to a BART station. perfect spot as far as hotels go.

review.title: Great affordable hotel for anyone.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff and amenities were wonderful. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. We have a two and a half year old and all staff were so nice to our rambunctious toddler. The hotel itself is a beautiful maintained and decorated property with a beautiful lobby and dining areas and one of the nicest fitness centers I have ever seen in a hotel or otherwise. We have stayed in hotels near Union Square in the past several visits, but much prefer the Financial District local of the Palace. We visit San Francisco fairly often and the Palace near Yerba Buena is far preferable to the crazy tourist crowds of Union Square.

review.title: NIce hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, rather formal. Room had no view (view of gravel court yard and other rooms), but didn't spend much time there so it was ok. Concierge was very nice. Did not dine there, only a drink in the lounge which was very nice. Close to shopping and metro lines which made it easy to get around for site-seeing and getting to/from airports. Only took a cab once. Also easy walk to Embarcadero and AT&T Park. Would stay there again if rate is good.
review.negativeRemarks: No view
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient, close to metro line and shopping.

review.title: Grand Dame doesn't disappoint!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, great location and accessibility to public transportation. Historic, iconic, beautiful. It IS old, so there are minor flaws, but I'd stay again anytime!
review.negativeRemarks: Loud people in the hallway can be annoying
review.locationRemarks: Close to Muni and BART, easy to get anywhere quickly and easily.

review.title: Quick getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel experience was great. Friendly and tentative staff. Internal decoration completely fits the holiday spirit. The only problem I encountered were kids playing and screaming early in the morning down the hall. Room door and walls are not as sound proof as I would like them to be.
review.positiveRemarks: Decoration, location, festive environment, and drinks.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls and definitely not a sound proof door. Not as quiet when kids are screaming down the hall.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to the Montgomery BART station and located within walking distance of many other destinations.

review.title: We like it!
review.reviewText: Great location! gorgeous classic style hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: close or easy to go most places

review.title: great hotel location
review.reviewText:
the location is great close to everything
the bed linens did not look too clean
facila towers were not replaced daily and were not clean at all
review.negativeRemarks: linens were not clean, did not change towels often enough
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Great location, with friendly staff
review.reviewText: The lobby was beautiful. The staff was friendly. The room was ok...bathroom was a touch small and the office chair was missing a piece of the arm. The walls were thin, which was mildly annoying when people were in the hall or in the neighboring room... since voices, coughs, sneezes could all easily be heard. The location was perfect. I was staying for a conference at the Moscone center which was an easy 10 min walk and it was close to the F line to get to the piers. Overall I would stay again.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: I was in this hotel for 5 nights. everything was very good, the staff were helpful, my room was very clean and comfortable. If I go back to SF I ll book with this hotel for sure. I only need to mention about the Internet. I took the basic package, 15$/night for 2M it is was slow. sometimes I had to come to the lobby to use the Internet as it was much faster!
review.positiveRemarks: I like the lobby very much.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good. just beside all public transport.

review.title: Great hotel and in a great location
review.reviewText: Very quiet, clean, and just next to the BART station. I will highly recommend.

review.title: Great Place

review.title: Great location with room challenges

review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Very elegant, comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: Not much interaction with the staff, but the facility was very well kept, clean and comfortable. Would recommend, very good value.

review.title: Unable to have my Volt EV charged when parkiong.
review.reviewText: As always, a Palace stay is comfortable verging on luxurious. On this occasion, I was delighted to find that they offered charging facilities for my Volt EV. Unfortunately, though I requested that it be charged each time I had them park it (three times), the car was never charged. I can only assume that they didn't know how to charge it, and didn't ask. This should be corrected forthwith.
review.negativeRemarks: Failure of parking garage to charge my Volt EV.
review.locationRemarks: Very central in San Francisco

review.title: Perfect hotel for history lovers

Gorgeous hotel and I will stay there again.
I was disappointed the wait staff were so unfriendly in The Garden Court. They just didn't seem to care that I was a registered guest who just wanted to enjoy a cup of tea.
review.negativeRemarks: noise level in middle of night

review.title: Nice Place to stay.

review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great business trip, extended for a couple extra days
review.positiveRemarks: Elegant and open to business travelers and families, alike
review.negativeRemarks: very busy lobby full of holiday party revelers so no quiet place to relax in the public areas (probably because it was the holidays)
review.locationRemarks: Great location; central to public transport, shopping, nightlife and dining

review.title: Historic hotel
review.reviewText: Great staff. Such a historic hotel. Definately would stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel with a bad staff experience
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel but as we left we had a bad experience with the staff. At check out we left our baggage with the concierge service for safe keeping. When we came back to claim our luggage and depart the concierge staff person rudely motioned to my wife that he expected a tip for pushing a cart carrying our luggage a total of 20 ft. Now I would have tipped him had he not been so rude as to show an expectation for his menial service. But the fact that he showed a sense of entitlement for doing nothing more than his job I was completely offended especially for showing such lack of class to my wife. When I refused him a tip he began spitting on the ground and shouting "cheap! Cheap!"
Way to make a final impression. I suspect he was a new hire and had an expectation of getting extra cash for every time he does the slightest bit of work. Just a bad apple. I will be letting the
review.negativeRemarks: Too pretentious
review.locationRemarks: The "heart" of the financial district

review.title: Good place all around-
review.reviewText:
I was there for business and I expect to be reimbursed 100%. Fro out of pocket you may shop round for a cheaper place. But for SF, that is fairly good.

There was a slight moldy/wet smell in the room and I suppose that is due to no proper air circulation, well there is air circulation, but the rooms are completely closed (windows do not open for safety, etc..) and hallways are long and closed to outside air. No fresh air in other words.

Other than that the place is really fantastic and full of the little things that makes you feel so special. The food was extremely expensive. I had an in room burger (with soda) and it was a $30 (burger itself is $ 20) , wow.

review.title: Couldn't Sleep at Night
review.reviewText: Booked the hotel for a birthday weekend, really enjoyed the presentation and layout of the hotel. The room was clean, however, at night when trying to go to bed you could hear the howling of the wind through the window. Ended up not being able to sleep at all after looking forward to a great weekend at a highly regarded hotel. Would not consider staying again given how many other nice hotels are within the vicinity.

review.title: Historic hotel with pool, sauna and work out room.
review.reviewText: This hotel has both the function and fun for a stay in San Francisco. The hotel is clean, inviting and offers many amenities. My kids and I loved the beautiful pool, relaxing sauna and nice work out room. The beds are REALLY comfortable! This was our second stay at this hotel and I'm sure we will be back. If you are looking for an historic and updated hotel, this is your place. The only downfall was the expensive valet parking - $50!
review.positiveRemarks: Historic beauty, pool, sauna, work out room.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square and within walking distance to restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Quick Family trip for thanksgiving and shopping.
review.reviewText: Staff was great moving my 2 rooms closer together. Friendly and accomodating.

review.title: More than a PALACE.
review.reviewText:
This Hotel is full of Character and old world charm, where you feel like you are stepping back in time. The room offer's comfort, and everyday amenities to make your stay enjoyable.
Transportation is close by along with shopping, and restaurants.
I loved this Hotel and would stay there again on further visits to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: A hotel with Character, the Decor, large place but very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee machine in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Outstanding, away from the hustle and bustle, but distance was close enough to walk to attractions, shopping etc.

review.title: Maybe not the best choice for a family.
review.reviewText: My family, 2+2, stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend. We booked the double double and were offered the king on check-in with a roll-away for the kids. We went to see the room but felt it was too small to fit a roll away for two plus so we went with the double double. We loved the high ceilings and the location of the hotel and it was quiet. However we did find that the double double was on the small side for a hotel of this caliber and the bathroom was small. There was coffee provided in the lobby in the morning which was nice and a small fridge in the room which is always welcome. The kids had a great time in the swimming pool and of course there is a small Gym which was not too full on a Sunday morning. Over all it was pleasing but a bit cramped for a family of 4.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to shopping and the SF museum of modern Art. The 'F' tram stops just outside the door for access to the wharf.

review.title: The Palace on Thanksgiving Weekend
review.reviewText: Hotel is well located. Dining Room is beaufiful. Rooms a bit outdated. Hallway carpet needs replacing. Check-out took too long, on 11/24, as only ONE person was at front desk, with FIVE parties waiting in line! Overall, location made up for this nuisance...
review.negativeRemarks: Check out too long, not appropriate for this type of high end hotel
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: A charming downtown hotel.
review.reviewText: Front desk clerk was very accommodating and helpful. Room was small but clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Television reception was erratic and the in-room movie channel did not function. The lobby and dining hall are spectacular, and the Pied Piper bar/lounge is very nice, albeit noisy and very expensive. Parking is $59 a day, which is steep, even for San Francisco. The concierge recommended a nearby "american cuisine" restaurant, which was good, but definitely not american cuisine. All in all, a very nice hotel. Small and welcoming, although limited in dining options, and if you're looking for a hotel with a view, look elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Impressive dining hall and welcoming atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee and limited dining options.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown, just off Market street. Walking distance to a few restaurants. Not the best location if you're a tourist.

review.title: Perfect location and a great family choice
review.reviewText:
An outstanding downtown SF choice, especially for families. It's one of the few downtown hotels with a pool, which the large fitness area overlooks so mom/dad can keep an eye on the kids while working out. Overnight parking fees have become outrageous at all downtown hotels ($50-$60 a night) so the Palace's location literally steps from the Montgomery BART stop, and right on the multiple Market St. muni lines, and 2 blocks from the cable cars, allowed our family to enjoy a 4-day vacation with no rental car needed. We utilized CityPass which includes unlimited Muni bus/streetcar/subway/cable car usage, along with a couple cab rides, and came out far ahead.

A few small complaints. The rooms don't include a coffeemaker, but they'll bring you one to use upon request, subject to availability - for some reason they made a point of emphasizing "we only have a few" and that we received the last one. Weird. The default pillows are small and hard (foam-filled) but they'll bring you nice down pillows on request. Our first night's sleep was uncomfortable, then we figured this out. Our room 634 contained no listing of services, and our check-in clerk never mentioned the free coffee bar available downstairs in the morning. The Garden Court is gorgeous but breakfast (or brunch) is extremely expensive, save it for a special occasion. There's a Starbucks behind the hotel, and a McDonald's a half-block northeast on Market. Also 3 Walgreens (!) and the Westfield shopping mall within 2 blocks.
review.negativeRemarks: pillows
review.locationRemarks: ideal

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel overall. Great location near all public transportation services. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. The fitness center is small but adequate. Staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would stay here again.

review.title: 5 stars hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean.high end hotel.excellent location close to all amities.only issue I had was there's no vent fans in the bathrooms. Overall highly recommended.when I came back to San fransico I will stay at the place .
review.negativeRemarks: No bathroom fan
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants and shopping

review.title: great hotel bad view
review.reviewText: It was great. The only complaint is that there was no view from the room we got. I wonder if those rooms are only for expedia bookings. I think they should atleast let you know about the view, all I saw was other hotel windows.

review.title: Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Staff are very courteous and the palace is very attractive...
review.positiveRemarks: Arts and architectural structure of the hotel...
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom has no enough counter top space...no vanity available.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to shopping center and great eating places.

review.title: Great Hotel in the city
review.reviewText: Convenient to all froms of transporation including the underground train. Beautiful place with lots of history.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved location and its history. Beautiful Place!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff was not helpful on places to dine at or directions.
review.locationRemarks: It was right across the street from the Muni Train

review.title: Great hotel for a visit to SF
review.reviewText:
My wife, two children (11 & 14) and myself spent 3 nights there while sight-seeing in SF.
Beautiful old building, very comfortable and well maintained.
Location was very good, could walk to many places, and there are bus stops and bart stations right at the corner.
Didn't eat in the fancy grand dining hall as the price was so high, but it was nice to look at.
Only complaint was from my wife about the showers in the pool locker room, and the fact that the hot tub was too small.
We had a rental car which was handy for longer excursions but it was costly to keep it valet-parked at the hotel. That's the only thing I'd change about the trip, just use the mass transit options that are readily available.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful old building well maintained and upgraded.
review.negativeRemarks: Window's were permanently locked shut, somewhat limited choices for room size and layout.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to financial district, chinatown, not far from fishermans wharf, alcatraz tour boat.

review.title: San Francisco nights
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location. Avoid breakfast very expensive even if you go continental.We would go back and really enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive brekkie
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Good place in a central location
review.reviewText: Great location. Great service. The staff was very professional.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls were a bit thin, but generally it was a quite place.

review.title: Beautiful property with great renovations
review.reviewText: I got an amazing deal through Expedia. I've stayed in many 5-star hotels around the world and this property is in my top 5 easily.

review.title: The Palace Hotel Passes Easily
review.reviewText: Old world luxury is best way to describe it. It isn't over the top luxury, but very elegant and comfotable. Large spaces, high ceilings, wide hallways, and generally spacious rooms and baths. I did not eat at the hotel reaturant, but the hotel is located in a great part of town near shopping and some good restaurants. Staff, to the extent i encountered them (only at check-in and check-out#, were helfpul and welcoming. The exercise room has several pieces of equipment #multiple treadmills, elliptical, bench press, stationery bike, universal gym), and I never encountered a crowd. I would stay there again many times over.

review.title: Beautifully Romantic Hotel
review.reviewText: We found this hotel through an Expedia promotion - what a pleasant surprise!
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly located with easy acces to transportation, dining, shopping and sightseeing.

review.title: Beautiful yet snobby and pricey
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous. The dining room is stunning in its grandeur. The bar is also incredible, with a 2.5 million dollar painting called "The Pied Piper". The hotel and bar have interesting history, being built before the earthquake and existing during prohibition.

This hotel is snobby. The staff were not especially friendly or helpful. After discovering how expensive room service was the first night, we had pizza delivered the next and they didn't remove the pizza box for 2 days (I tried both putting it in the hallway, then left it in the room where housekeeping worked around it, then finally put it back in the hallway.)

The location is nice - near the edge of the financial district. It gets a little seedy several blocks away, but the location is good.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel bar and dining room are unbelievably beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bad service

review.title: Great hotel to see San Fran
review.reviewText: Perfect location. The staff was friendly and very helpful
review.locationRemarks: perfecct

review.title: The perfect S.F. trip thanks to The Palace
review.reviewText: My wife and I decided to visit San Francisco for the first time to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. We wanted to stay someplace nice, and historic so we chose The Palace. We were not disappointed as The Palace Hotel was wonderful. Even upon arrival we were amazed by how beautiful it was. The other passengers in our shuttle from the airport demanded to know the name as we exited the van and the envy was obvious in their faces. My wife was mesmerized by the garden court and must have taken a dozen photos when we first arrived. The location was perfect, with easy access to public transportation all over the city. Within 2-3 blocks we were able to hop a cable car to fisherman's wharf one day, then an express shuttle to the 49er's game the next. We had numerous dining options nearby but the Pied Piper bar & grill located in the hotel was the best food we ate during our entire stay. I've been bragging about our trip to S.F., the game, and the hotel, nonstop since we've returned. We'll definitely be back again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very polite and professional. The entire place was beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was a little small. Great shower but the toilet area felt cramped.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location. Close to food, transportation and entertainment. Ask the concierge about BART vs. Muni if you plan on using public transportation.

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText: The Palace is a nice, historic hotel conveniently located in the financial district, and I don't have too many complaints. The first night was rough because the fan made an annoying sound, and the ceiling was a little squeaky, but after that, I was tired enough to sleep through anything. The towels are disappointingly rough for a four star hotel, and in this day and age, it's a little ridiculous to have to pay a $15 surcharge for internet access (unless you want to go down to the lobby).
review.negativeRemarks: Fee for internet

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location!! The concierge was amazingly helpful! I will definitely stay here again

review.title: location to all
review.reviewText: great hotel and convent to all activity, parking price to high
review.negativeRemarks: beds to small

review.title: Very nice historical building - great stay

This place seems really geared towards couples, etc. Looks like they do alot of weddings there. In a great part of town and very close to PT, so you probably wouldn't even need a car as lon ags you plan to stay in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: No in room coffee

review.title: Great family hotel with a touch of royalty!
review.reviewText: Great staff; good location in the middle of SF with great restaurants within walking distance. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay. Thank you

photos.caption: Compliments of the Manager for my birthday

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is very elegant and in a convenient location. We arrived early, but our room was already available and we were able to check-in. The Reception and Concierge staff were very helpful and informative. One night, to our pleasant surprise, a bottle of champagne in ice, 2 flutes and a card were left in the room in celebration of my birthday.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to public transportation, the charm and elegance of the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: It is easily accessible to all areas of San Francisco by subway, bus or muni

review.title: Perfect in every way
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is also fantastic. It is on every major transportation line in the city. One of the best vacations ever. Also the Sunday brunch is the perfect.

review.title: Non-pretentious, refined elegance, great location
review.reviewText: Nice, well-maintained old hotel with non-pretentious, quiet, refined elegance. Great location. Very comfortable overall. Enjoyed being on the 8th floor. (While we did not have a city or street view, the quietness was worth it. We spent a LOT of time on the street doing photography, so did not miss the view from the room.) We would have preferred a hotel that was more contemporary with modern, edgy design, but other than that, this hotel suited us very well. Room was smaller than we would have liked, but not inadequate. Bathroom was clean and reasonable size. Bed comfortable. We arrived early Friday morning, and amazingly, we were able to check in right away at 10AM. (Well-appreciated surprise as we'd been up all night!) On Monday we were able to extend our checkout time until 1PM. I have to say, the Palace Hotel enhanced our stay, and in no way detracted from it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great. Comfortable hotel enhanced our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Free coffee not so good. Room size a bit small, but adequate with good layout.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location! Very close to BART station, near cable cars, easy to walk everywhere. We are photographers, so walked to Wharf, Lombard St, etc.

review.title: Great couples Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful classic Old world Hotel constructed in 1906 and carefully renovated to its early elegance afetr the San Francisco Earthquake...The Sunday brunch although pricey is probably the most elegant and delicious brunch on the planet...We will definitely return...Note, parking is $59/day,so it makes sense to leave your car at home and take cabs or trolleys
review.positiveRemarks: Saturdat High tea and Sunday brunch
review.negativeRemarks: the pool was small and shallow ...ie strictly a lap pool
review.locationRemarks: Market St and New Montgomery, right in the heart of the financial district on the trolley llne

review.title: San Fran recharged my soul
review.reviewText: Better pricing deals for repeat customers, please. I would certainly like to visit the city and this hotel again. Price has some bearing on my decision. Thank you
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Character, Staff, Building construction and condition
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Well situated for our exploration of the city.

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel was great. As with most places in San Fran you just have to be careful of where you go after hours. The front desk staff were great though as we asked where to avoid and they gave us suggestions of safe areas to be and places to eat. Very happy overall
review.negativeRemarks: expensive charge for wifi in rooms
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Close to transit systems
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location for BART coming from airport, and for the buses to get to Fishermen's warf and other places. The hotel is obviously an older hotel, but gives you that luxurious feel. However, there is no insulation between rooms, conversations in the next room are definately clear to hear! We did not use the hotel restaurant...way too overpriced for us! Found out on the last day there is complementary coffee in the restaurant area every morning after 5am, that's why they don't have coffee makers in the rooms! Lots of restaurants and stores within walking distance of hotel.

review.title: Very nice Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText:
Everything was fine except a few points:
-You can here the next rooms quite easily if they are a litle bit loudly.
-Towels were not changed daily.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise in the room when the next rooms were a litle bit loudly speaking
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Close to Union Square which were our preference.

review.title: weekend get away
review.reviewText: We brought our niece and her friend for the weekend prior to going off to college. Good location easy access to public transportation, helpful staff. We really enjoyed our stay

review.title: Great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: great location close to anywhere you want to go. Price of meals maybe to high for someone on a travel budget
review.positiveRemarks: staff is great hotel is right down town
review.negativeRemarks: nothing everything was super

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Common areas of lobby including bathrooms were dirty and in disarray. Coffee service table in the morning was poorly supplied, dirty and had broken coffee urns. Wait for reception and bell staff was very long.
Carpeting in room really needed a vacuuming.
review.locationRemarks: located in the financial district close to shopping, dining, BART and taxis.

review.title: Great old world elaborate charm
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly amazed when stayed in the SF Palace hotel. It feels like stepping back one hundred years into an elaborate old world hotel. Don't let it fooled you, the hotel is well kept and very modernized in terms of its amenities: Good in-room electrical controls, flat screen TV with HD channels, high water pressure in the shower and good AC. Each room has a refrigerator so you don't have to ask for one. Staff is very courteous and respectful. Another huge advantage is the Montgomery BART station that is literally 2 steps outside the hotel. The area feels much safer compared to Union Square. Two downsides of the hotel are the high priced extra services (interntet, meals) and some of the rooms have gloomy backyard view (other room windows).
review.negativeRemarks: cost of extra services, window view

review.title: Most affordable and convenient.
review.reviewText: Located conveniently at a Bart/subway stop. You can connect from SFO to Hotel solely by using the bart. Not to mention it was the most affordable hotel on Market street.

review.title: Great for everyone!
review.reviewText: We were in town for a weekend getaway-we stayed at the Palace Hotel because of the outstanding deal we got through Expedia! The hotel is amazing and the location was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Location Location Location, Quiet and the hotel is stunning
review.negativeRemarks: Brekkie is pricey
review.locationRemarks: easy access to everything!

review.title: Most Comfortable bed and pillows!!
review.reviewText:
Most comfortable bed and pillows

comfortable bed and pillows (amazing). the pool is excellent. close to shops/everything. the courtyard garden has magnificent ambiance and soothing background music. staff members are courteous. couldn't ask for more. quite pricey but well worth it. we stayed here as a family and no second thought we will definitely come back at this hotel!!

review.title: Mother and Daughters trip
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, very friendly staff but the beds and linens were uncomfortable. The location of the hotel is superb!

review.title: The Palace lived up to its name!
review.reviewText: We are a family of four, both of my children are under ten, and the Hotel was perfect. The location was ideal, near Union Square, Chinatown, and the Ferry Building. The indoor pool was exactly what we needed after walking the town. The staff was friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, historical and located in a great part of the city.

review.title: palace
review.reviewText: The staff went above and beyond to assist. The location is excellent to all major attractions. On the down side. The beds were very uncomfortable and the washroom had a very unpleasant smell.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed size

review.title: Solid hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, beautiful rooms. Shower was very old and required a lot of force to turn on, but the water pressure was great once it was on. The housekeeping staff was also very helpful and promptly brought the extra shampoo I requested. The only downside was that the front desk was very curt when I checked in and checked out. I've stayed in many Starwood hotels in the past and have always been impressed by their customer service and pleasant welcome - the staff at Palace was lacking in this regard. That said, the hotel itself was comfortable, quiet, and provided a relaxing and enjoyable stay.

review.title: Good comfort in a fantastic location
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is really impressive. The rooms are comfortable, although nothing spectacular. The staff is friendly, helpful, and a pleasure to be around.

The pillows on the bed are uniquely comfortable to lie on.

review.title: Great Hotel For Everyone
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Palace Hotel very much. The hotel is beautiful inside especially the main dining room and lobby. The hotel staff were very courteous and efficient. My room was large and spacious and very comfortable. One of the best hotels in San Francisco for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Large, spacious room and very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Best Location Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel location is superb; BART, Metro, and bus stops of various lines in front of the hotel as well as Union Sq (shopping mecca and cable-car terminal) and SFSoMA within 5 min walk. With 7 days Muni Passport, we used the hotel as a base camp for our exploration in the tiring hilly city. The quality of the staff and their service was great; useful information from the counter staffs and professional room service. Complimentary morning coffee was a good-to-have. The building and its appearance were old-fashioned, but neat and clean. Overall, we liked the hotel experience quite a lot!!.

review.title: Great location to see San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent service and perfect location! The staff was extremely welcoming and the location allowed for many forms of transportation from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Will be back, perfect location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, we stayed a week and our room was always very clean and well stocked. The location was perfect for us, transit station right outside the lobby door, very convient for taking BART from and to the airport. Everything was pretty much in walking distance
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Royal Stay
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square. Easy to walk to shops and restaurants. BART station is outside the door. Room was big and well decorated. Staff was friendly and always addressed you. Nice bathroom amenities and the free bottles of water were a great touch. Very little counter space in the bathroom but the closet was big. The only complaint is the noise level. You can hear people talking and walking in the hall and you can hear the sound of water in the pipes a lot. Had drinks and dessert in the bar and both were fabulous!Concierge was helpful. Overall, great experience at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level

review.title: Old world stunning
review.reviewText:
Hotel is old world stunning. Only glitch: rooms small and mattresses uncomfortable. Also only double beds, not queens so difficult to share. Great location, near all trains. Beautiful city.
Do the old open trolley to the wharf. Worth the 45 min line. If you have a car just drive around Stunning views pop up everywhere up and over the hills

review.title: Pretty hotel of thin walls
review.reviewText:
It is a very beautiful hotel indeed.
However, an older lady at the concierge was not friendly actually quite rude. Most importantly, if you prefer not to hear baby or adult noises from your neighbours at night, or anytime, then find another hotel. The walls are way too thin.
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls.

review.title: Fabulous experience!
review.reviewText:
Fabulous experience. The only problem was that my daughter had a headache at 3AM and the hotel does not sell pain medication. There is a 7-11 nearby but at 3AM??? I waited until it was light.
Also, the Internet fee is per device. We had 5 laptops and 5 days. It gets expensive. It is a free wifi near the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of free wifi everywhere
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Wow!
review.reviewText: Wow! This is the most beautiful hotel I've ever seen! The kids loved the pool! We all enjoyed walking around in the heart of downtown SF. What a treat to get to stay here!
review.positiveRemarks: The building interior was like stepping back in time.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurants in the hotel were too expensive for us, but other places to eat were right around the corner.
review.locationRemarks: It's within walking distance of several large malls and museums.

review.title: Nice vacation location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and comfortable. We liked having free bottles of water every day in the room. The dimming lights in the bathroom made great night lights and we liked the decor with luxury linens and towels. The shower water pressure and temp were nice and consistent. The lobby and common areas were beautiful. The exercise room was well equipped and clean. We really have nothing bad to say about this hotel except that there's not an affordable restaurant on site. The location is great for all public transportation. The BART station, cable car and busses are right out front and and make it easy to get to the airport. The only negative was that the walls are thin. We could hear people in the next room like they were in ours. Other than that I would say we loved the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls and expensive restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText:
My son and I enjoyed a great vacation in San Francisco, and stayed at The Palace for 3 nights. It's a classy hotel, and we loved our stay. The staff was great, especially Chinata at the Concierge. She made my son's Birthday very special by sending Apple Cider up to our room, and a nice note. She also made arrangements at two restaurants that we loved.

The Hotel was clean, had that old style, and classy feel. The pool area was nice, with skylights, and we enjoyed that as well. Overall, the room was great. The bedsheets didn't fit the bed, and they start cleaning the rooms WAY too early(9am or before) but overall, this was a great place to stay.
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks from the main part of Union Square.

review.title: Beautiful and historic
review.reviewText: Amazing! Helpful staff, clean and quiet room, cool bar.
review.locationRemarks: Great- right downtown. Easy access to transit.

review.title: great hotel near public transportation everywhere
review.reviewText: Location. Location. Location. Plus: simple and elegant.

review.title: Great Value in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Location, location, location! The Palace is located in the Financial District which is close to Union Square and the Ferry Building. Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf are within walking distance if you are in good physical shape. There are many delis in the area. Take the city bus tour which leaves from Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a beautiful, historic hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining here is very pricey. Go check out the Lee's Deli.
review.locationRemarks: The Palace is on Market Street in the heart of downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Overall great hotel

review.title: Professional, Clean, Friendly.
review.reviewText:
Professional, Clean, Friendly.

review.title: Location, location, location

I will definately be back. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the restaurants are wonderfull, especially some of the uniquie bar cocktails.

Though the room was vacuumed daily, it was also somewhat dusty. The pool was a nice extra and very welcome. Architectural details were wonderful.

All staff we had contact with were very nice and willing to please, the hotel was beautiful and clean, and the location to everything was really great. There were absolutely no negatives in our eyes. We would gladly recommend the hotel to others. Oh, oh!!!!!!!!!! One thing I did complain about to my wife, there was no "golf channel" on the tv. You diffently need to add the golf channel.

Super location & welcoming staff!

review.title: Magnificent and enjoyable service and presence

review.positiveRemarks: The glass dome and the chandeliers are great.

review.title: Lovely, but beware the added charges
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel in a very convenient location. Of course you pay for the privilege, and our criticism would be the $15 per day per device charge to access the Internet and the $59 per day parking charge. The history of the hotel adds to its appeal, but be prepared to pay to enjoy it.

review.title: Yes, I would recommend it to a friend.
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. From the moment you walk in the front door, you feel a sense of classic elegance. The Palace Hotel is very central. We were on a family vacation & we were able to easily navigate around the City on foot. Prices for hotel room service were too pricey for our family but there are lots of food options available in the neighbourhood. If you have time, sign up for a walking tour of the history of the Palace Hotel. We didn't have time to do that but we will try to do that next time we're in town.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the regal elegance of the common areas.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices of room service. No free Wi-Fi in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Central location. Easy to walk to everything & lots of transit options available to get around.

review.title: Good choice!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very beautiful, and in a very nice area. Conveniently, there are BART stations, bus stations, restaurants, and shopping all close by. The room was clean and well-kept for the most part, and very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and helpful when we asked for advice or directions. The only drawback is that free wifi is not available in the rooms, which was a slight inconvenience when we were attempting to find attractions/directions. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel, unless you are against paying for wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi in the rooms was inconvenient
review.locationRemarks: safe neighborhood, close proximity to shopping, transit, and food

review.title: Memorable two-day vacation
review.reviewText:
I am very happy we chose the Palace Hotel in San Francisco for a two-day vacation after a full convention week in another hotel. It made our "special time" more significant, although I had been in the city for several long days. Furthermore, it allowed us the opportunity to visit both Sausalito in Marin Co and both Berkeley and Oakland in the East Bay with its easy access to the Montgomery BART station. As a former resident, the ability to visit and revisit both favorite friends and sites made it memorable.

The staff was professional, courteous and accommodating. Our room was luxurious and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Notwithstanding the opulence of this historic hotel, I really l enjoyed the luxurious bathroom & amenities in our room, a private mini-spa experience.
review.negativeRemarks: My least favorite thing about this hotel was that I had to "check out from it and return home". (smile) I could have stayed there forever
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, great for both the experienced traveler and tourist.

review.title: Great hotel for classy stay
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco overnight just to participate to the San Francisco Marathon. The hotel is magnificent and kept up beautifully. I would stay there again, a[nd next time I will have tea in the gorgeous Garden Court.
review.negativeRemarks: None

review.positiveRemarks: Hotel booked a show for us and we got really good seats.

review.title: Great location with friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Great location with very friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: We loved everything about this hotel. The room was large and comfortable. The bed and pillows suited use perfectly. Of course the location turned out to perfect for all of our plans.
review.positiveRemarks: Lydia at the spa was a highlight of our experience. Welcoming,accommodating and attentive to our needs.The concierge desk also had valuable suggestion

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and in a perfect location near public transportation and Union Square. It's within walking distance of dozens of stores, restaurants, the museum of modern art, and Yerba Buena Gardens. The staff and concierge were polite and helpful. Our complaints: the walls were thin so we could hear our neighbors, the public computers in the business center cost us $8.50 for 12 minutes or so on their slow Internet, and you have to pay for wi-fi.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the location near all forms of public transportation and stores.
review.negativeRemarks: The thin walls and lack of free Internet.
review.locationRemarks: SoMa, just off Market St. Within walking distance of Union Square, the visitor's center, and cable cars, BART and Muni.

review.title: great hotel for only one day
review.reviewText:
great location nice rooms. friendly staff . I am wounder why the internet free in the lobby but they charge you $ 15 a day in your room. you go to any fast food around the corner and its free
every one these days use the internet even in 2 star hotels is free
also there is no coffee maker in the rooms so you had to get up early in your vacation go down to the lobby so you can get free coffee please change the time from 5 am to 8 am . change it to 11am . remember vacation people they dont like to get up 5 am to get free coffee We are paying alot of money to stay at this hotel to pay fr the internet and not having coffee in the rooms. I will find something worth our vacation mony. also I had to pay for the airport transportation other hotels its free
review.negativeRemarks: the lobby is boring no t.v nothing there only employee to look at

review.title: Great Old School Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square, the financial district, SOMA and Chinatown. The lobby, restaurant and facilities in general are beautifully grand and very well maintained, especially for a turn of the century hotel. The rooms were spacious enough, clean, and generally well appointed, but those who normally stay in newly built/remodeled hotels may think the rooms could stand a bit of a remodel. Also, could hear the folks in the next room on one occasion. But my wife and I thought the overall experience, location and price were well worth it, and I would stay here again and recommend that others do as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, turn of the century grand hotel charm
review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms could be updated a bit; could hear the neighbors next door a bit
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square, Financial District, SOMA and Chinatown

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location! This hotel is close to the BART and all other public transportation. It is also an ideal location to do everything in San Francisco that you would want- close to fisher-mans wharf, union square and shopping, Castro District, etc. You won't be disappointed if you stay here!

review.title: Good for Families too!
review.reviewText: When I first booked here for it's proximity to a conference I was attending, I was a little worried about bringing the family. This is truly an elegant and beautiful setting, with high quality and attentive staff, with a generous room size and comfortable amenities. I needn't have worried. My family including two young children took full advantage of the covered pool area and the spa / exercise activities while I busied myself at my conference. Great experience.

review.title: Overall, a nice place to stay
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice facility. However, while it has the appearance of a luxury hotel, it was missing some things that you expect in a luxury hotel.

Pros: Very nice staff. The concierge personnel in particular were very friendly and helpful. The building is very nice. The exercise room was good, although the weight machines were not particularly user friendly. A nice enough indoor pool with skylight.

Cons: They charge extra (I think $15/day) for internet access in your room. I'm sure it does not cost them $15/day for each person who uses the Internet. Charging extra, as opposed to incorporating the cost in the room fees, just makes it seem like they are using it as a profit center, and are not trying to be customer oriented. They also don't have a gift or snack shop or vending machines (that I could find), so no Coke if you get thirsty. The rooms also lack a printed hotel-information guide. You can get information on your TV, but you have to wait for it to boot up, and then again while it pauses to "access that information," once you figure out the TV system. One night I tried calling the front desk twice and no one answered. These are minor things, and not things that everyone will find important. But at this price, for this type of hotel, I just expected a little more.

Overall, it was a nice place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay extra for Internet access
review.locationRemarks: A good location, but not quite at the heart of anything. Not too far, though, from Union Square, or South of Market. Some homeless people nearby.

review.title: Palace Hotel, July 2012
review.reviewText: Mum travelling with two teenagers (13 and 14 years), we stayed at The Palace for 5 nights whilst on holiday in San Francisco. The rooms had plenty of space for us, the only downside is no electric jug for hot water, but it was free from room service and always arrived quickly. The fitness centre and pool are a great way of relaxing after a hard day of being a tourist!! i had the pool to myself most mornings! The hotel is perfectly placed to access buses, street cars and BART - the stops are right outside the street door. Cable car terminus was a 10 minute walk as was the Ferry Building. There is a Starbucks and a great bakery within a minute of the hotel - ideal for breakfast. We felt safe in the area even after dark, although there are the ever present homeless people around the area. Hotel staff are polite, courteous and helpful. The Concierge was fantastic.. We had an evening flight out of San Francisco (to Australia) and the hotel were happy to arrange a later check out time for us.
review.positiveRemarks: position, pool, politeness and knowledge of staff
review.negativeRemarks: no electric jug in rooms!!
review.locationRemarks: perfect for all forms of transport and access to main San Francisco areas

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, but I did not like the thin walls, too much noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Awesome

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very accessible to everything. True to its name, it really looks grand and beautiful. The downside is the internet, which is not free and the buffet is over priced. We would have wanted to use the pool, however, it was very "chlorinated", we can smell the chlorine from the hallway. Neverthless we enjoyed our stay and I'll recommend it to all my friends.

review.title: Top class luxury.
review.reviewText:
An absolute palace! Beautiful and a real touch of beauty. Located with immediate access to the BART (airport link underground train.)
Fantastic staff and excellent concierge service. They even knew where to eat and what was on the menus! An immaculate hotel, full of history. Probably the most impressive in SF.
Don't forget your swim suit. The pool and hot tub are stunning.

review.title: Palace Hotel San Fran
review.reviewText: You really feel as if you are in a palace - the beds are heavenly - staff are warm and friendly - service impeccable - thank you!
review.locationRemarks: Great location - close to everything

review.title: Should have been cleaner
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was beautiful and the staff was great, but the cleanliness of the hotel was not up to standards. The bed skirt had stains on it, the curtains were dirty, the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling in several spots, the bathroom sink was cracked, the baseboards were dirty, the stairwell between the 1st and 2nd floors was dirty, and the gym area wasn't clean. The table behind the hotel reservations counter was also noticeably dusty. The finer touches such as a complimentary newspaper at the room door in the morning were not available. A newspaper was available, but only by the elevators. The valet and doormen were very helpful and professional
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby was beautiful and loved the history of The Palace
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to a variety of things and transportation

review.title: Recommended for couples
review.reviewText: Great ambiance, wonderful service. It is also in a very convenient location right next door to Bart, Union Square and the Ferry building. The only complaint is the bed is a little hard but all in all, our stay was very pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The dining room was very elegant!!

review.title: outstanding

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: I recently stayed here for one night with my wife to visit our daughter. It's a great property. We arrived at 10 AM and were given a room right away. The staff was very helpful.

review.title: Wood annyversary!
review.reviewText: Location is great, away from the crouds but within the main streets, close to the piers, and close to all the stores. Walking distance from china town, Coit tower, and just about everything. The hotel is expensive and somewhat older if looking to stay in a modern one. But the whole hotel is beautiful! the ceelings in the brakefast room is wonderful! Worth seeing even if you are not staying there. One down side is how expensive brakefast was but it was great! They don't have a coffee maker in the room and foa a morning coffee drinker is a big deal but they place a service table of coffee and tea in the lobby and it was great!

review.title: SIMPLY AMAZING
review.reviewText:
I chose SF and this hotel for my wife's 40th birthday surprise. She was blown away. I liked the historic feel, but inspite of the classic nature and age of the structure, the interior was simply incredible. Every person down to housekeeping was easy to talk to and willing to help. The rooms are massive for a city hotel, particularly the high celings. Reminds me of the size of a standard Las Vegas hotel, with WAY more class. Remember, you get what you pay for. This property is worth every penny.

-Dr J

review.title: Beautiful hotel, fantastic pool for families
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco with a friend and two 17 year old girls. Not much to do around the hotel at night as it is in the financial district but there is a 24 hour 7-11 right across the street. Staff was very friendly, room was clean and well appointed.

review.title: Great hotel at the heart of SF!
review.reviewText: I went there with my bf and we stayed for 4 days. The location of the hotel is great, you can walk many places or use public transportation easily, so u actually dont need to rent a car (especially considering the high parking prices). The rooms are clean and nice. The staff are very nice and helpful. Eventhough it is on the street, we never had any noise problems. The beds are so comfortable. You can also walk to best night clubs around Union Square. The hotel has a nice bar, which is always crowded. And the dining hall is so romantic! Overall I strongly recommend this hotel if you are planning to go for a short-term vacation and want to stay in the heart of the SF. We will definitely go there again!

review.title: wowwwwwwwwwwwww

the hotel itself is beautiful ...the architectual part is just amazing , from the entrance to the open dinning area and hallways...everybody that i've seen took pictures so just that itself tells you a lot of the Palce Hotel ....PALACE it is.

the service was excellent...

review.title: Great hotel for business travelers
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel! Not only is it very elegant and clean, but its staff are extremely friendly. The rooms are kept orderly and the service is awesome. The concierge service is very impressive.
review.positiveRemarks: Its overall comfort and staff friendliness
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Its is right off Market Street, which is a very convenient location.

review.title: Historic with modern amenities and great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I were in San Francisco to celebrate our tenth anniversary and wanted to stay in a nice, romantic hotel without breaking the budget. We were able to find a really great deal for The Palace on Expedia and I'm so glad we did. It had historic charm but wasn't rickety. We stayed in a superior king room and the bed was really comfortable. There was a decent amount of space too. We didn't have much of a view, but that was okay; because we faced inward even though we were on the second floor there was no street noise. I was worried about being able to hear the conversations of the people next door based on some of the other reviews, but while we could hear people out in the hallway fairly clearly we didn't hear anything next door. The staff downstairs were really helpful too. Location was great, with a BART station and F-Car stop just outside the door. It was a quick walk to Union Square and about a twenty minute walk to AT&T Stadium where we went to watch the Giants play. Overall, it was perfect for our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Mirror across from the toilet. Not a lot of vanity space in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. Close to transit. If you're up for it you can walk to most of the major tourist attractions without much trouble.

review.title: Consider everything before staying here
review.reviewText: Worst of all was the $59 daily parking rate. Second was that there was not a coffee pot in the room.

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. (We were situated on the 3rd floor, the farthest room from the elevator.) I was in town for a conference, and my fiancé spent more time in the room than I and he had no complaints either. The room size and corresponding price was what you'd expect for a downtown hotel. The decor was lovely and the staff were friendly. In short, we'd both recommend the hotel for couples/individuals on business.
review.locationRemarks: It's located steps away from BART/Muni. It's also in close walking proximity from most major downtown sights/museums/shopping.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: Great location. Locates right beside barb station which makes taking transit absolutely convenient. The room is a good size. Cleaness is okay. Consider the price, the cleanness can be improved.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: Not worth the price!! $60.00 for parking per night! Hair in bathroom and dirty towels left by bed from the previous customers!!!

review.title: Parking!!!!!!!!!

A super plus to my friend and I was that we wanted to see the city and the Concierge was very nice and knowledageable.
review.negativeRemarks: thins walls and no vent in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: great location, right next to the trolly and bart

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, walking distance to everything, muni/bar/F-line stations right outside the doors. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Trust me...stay here.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was beautiful! It is in a great location with transportation right outside the front door. The hotel staff was wonderful and willing to help in any way they could.

The room was big, clean, and comfortable, The bathroom was nice too...everything you could possibly need including a great shower with lots of hot water.

My only complaint would be that the price of the parking is outrageous at $59 a night...but that is San Francisco for you.

I would certainly stay there again if I'm back in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is beautiful and the staff was excellent!

stay here again.

IN THE MORNING THERE IS COMPLIMENTARY COFFEE AND TEA WITH A SEATING AREA OVERLOOKING THE GLASS DOMED PALACE COURT. JUST A ELEGANT AND FUN PLACE TO STAY. ONLY DRAWBACK IS PARKING IS ASTRONOMICAL.
review.negativeRemarks: EXPENSE OF PARKING
review.locationRemarks: CONVIENENT TO THE FERRY BLDG. AND UNION SQUARE

review.title: Bay-to-Breakers from the Palace
review.reviewText:
An impressive property with an outstanding financial district location that is just three blocks from union square. 10-foot ceilings gave the rooms a spacious feeling and the stafff was very friendly. There is no view from the inside rooms- unless you look into another room- but this is only an 8-story hotel so views are scarce anyway. The lobby was picture perfect althought the publice areas were a little less than i expected. Swimming pool and workout area was very good despite weak jets in the hot tub.
Maxfield's bar is a treasure. The back mural is striking, the atmosphere and feel of the place is perfect and it is actually a popular night spot.
We will definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Morning sun in the lobby dining room. Maxfield's bar. BART terminal right outside the door.
review.negativeRemarks: No view. The hallways are loooong.
review.locationRemarks: Market street location was convenient and easy to find from anywhere in this great city.
