review.title: A real treat :D
review.reviewText: I really loved the hotel, the only problem I had was I found blood on one of my pillows but everyone was quick enough to get clean linens for my entire bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the Garden Court... I had a wonderful breakfast there
review.negativeRemarks: The blood on my pillow
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect walking distance to many things

review.title: Perfect location, great staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the perfect location. Staff was VERY helpful. Room was spacious and clean. Hotel expensive for meals for a family but plenty of other places to eat locally.

review.title: Great location. Don't bring a car!
review.reviewText: Great location. Nice staff. Nice pool and jacuzzi. Smallish but high ceiling rooms. Too bad it costs an arm and a leg to park a car there.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking. $59/day! Or fend for yourself. Car was improperly towed. Waiting for results from MTA hearing to reverse tow charges and ticket.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to Embracadero, Union Square, Chinatown, and some great restaurants.

review.title: Well.. it's good
review.reviewText:
Pretty nice hotel...
The dining room Garden Court looks nice though did not have a chance to dine there. The afternoon tea seems to be very attractive.

review.title: Honeymooners
review.reviewText: This was a beautiful hotel though I think it's more for business people more so than honeymooners. The walls were thin but the bed was very comfy and the staff was very accomodating.
review.positiveRemarks: Was in the financial district so lots of good hotels
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls and all this uppity business folk
review.locationRemarks: Good for walking to restaurants and also close to all public transportation

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much, the Palace is a great place for a vacation. The location is perfect, very close to the BART and several bus lines. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The exercise room, sauna and indoor pool were perfect for getting in a workout.

review.title: great
review.reviewText:
Should have free internet in the rooms for what you pay. Even the Holiday in does this
Should have a coffee station in the lobby

review.title: Fresh flowers and spectacular lobby/ restaurant
review.reviewText: What a lovely experience we had! The lobby and restaurant area is a real showstopper. Loved the beautiful fresh flower arrangements. We were more than pleased with the ambiance, staff and location. Room was plenty spacious for an older hotel. Would definitely stay there again in the future.

review.title: Should be 5 stars
review.reviewText: I was a little disappointed with my room. There was no coffee maker. Given the luxurious decor of the hotel I expected more. The bed spread and shower curtain had small stains.

review.title: Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: We found the Palace to be located conveniently, within short walk to cable cars, street cars, BART, etc. The Staff was polite and most concerned that our stay/experience was what we expected it to be. The public portion of the hotel was exquisite. Our room was lovely. Some reviews mentioned that the rooms were too small however our room was certainly big enough for two people. It could be that we were comparing it to European hotels where large rooms are not the norm. We loved every minute we were there.

review.title: Would Stay there again.
review.reviewText: conveniently located, next to BART. Free WiFi at the lobby and concierge was very helpful with the restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi charge

review.title: Grand historic hotel
review.reviewText: Beautifully restored historic hotel right in the heart of the financial district. Staff went out of their way to make us comfortable, the pool was a nice surprise, well designed, clean and good for lap swimming or playing with kids.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra charge for parking $69 a night!
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the business district but within walking distance of all major attractions.

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, close to shopping,resturants and transportation. Very clean in all areas and the staff helpful and plesant. The breakfast at the hotel is wonderful but expensive, thats the only thing that I have negitive to say. There are many other choices close by for snacks and meals that are resonable.
review.positiveRemarks: Large rooms for a city hotel and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was very expensive, even if you ordered off the menu.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect, for all visitors to the city.

review.title: Very, Very Satisfied!!!!
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to help!!
The service in all aspects of our visit was exceptional.
Excellent location!!

review.title: Beautiful hotel for a beautiful city.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and perfect location. The streetcar pickup is right outside the front door, there are several delicious restaurants right around the corner, and blocks away from Union Square. The staff was professional and friendly. If we ever go back, we will stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful and ornate. The location is perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: I know this is petty, but free wifi and a coffee maker in the room would have been nice. It's an expensive city and that would help.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Close to downtown, but not too close. The warf is only 15 minutes on the streetcar, which is right outside the hotel.

review.title: Awesome pool
review.reviewText: Swimming pool was awesome.. Room service was soooooooooo good

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Loved the dining room. Not terribly happy about the $15/day wifi, but other than that it was great. Loved getting apples everyday at the pool. Nice touch.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: The room was dusty and the bathroom is really outdated.

review.title: Would definitely go back.
review.reviewText:
We recently stayed at The Palace Hotel... and we would definitely return. The location was excellent, the staff was very attentive. The breakfast buffet and menu could be improved though. But the menu in the Pied Piper Bar & Grill was excellent!

If you like classic hotels with a lot of history do stay here. Maintenance of the building is outstanding. It was rebuilt after the San Francisco earthquake and has maintained it's style and class.

We stayed in room 434 and the only thing is that the bathroom sink needs to be replaced since it has a small crack in the porcelain.
review.positiveRemarks: The Garden Court and Pied Piper Grill... the comfort of the beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The pool area smelled too much like bleach.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance of Union Square, great food and shopping. Would like it if there weren't as many homeless/schitzophrenic people around...it was odd.

review.title: Gorgeous Lobby but rooms need updating.
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel grounds and lobby with great location. Rooms need updating. Our room was little too small with small window and carpet was little rundown. Bed mattress need upgrading or may have been too old. Indoor pool was great. Staff were good. Valet Parking was expensive: $60 for one night!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great location, but interior should be upgraded.
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice and within walking distance of Union Square, China Town, Fisherman's Wharf, etc. However, I feel they should upgrade the hotel for the price. The pool is nice if you are traveling with children.

review.title: Spacious with great service
review.reviewText: This hotel gives you the entire 360 experience of beautiful architecture, great service, very knowledgeable staff and large comfortable rooms.

review.title: Palace Hotel, San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is a historic, magnificent, gorges hotel. The quality of the construction materials belong to a higher standard of a different era..marble, glass, iron ...but still everything kept mint condition. It is a breath taking hotel, very elegant. I totally love it. Best location.
review.positiveRemarks: elegance and luxury. The entrance and the atrium.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking $59 per day; impossible public parking in the area.
review.locationRemarks: The best: walking distance to nice stores,restaurants,

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: My friend and I just stayed at the Palace Hotel while on vacation in San Francisco and we had a great experience. The hotel has great old-world charm but the rooms were very comfortable. The lobby and garden atrium are stunning and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Hotel Restaurants
review.reviewText:
Hotel Restaurants

Hotel restaurants were not what I was expecting. Pied Piper is a bar. There are no restaurants in the hotel per se. However, room service food was great.
review.negativeRemarks: I like restaurants inside the hotel
review.locationRemarks: location was very convenient to most places

review.title: Very nice hotel!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is very pleasant. The hotel itself is very clean and elegant. We did not eat at the restaurant, we want something less expensive, but there are a lot of affordable places to eat within walking distance. The room is very nice, though we heard some people talking(either next room or maybe out in the hallway next to the rooms).
review.positiveRemarks: The treatment we got from the employees.
review.negativeRemarks: The noises heard from inside the room.
review.locationRemarks: One of the best locations.

review.title: Old World Charm
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at this hotel primarily because it was within walking distance of the Moscone Convention Center and I had read good reviews online. The room was well kept and comfortable, while I wouldn't describe the decor as modern or elegant I enjoyed the uniqueness and the overall old world feel of the hotel. I felt like I was frequenting an old hotel that has been updated and renovated but has still kept the look and feel of its history alive. Room Service and the Pied Piper Bar seemed expensive but you definitely get a deserved level of quality from that price. Let's face it, this isn't a hotel with a free continental breakfast where you can make your own waffles. You are ordering food crafted by people that know they're business. All said and done, enjoy your stay and if you keep in mind that the food and drinks are worth the price and that the decor reflects the history of the hotel, you will love this hotel!

review.title: I'd stay here again.
review.reviewText:
Gorgeous and spacious room with nice spacious ceilings. Bed was very comfortable and there was nice ambient lighting. It's nice that the hotel is one street off the main drag as it lends itself to a quieter night's sleep. Fourth floor had access to the fitness facility and spa, but I didn't bring any workout gear.

I had limited interaction with the staff, but they were overly nice.

The only blemish on an otherwise great stay is the Internet access - it's an additional $15-20 for a night. Wi-fi didn't work very well, so I had to use the hard-line (whose cable wasn't quite long enough to let me sit on the bed). I really wish this could be bundled in the room cost as it would make it easier to expense.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive internet access.
review.locationRemarks: One street off the main drag in both directions; close, but not too close, if you know what i mean.

review.title: awesome experience!
review.reviewText: From the moment we pulled up, we were treated like royalty. The staff were professional but not stuffy. The room was fantastic. Free coffee, swimming and jacuzzi for the kids, workout for mom and dad. I would highly recommend the Plaza!

review.title: Another Greaf Stay In San Francisco
review.reviewText: Every time we stay here at the Palace is a pleasure! Staff are always helpful & assists you with request or information. We enjoyed using their hot tub where the pool us located Kb the 4th floor. Great after walking around enjoying S.F. sites & food.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to walk to around city & to transportation to get to other sites there.

review.title: Old school luxury
review.reviewText: It was a little less than hospitable and user friendly. Doorman was rarely there. Couldn't find a hairdryer or ice bucket until we asked down at the desk. (When you seek them out, the staff is very courteous and friendly.) Bottled water (there was one bottle in the room for 2 guests) was $7./bottle. They charge for wi-fi, and although there is supposedly a lovely pool - we never found it. But, it is a pretty old hotel. Its comfortable, conveniently located, and the Pied Piper Bar is great. It feels as thought you're living in an old luxury apartment building.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities and staff are a little hard to find.
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous, convenient, quiet location, adjacent to, yet not smack in the middle of everything.

review.title: Right on Market
review.reviewText: Great hotel if you are in town and don't rent a car, the location is great. Fitness facilities and pool for the sportive business traveler.
review.positiveRemarks: Fabulous old fashioned luxury hotel with staff who is pleasant and very friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Location is awesome, close to Montgormery BART station. Transfer from and to teh airport is easy and fast.

review.title: The Palace over Prez Day Weekend
review.reviewText: Walls for a little thin but luckily the neighbors weren't noisy for too long.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool was a bit cold and the walls were a bit thin.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to Ferry Building and Powell St.

review.title: Location,Location,Location
review.reviewText: I had been promising my daughter (16) a trip to SF for three years and we finally did it. While I have spent a lot of time in the city, my daughter has not. We had an absolutely wonderful time, the hotel is gorgeous and so centrally located. We had breakfast in the Garden Court and it was very good food for a buffet, but the ambience was what really made the morning. My daughter got to walk china town, shop in Union Square (there are two forever 21 stores within blocks, heaven for a teen girl) and take a trolly and cable cars to fishermans wharf. The room was really quite large for a downtown hotel, not an embassy suite, but still quite adequate. The staff were quite helpful and let us check in early. We took BART to and from the airport, and the stop is literally right in front of the hotel. Best time in SF I've ever had.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to everything. Buy a muni pass, and the city is yours to explore

review.title: As expected
review.reviewText: The staff at desk was very friendly. The lobby was nice and the room was adequate for the family.
review.positiveRemarks: Kids enjoyed the pool. If you have kids ask to stay on 4th floor where pool is.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I really "disliked".
review.locationRemarks: It's close enough to Union Square and Convention Center. Starbucks next door.

review.title: Palace hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with very courteous and professional staff.

review.title: Order from Starbucks but pull up the covers here!
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I completed an extended weekend trip to SF with a nice night at the Palace Hotel. We were fortunate enough to stay with a friend for most of our weekend but I may have reconsidered staying more nights than one at the Palace Hotel had I known how nice it was. As for the service--everyone was extremely friendly...the kind of service that I'd expect the staff would be scolded by the supervisors if they passed by a guest and didn't kindly greet. The room in excellent order. The lighting in the bathroom was a bit dim however. The shower was super clean and the water pressure was great. Always a plus! I did not use room service or eat at the very nice dining area they had. I did however get some appetizers at the bar late at night. The one and only disturbing price complaint I have for the trip...$5 for a cup of coffee?? I mean, really? Unless there is a gold nugget or a complimentary mug with each cup of coffee, that is just stealing. All in all, I would gladly stay there again as it is at a great location and overall a great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Not your everyday cookie cutter hotel
review.negativeRemarks: $5 cup of coffee better be the same fluids they use in the fountain of youth
review.locationRemarks: Prime location to visit SF complete with crazy homeless people walking around like zombies for complete effect

review.title: Great SF hotel
review.reviewText:
Only fault is the food service on Sunday, an overpriced buffet was a let down.

Staff = five star.
Hotel =. Classically stunning
review.negativeRemarks: Food service & over priced valet
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Wonderful place to stay!
review.reviewText: This hotel is wonderful! Located in the heart of San Francisco, you are able to walk to many popular places. The hotel is beautiful. Our room was very comfortable. My husband mentioned to a staff member that it was our Anniversary weekend and the staff signed a card with a bowl of fruit and a bottle of wine and had it delivered to our room!
review.negativeRemarks: The shock at the how much room service was...but totally worth it.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent locatin in the middle of San Francisco's downtown financial area...close to Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Great Night in SFO
review.reviewText: The Palace is a beautiful old hotel that has been magnificently restored. The rooms were large and comfortable. The staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and WiFi charges were very stiff but comparable to similar hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to shopping at the Market Street shopping center. Near the Yerba Buena Gardens and the Museum of Modern Art.

review.title: Not Luxury Hotel
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel and well located with an amazing bar with original stained glass ceilings. The striking dining area has an ornate canopy of the most amazing stained glass. However, the furniture in the lobby and by the concierge lets the hotel down as they are not in keeping with the sumptuous ambiance of the hotel and this is also echoed in the rooms. We stayed in a Deluxe King room but it was nothing special. The mini-bar was not stocked, nor were there any tea/ coffee making facilities in the rooms. You had to call housekeeping and if you wanted coffee in the morning you had to go to reception and help yourself - this is rather impractical!!!

However, it does not warrant the branding of a luxury collection hotel but on the bright side the hotel was clean and the staff extremely helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great NYE stay
review.reviewText: Clean room, great staff. We went there on NYE and they keep the place neat and organized.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location. Alarm clock should have been re-set before we checked in, woke us up early. Concierge could have been a little bit more helpful. Would stay there again. Not many dining choices in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of dining choices in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: central and close to everything

review.title: RESTAURANTS
review.reviewText: tHE FOOD MENU IS SMALL, AND SOME OF THE STTAF ARE NOT FRIENDLY

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText: Love coming here during the holidays. The tree in the dining room is so fantastic - people were there taking photos every time I walked by. The room was great and the staff was helpful. Great price for the area as well. This was my 6th stay and I always come back to enjoy it's majestic beauty and the rich history of the hotel.

review.title: Roys.
review.reviewText: just GR8.!!!!!

review.title: Old beauty in need of a facelift
review.reviewText:
This is a beautiful old hotel but in order to compete in a city like SF, Starwood's going to have to start redoing this place. The carpet is a mess: worn and dirty. The beds feel like they too date back to 1910.
Even the beautiful dining room serves food that don't even come close to being worth the $30 they charge. WIth so many restaurants and hotels doing true luxury within blocks, it's time to update or keep sliding fast.
review.locationRemarks: stay downtown but away from Geary above Union Square.

review.title: I hated it!
review.reviewText: I was so upset with every aspect of this over prices wanna be luxery hotel. I could go on but I'm not going to waste my time. This hotel stinks!

review.title: I will definitely go back to the hotel. .
review.reviewText: All the personnel were very courteous and professional. The bed is comfortable, and the bath tub is nice. Great location. Best price. I walked from the hotel to all the favorite and famous spots nearby; the Ferry Building, SF Museum of Modern Art, Union Square, the new Westfield Shopping Center and the cable car turnaround on Powel Street, near many nice and hip restaurants. You can also walk or take thehistorc cable car to AT&T Park, home of the Giants. The hotel is on the main thoroughfare, Market Street where you can catch many bus lines to go to other tourist spots, i.e. Golden Gate Park, Fisherman's Wharf, Palace of Fine Arts, Castro District, Japan Town, The Filmore District,...
review.locationRemarks: SFMOMA; they were showing wonderful photography show by Francesca Woodman and also other art exhibition. Also Mission District; we went to see a wonderful show, "Psychogeography" which showed very talented avant garde artists with their short films about Mexico and controversial Canadian popular sport, hocky games, "Vallery's Ankle". Walk along the Embarcadero and see the bay and see both the famous bridges; Bay Bridge and Golden Gate Bridge. Also get on the cable car travel along the gracious California Avenue and see the famous Grace Cathedral. Go to the Marina area for shopping, and the Filmore District, North Beach (the famous Italian restaurants and the hippie origination), Yerba Buena Center of Arts, the Cable Car Museum, the Coit Tower, Fisherman's Wharf, and go out to dine at various restaurants that make SF famous.

review.title: Nice Hotel over priced.
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice but over priced. I stayed here because there was a convention and there were no rooms to be had. I stayed at the Donatello for less and they were great and included internet.

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: For the past year of traveling to San Francsico, I found this hotel by accident. I will not stay at any other hotel.....the best way to describe it is AWESOME!!!! Location, people, cleanliness, charm, it is truely the best place I've stayed in the city.

review.title: Will come back
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, close to shopping and easy access to bus and BART. The only compliant I have is that there's no in-room coffee and tea. Hotel do offer coffee and tea in the morning in the Lobby area but it's not as convenient as in your room. Also, they charge for bottle water in your room. Not enough people to handle Bell service.

review.title: Great location for a SF Giants Game
review.reviewText: Easy & safe walking distance to AT&T Park. The walls were a tiny bit thin - could hear the couple next to us arguing - but not too bad. Hotel Restaurants are very expensive but there's plenty within walking distance that are more reasonable.

review.title: Confortable
review.reviewText: I have been in this hotel with 3 kids, very confortable!!

review.title: Fantastic hotel in the heart of San Fran!
review.reviewText:
Girls weekend in San Francisco was enhanced by the beautiful setting of the Palace hotel and the convenience to everything. Hotel concierge was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful.

The only downside was the expensive room call charges, overpriced drinks in the Pied Piper lounge and the inability of the hotel to get us 2 adjacent rooms when requested well in advance.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Price
review.reviewText: The room was great. Premium bedding and great view of San Francisc's finical district. I booked this hotel because it was a little less than a mile away from AT&T park. We walked to and from the park at night and never felt as if we were in a dangerous or shady part of town. They have a amazing indoor pool and sauna. The breakfast buffet was delicious and they let us check in 4 hrs early.

review.title: Bit tired, but comfortable
review.reviewText:
Pros:
Location
Pretty good pool and fitness area
Nice toiletries

Cons:
I was put into a room facing market street, a little noisy
The lobby is a bit tired
Room is a little on the small side

review.title: A really good stay
review.reviewText:
The Palace Hotel is well located - only a 5 min walk to Union Square and a 15 min walk to the Ferry Building and is at the top of the Financial District. The hotel is very comfortable with a beautiful dining room just off of the lobby area. The staff were efficient and courteous, the interior very comfortable and the hotel's bar and restaurant offered high quality food and drink at reasonable prices. I loved the swimming pool (and of course meant to use the gym but didn't quite manage it).

Overall I am impressed and would recommend it.

review.title: Great Service at a good price in the middle of downtown.
review.reviewText:
If you look past the exorbitant amount for parking (same in most SF hotels), this hotel has everything you can ask for. Professional, prompt service, grand architecture and clean, good sized rooms.
We were there on a Sunday night so they upgraded us to a slightly larger room for free. They also had a service to park your luggage before check-in/after check-out and the valet parking allowed you to leave your car there until 8pm the day of your checkout.
My only complaint: very poor mattresses. You could feel the springs way too much. A shame for a hotel with "luxury" and "palace" in the name...

review.title: A very good value, will be back!
review.reviewText: We didn't know what to expect before we arrived and we were very suprised. From the friendly greeting at the front desk, the nice sized rooms by old hotel standards, the great bar and accomodating concierge service, it was an all around A+.

review.title: Very impressed with the Palace!
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is easy to get to by way of the BART raill system, being right at the Montgomery Street station. The high ceilings and general elegance of the hotel make it memorable. The location is excellent! We will stay there on our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: There's a reason they call this place LUXURY!!!
review.reviewText: Got such a great deal on Expedia.....the hotel is basically life styles of the rich and famous....the Grand Court...is a stunning room....with excellent food and staff. The Pided Piper was the perfect place to relax after walking all those hills! (I'll recommend the "Last Cocktail"....refreshing!!! Location.....coundn't have had a better location! Check out the list of people that have stayed there....

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText:
A nice hotel in a great location. The "Garden Court" was exquisite, even just to walk past. The hotel provided very good service - staff members were always polite and helpful. For example, I called housekeeping/room service to ask if they could bring up a coffee maker or kettle so I could make myself a late night hot beverage, but they didn't have any available and instead, promptly brought me hot water in a pot - much appreciated.
Upon arrival, we were assigned a room near the elevators and when we requested a change, we were moved to a quieter room without any questions. We stayed for two nights, and had great sleeps.
Valet parking was a bit costly but they were always quite fast to bring out our car. And the cost offered in and out privileges, something the nearby lots didn't offer.
The hotel does need to change the linens they use - it is hard to believe that they wash those patterned blankets and throw pillows between each guest stay. Yuk. I would have much preferred duvet covers that get changed between guests, and plain pillow cases - like most other high end hotels offer.
Lastly, I would have really appreciated and valued an evening turn down service.

review.title: nice classic hotel
review.reviewText: Overall a hotel with good classic decor, there are common area in the hotel that are pictures opportunities. Right off the Montgomery station. Free wifi in the lobby. (Need to ask for passcode)

review.title: Nice and posh
review.reviewText: Not really our style of decor but excellent service and comfort.

review.title: "loved it"
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel in an Excellent Location.

Beautiful lobby.

Sumptuous Afternoon Tea and Brunch.

Very helpful Staff and Concierge.

review.title: Overall a lovely property.
review.reviewText: The front desk left little to be desired. There was no offer to assist with bags or a friendly welcome for that matter. With that said, I was able to check in at 10:00 AM on a Saturday and for that I was very appreciative. The housekeeping staff was exceptional, they were pleasant, attentive, and efficient. The bar and the service provided there was terrific.

review.title: decent for a short stay
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night for the marathon. The hotel is much older than others in the area. Valet was $50 but what can u expect in SF? good place to stay as it is walking distance to lots of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Linda Kirk
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much. The employees were very kind and helpful. If we are ever in San Francisco again we would love to stay at the Palace again.

review.title: Good for old people
review.reviewText:
1. Expensive.
2. The internet is very expensive in the room, but free in the lobby.
3. The room is small.
4. There is no free brekfast, only coffee, and it is available for short time.
5. Most of them were polite, except for one. He was one of the concierges, don't believe him when he says "spectacular". Everything for him is spectacular :)

What else, oh yes, have a nice trip and good luck :)

review.title: Close to BART
review.reviewText: Very nice and close to BART

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel very satisfied. If only they provided slippers and robes for guests using the pool facilities. Had to walk back to our room barefoot.

review.title: Okay with special rate
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a grand dame in SF. Public spaces are elegant, but the rooms are clean and comfortable, with size only adequate. I booked a deluxe room, one grade up, and found the room no larger than a standard room, and the small bathroom had only a mini-tub and shower. It was located on an interior light well, so it was quiet, but no view. I'm not sure how this was a "deluxe" room.

Well located within walking distance of Union Square and the Ferry Building (a bit of a hike, but doable), the financial district, and next to a Muni/BART station.

review.title: Still Impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Palace two years ago, and loved it. This trip was no different. It's in the Financial District, which is gorgeous. Anywhere you could want to go in the city is easily within walking distance; except the Golden Gate Park and Bridge. The staff is always friendly and quick to volunteer help with anything you could need. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous! The rooms are very large, with plenty of space and storage. I continue to recommend it to family and friends.

review.title: They charge too much for wifi and meals.
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful place w/ v. adequate rooms and a good location., They are not particularly sensitive to the needs of travellers, however, having inadequate door service and spectacularly expensive meals in the beautiful courtyard. Also $15 p/d for internet access is ridiculous when it is free in most of America. I was made to feel guilty about wanting to use Bart when it cost 1/2 of a miserable van ride to the airport. C'mon, guys, people appreciate being treated with dignity and common sense. This is a problem for a lot of American hotels. The concierges were great and helped solve problems, but the doormen let guests wait a llong time for cabs b/c they were unloading new arrivals. Certainly, a few more employees would reduce the competition for assistance and add to the dignity and humanity of the door staff and the patrons. These guis work mostly for ti[ps so what is the problem in allowing more of them to work. especially in this economy?

review.title: San Francisco classic
review.reviewText:
What can I say. This hotel is beautiful, old, classic full of good aura.....Love the entry but mostly it has that great old scent of a high end hotel with the incredible bouquet in the entry and old wood on the walls
beds super comfortable. Rooms old and a bit small, but very comfortable.
I love the old Classics and this hotel is one of the Best

review.title: "So Fun!"
review.reviewText: This hotel is awesome! I think it is the best in San Fransico by far! And the pool opens at 5:00 AM. Plus Mrs.Lidia [the lady that runs the pool] is also so nice! I also liked the great location, the people there, and my room. I highly recommend it!

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Great upgrade of historic hotel

review.title: Very Amazing
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, and very classy. We enjoyed it very much. The location was very nice and extremely convienent.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean and close to everything in the financial district

review.title: A very low-value stay: Expensive and poor.
review.reviewText: Rooms are divided by very thin concrete walls. The hotel guests next door were often audible...even the ringing of their phone could be heard. My room appeared to have been updated about 10 years ago, having furnishings that were well worn, matted carpeting, and broken bathroom floor tile. Hotel service was very slow: A request on two occasions for bowls and spoons (for morning cereal breakfast) to be delivered to my room took longer than 40 minutes each time. The concierge was understaffed with a wait longer than 15 minutes, while the checkout desk also seemed understaffed. Although the hotel lobby and dining room are spectacularly beautiful, the hotel is a major disappointment: noisy, worn, and very expensive.

review.title: Lovely hotel, prime location
review.reviewText:
My only complaint was about the Pied Piper (the bar in the hotel) -- despite it being clearly posted (on the web, in the book in the room, on the sign outside the bar) that the bar was open and serving food till midnight, we arrived at 11:15 on a Saturday night to be told it was last call, the kitchen was closed but they would serve us "one drink if we promised to hurry." We had been at the theatre and had many options to eat in the city, but came back to the hotel specifically to enjoy this much-acclaimed watering hole. The waiter was downright rude when we expressed our dismay and told us to order room service (at the additional very high delivery cost and service fees -- no thanks.) It was too late to go back out at that point -- so we went to bed hungry that night.

Otherwise, though, lovely hotel, wonderful sheets, they let us check in early on the day of arrival, the pool was gorgeous, HD TV was high quality, I would definitely go back. Oh, and the concierge was terrific, getting us reservations at a fantastic restaurant and arranging for a rental car to be delivered to the hotel.

review.title: Saddam's Palace
review.reviewText:
The Palace seems very dated and well past its prime.
The mattress was mushy.
There was no coffee service in the room. I had to walk to Starbucks across the street for coffee.
$48 for Valet!!! It still took them 20 minutes to get the car.
Won't go back.

review.title: Palace with Perks That Cost Extra
review.reviewText:
My first impression of The Palace Hotel in San Francisco was very positive. The staff was pleasant and accommodating, the hotel beautiful (The Garden Dining Room Was Reminiscent of Classic Old Luxury Hotels).

My room was superb with high ceilings again reminiscent of the classic luxury hotels. The bathroom was large and convenient. All in all it was a very good experience.

So why the rub?

I'm just a believe in today's day and time (old luxury or not) that internet access in your room is pretty mandatory. Sort of like a TV or hot running water. But no, the internet access was an additional fee, either per day or other hourly combinations. I found it a little (used car sales'ish for a hotel so nice). Why nickel and dime me. Just add it to your normal room charge, but make it part of The Palace Hotel stay experience and you will have my vote for all 5 stars.

review.title: Would Go Back To Enjoy Staying Again
review.reviewText: An exquisite hotel from the time you walk into it. All the staff were accomodating if we had a question as to where we needed to go or if we needed extra supplies for our room. The room was ample in space and very clean. The floor where we stayed was delightful to walk down with their fixtures of the hotel to admire. Wished we would have had time to enjoy their indoor pool. We definetely will go back to stay there. It's well worth it!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, but don't bring a car
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, everyone was gracious. The rooms were very comfortable and the hotel was beautiful. The grand dinning room was stunning. Parking you car is expensive.

review.title: Slowest checkin around
review.reviewText:
Nice rooms and features. Indoor pool. Banquet room is big.

Unfortunately: Extremely slow checkin. 2 people on desk - 1 was used for club members, 20 people in line, at least 30 minute wait or more

Parking is half a c-note overnight plus tax, plus valet.

review.title: christmas holiday
review.reviewText: We loved staying at the Palace during Christmas. The hotel was beautifully decorated, got great pictures of the grand kids sitting on the "throne" in front of the huge tree. They loved swimming in the pool. Experience was a great treat for all.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: A relaxing and pleasant experience.

review.title: Extremely poor customer service
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel overbilled me and has steadfastly ignored multiple inquiries from me to reconcile my bill. Their lack of responsiveness to my issue is highly unprofessional.

review.title: Absolutely beautiful
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience. The room was beautiful, spotless, and had every amenity. The hotel itself was gorgeous and so historic. We'd go back in a minute.

review.title: Great luxury hotel at a low price
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, spacious and beautiful. Centrally located in a great neighborhood. The staff were friendly and helpful. Check-in took too long. We ended up going to eat and coming back because the line was so long what with a coach load of people coming in. The restaurants in the hotel were a little over-priced, so we opted to eat at one of the many great restaurants a short walk from the hotel instead. There's also a few great cafes on the same block, with great coffee, tea, pastries and sandwiches. One annoying thing was the $8/hr wireless internet charge in the hotel. I wasn't very impressed with that, since it's a higher end hotel. But all in all, it was a good price for the quality of hotel and the area. I'd stay there again.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location, high ceiling rooms

review.title: Lovely Hotel but I expected more for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel is a lovely old grand dame and is fairly well maintained. The room was very small and I was expecting that due to when this hotel was originally built, but it still made for some ackward maneuvering - two suitcases cause big problems. The staff is friendly, professional and go out of their way to help you. I was disappointed however by the lack of coffemaker in the room which forces you to have room service as well as the lack of dinning options. You could get breakfast and lunch but the main dinning room was closed for dinner and their alternative was a Japanese restaurant. For the money, I feel there should have been more than ambiance.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Was married here a few years back. The service has taken a little downturn...not quite as accomodating/sincerely nice as before. Small details, but not what I'm used to there and what is expected there

review.title: Nice but expensive
review.reviewText: A very pretty hotel but the rooms are small as the hotel is quite old. Our view was a wall but decided not to complain since it seem to help considerably with San Francisco noise. Comforable bed. Pricey but it is San Francisco after all.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is excellent located and you don't really need a car, you can walk around to know places or shopping centers, take the cable car or troll, find good restaurants around and the service in the hotel was good. The Concierge helps you in everything that you need, they helped us to book whatever we needed

review.title: Palace Hotel - San Francisco
review.reviewText:
In general - I was quite happy with the hotel (service, staff, restaurants, location)

my complaint: the walls shouldn't be this thin in this class of hotel
on one side of my room was a well used stairwell (one of the main ones)
on the other side of my room - an amorous couple arrived 2 nights before the end of my stay

review.title: Perfect location, great service, wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel! Perfectly located near the BART and the trolley is just a few blocks away, making sight seeing a breeze. Hotel room is lovely with comfy beds, nice bathrooms and it's beautifully decorated. Having the famous Garden Court in the hotel is a bonus. Several friends commented on how nice the hotel was. Highly recommend it!!!

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: to take great moments with your partners or with the family

review.title: Wonderful grand old hotel - they don't build them like this anymore!
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel, very welcoming staff, super clean, bed very comfortable, right next to great restaurants and shopping, highly recommended!

review.title: Two times lucky at the Palace
review.reviewText: Stayed in the Junior Suite booked through Expedia. Great to stay in a hotel that is close to BART/MUNI transit stops but away from the west of Union Square where the Tenderloin can taint a stay in San Francisco. Lobby and pool facilities are great.

review.title: Felt like Queen and King
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights with hubby before the SF Marathon. Convenient location to the run. Beautiful hotel. Had a fantastic brunch in the Maxfield Bar - the crab omlette was to die for. Great friendly service. The Palace is a wonderful landmark hotel.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText:
We booked a junior suite and were very satisfied. The high ceilings and large windows were outstanding. The roominess of the suite was great especially from a hotel in the City.
We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Luxury at an affordable price
review.reviewText:
The Palace Hotel is ideally located to Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants and other attractions can be easily reached as the conceirge can provide the necessary travel arrangements.

The hotel's facilities are first rate and the hotel's restaurant for breakfast and lunch is first rate. Dinner should be experienced outside the hotel's doors.
My vacation was excellent

review.title: enjoyable
review.reviewText: Carpet in the hallways could stand a little cleaning. Mattress uncomfortable. Good location. Older decor, but was as shown in the pictures.

review.title: easy access
review.reviewText: good for overnight stopover.excellent japanese restaurant in-house and very "buzzy" bar (Maxfields)also serving food. easy access to shopping,both Westfield and Union Square. another plus is that BART from airport stops in street outside. the main entrance and 'cafe' is pure early 1900s, so do not go if you like super-modern aesthetic. would recommend as good value

review.title: highly recommended and would use it again
review.reviewText: A luxury hotel as described. Room is extremely spacious and well decorated. I am fussy about the cleaningness of a hotel but am able to say it is to my satifactory standard, I would however expect complimentary bottle of water everyday for this kind of class but it was only provided at day 1. Great location to get around using bus, tram and cable cars. Friendly staff. A truly 4-star hotel. Advice is to book early to enjoy cheap and promotional prices.

review.title: Staying again in August
review.reviewText: We were so pleased with the service, the food, and the overall convenience to everything, we are coming back to The Palace. I checked a number of other hotels for this trip (we are moving our son for college), but the price and location won us over -- not to mention the friendliness of the staff.

review.title: My favorite hotel anywhere.
review.reviewText:
I adore the Palace. I love the huge bowl of roses in the entry, the helpful people at the concierge desk, the quietness of the lobby, the extremely polite and helpful valets and car handlers, etc. Get it? I love it. I go for a few nights every few years. This year we tried the Pied Piper Bar and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a junior suite and enjoyed the open space. The people in the next room were rather noisy but didn't keep us up. The beds are extremely comfortable and I LOVE THE BATHROOM, especially the phone.

The hotel is perfectly located. We drove around town and found ourselves close to everything, once we figured out how New Montgomery Street was situated. My sister and brother loved the Mickey D's across the street.

review.title: The Palace
review.reviewText:
The Palace is a grand old hotel. You're greeted by a beautiful lobby. It is located near a Muni/BART station, taxis were always available, and it was within walking distance of the Ferry Building. It was a great deal at the price paid.

Service - After taking a 6 a.m. flight from NJ, I requested early check-in and got it. I left something behind at the front desk and within minutes it was dropped off at my room. Those working at the concierge desk were very helpful and only had one miss with their recommendations. The Grove, a local restaurant, was a very good selection for lunch. A question regarding live/salsa music brought us to place that only has salsa on certain nights so we were disappointed to find a DJ playing hip-hop.

Room -Mine was on the Market St side. The issue there is the traffic noise during the day, but it wasn't too much as I live in the city. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. As it is an older hotel, the bathroom probably should be updated in the near future, but it was clean and that's all that matters to me. Loved the magnification mirror. More should have them.

Amenities - While I didn't use either the pool or fitness room (why stay indoors when you can walk around?!), there were few folks there so you could almost have them to yourself. Wi-Fi seemed to only be available in the lobby as that's where folks with laptops were gathered. There is a business center, but I only needed to print my boarding pass and that was near the concierge desk.

review.title: San Francisco's Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: The carpets in the room and halls need to be cleaned. The bath/shower corner unit is very small and has a cheap glass/metal enclosure. The shower drained very slowly leaving one standing in soapy water for the duration. However, the concierge was great!

review.title: Robbie - Orlando
review.reviewText: This is a upscale hotel that offers nothing. They have a coffee stand downstairs in the morning which ran out of coffee all the time. The rooms are old looking and not up to date. The bathrooms were not nice, tubs had stains and the walls needed painting. We had to come back several times to get help since the front desk was to busy on the phone. They turn your power off the day of departure. I was a star-wood member but after this trip never agin. For the price it is not worth it. No wireless, no cont. breakfast, nothing. Go to the four seasons they offer much more for much less.

review.title: We love old hotels and travel with three teenage daugthers.
review.reviewText:
My wife and I love old hotels. This one is worth staying at.
A few pros and cons:
Pros: Location, a few feet front the F trolley. Can walk or ride to the harbor. Architecture. High ceilings and nice sized rooms. Friendly staff, lots of help. Great bar and good food ( expensive of course ). Kid friendly, nice pool. Fresh fruit and coffee every day in the lobby and gym.
Cons: A little shabby in the room. Lamp shades frayed. We needed two rooms next to each other ( 3 daughters ). Needed to call again to make it happen--did not pay attention to request on Expedia. One room was not ready at 3pm, but not a problem we simply walked to the harbor.
A few tips:
1) You don't need a car; however, many cabs on fit 4. F train is $2 dollars / person and right next to hotel.
2) Muir woods is worth the trip. Did an open bus trip to sausalito and muir woods. Great day.
3) Book Alcatraz in advance and do the audio tour.
4) Don't eat at Sinbads even though it looks ok and is the first restaurant if you walk.
5) Do eat at Horizon's on the back deck in Sausalito.

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was very nice. We will definately stay here again.

review.title: A Great Hotel in the Most Charming City in the World
review.reviewText: This was our third anniversary in a row (#32-34) that we've stayed at the Palace, and we plan to do it again next year. We commute from the suburbs on Bart which drops us off at the door, take Muni or walk to all the landmarks (Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, Ocean Beach and the Ball Park at McCovey Cove, and use the first-rate facilities at the hotel--pool and jacuzzi, cozy room, the Pied Piper bar, and the Sunday brunch. The entire staff is service oriented and friendly and the Palace sparkles with Old World charm.

review.title: will return
review.reviewText: There was no hassle when I requested to change to a room with an external view - the receptionist arranged a room directly opposite rightaway. The only complaint is the room service telephonist who did not even hear out my request before saying it can't be done - even if it cannot be done, it is courtesy to hear your guest/client out first. Would be good if the hotel is located on Union Square itself, like the Westin.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful. We didn't expect it to be as wonderful as it was. The staff were helpful and rooms very clean and comfortable. I looked forward to sleeping in the comfy bed every night! The location was perfect and we were easily able to get where we needed to go. It's very easy to get to this hotel because it's right across the street from the BART Montgomery station.

review.title: Opulence and Elegance abounds!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel - presents nicely, rooms are spacous and adequate, close to all San Francisco amenities. It's a pleasure to walk into a hotel like this - I love it's old world charm - only one thing of note is that for some reason at times I could hear the conversationis in the room next to me! This was not constant so am not sure whether it was the room next to me or personnel in the fire stairs! Despite that, it was relatively quiet as far as San Francisco hotels go. Nice to come in in the evening and have the bed turned down and the lights on. Definitely will stay again and recommend this hotel to anyone travelling. Concierge was delightful - recommended some excellent eating venues.

review.title: Not a Four Seasons, but still a solid 4-star hotel
review.reviewText:
The entrance/lobby area is beautiful-- a very elegant European feel. The staff was friendly and check-in was a breeze. There's free wireless in the lobby, but I wish there was complimentary internet in the rooms as well. We didn't eat at the hotel as it was VERY pricey. We didn't make it to the gym or pool either, as both close at 10pm.

The rooms were kind of small, but nice, elegant, and clean. I didn't like my mattress--I felt it was old and lumpy. The pillows were too big for my taste. My friend, however, didn't have the same experience; she felt her mattress and pillow were as comfortable as it gets!

The concierge was helpful-- he tried finding out about our friend's flight when we didn't know any information about it, and he made our dinner reservations.

review.title: Central Location, Great Class
review.reviewText: The Palace is a very nice hotel. It has a very impressive lobby and is in a great location for transit and walking around. Very close to shopping if that is your interest. The only down fall to the location is that there are not a lot of restaurants in the near vicinity. It is about a 20 to 25 minute walk to Columbus Avenue where there are quite a few restaurants. The best way to get to Fisherman's Wharf is using the F line. The pool was a great addition to the Palace experience. I have two complaints with my room. I wish the bathroom was more modernized and my bed had a spring that made a noise every time I sat on it. Didn't notice it for sleeping or I would have complained. Overall I would recommend staying here.

review.title: VERY IMPRESSED
review.reviewText: We felt like we were really in a 'PALACE' while we were in the hotel. Excellent service, beautiful room, and gorgeous decor all around us. The Garden Room is especially wonderful to take in and to ber in with it's old world charm.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: We had a lovely time at the hotel.

review.title: Ideal choice of hotel in the San Francisce area.
review.reviewText: We've never been to San Francisco before and didn't have any idea of the best location or star rating for a place to stay so we decided to pick in the financial district and go with an older style that had been completely refurbished. We made an excellant choice and if we every went back, we'd pick the exact same hotel. Location was perfect and the place was beautiful. If you're staying any length of time and don't want to shell out the money for a taxi, all public transportation is within one block and it's only a short walking distance to the famous cable cars. If you would rather travel by taxi, there was always one just outside the door and never a wait. The Palace hotel is the place to stay while in San Francisco. Highly recommended for any traveler.

review.title: Great Hotel! Great Location!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Palace. The hotel has a lot of charm. There were plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice place, nice rate (on the weekend), good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Very pretty inside including the dining room (which we never ate at, nor did many other people). They're breakfast started at $26 a person, so we opted to walk a few blocks to eat breakfast at a nearby diner. As you may have already read, the parking is high ($46 high) as many hotels are in the area, but if you don't plan to drive your car much for a few days, there are other parking garages in the mid $20s to park at a few blocks away. The beds were comfortable however the rooms were a lacking a little ambiance. They used florescent light bulbs in the main lamps, so the most convenient lamps were never used, because the lights were so bright. Instead we had to climb over the bed to use the lamps on either side of the beds. The room is a little cramped for space for suitcases due to furniture placement. They could probably use a little more color on the walls as well. Less than a block away to get on the rail car. The concierge was very handy with local sightseeing info. Eitherway, it was still a nice place, nice rate (on the weekend), and a good location.

review.title: Nice Hotel in San Fran - too bad the weather didn't match
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is an excellent choice for those who want to be centrally located in San Fran. The building is well maintained with a beautiful interior. We did not eat at either of the three restaurants: Maxfields seemed busy enough in the evening, while the Japanese restaurant didn't appear to have any customers when we walked by. The courtyard restaurant (beautiful) was also not busy except for Easter Sunday brunch which was outrageously priced. The pool is clean and sufficient for a dip, while the fitness area and sauna were also very well maintained (the sauna looked brand new). The concierge service was great (we used it many times). Room was spacious and clean and the king bed was comfortable. We did a lot of walking from the hotel - to the Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf and also back through Chinatown, however there are bus stops within a block or two and trolleys also nearby. Union Square is a 10 minute walk. Walgreens is also nearby but hours vary. All in all, we would stay again and recommend this hotel. Hopefully you have better weather than us - 2 out of 3 days rain and highs of 11C/52F :(

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel

review.title: Needs refreshing
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a convenient location but needs serious updating. The rooms are small and dated. We also put the privacy sign on our door on our way out to dinner but housekeeping came in anyway and turned down the room.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The Palace is so elegant. The Garden Court ceiling and chandeliers are gorgeous. The bar at Maxfields is massive beautiful wood (the food was good, but the drinks pricey). The location is perfect with a BART stop right outside the door. We walked to Chinatown, through North Beach, to Union Square, and to the Ferry Building. The F trolley is right outside the door also to get to the Fisherman's Wharf. It is one of my favorite hotels in San Francisco.

review.title: Great change from the other side of Union Square
review.reviewText: Checked in with ease. The rooms are fine, not as luxurious as the pics led to believe. We wanted an exterior room for a view of Market, but ended up giving a better bathroom for it. Loved the excercise facilities... Good equipment, pool, etc... Very convenient to restaurants and shopping. We usually stay on the other side of the square and were pleasantly satisfied. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good stay at San Francisco's oldest hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is rather majestic and grand in its old feel. The rooms were of average size with extremely high ceilings. Flat screen TV and a refrigerator in the room were a pleasant surprise.

My view overlooked the building across the alley, so i had maybe 30 minutes of direct sun, so be sure to specify what view you want at check-in.

The location was perfect -- a nice walk down Market St. to the ferry terminal.

I would recommend this hotel as a place that you cant go wrong -- but its certainly not one of those new boutique hotels -- if that's what you are looking for.

review.title: WE LOVED IT BUT...
review.reviewText:
The hotel was excellent, luxury and convenience abound! Great location to just about everything a person could need in walking distance... The staff was super well trained and friendly.
The $7.99 an hour in room internet is a money grabbing joke. (it's free in the lobby with a password)
The $29.00 continental breakfast is way over priced! (the food was great and selection good, but a $78.00 tab before tip for two, really?!?)
The valet parking was much quicker than other hotels we've stayed at in the area, the price is about the same every where we've been as well, but there is no extra charge for in and outs. (which is very nice.)
The bar has a wicked Maxfield Parish mural, (not to be missed) but it felt like we were going to a wake and not out for drinks before a night on the town...

review.title: We will go back in the near future
review.reviewText: The service, the hotel, the people, the food, the decor everything was excellent and anytime we go back to SF we will stay there.

review.title: What a hidden gem!!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was perfect in every way! The service was exceptional -from the doorman's warm welcome to the Bellman's helpful attitude. The room was huge, immaculately clean & very quiet. The large bathroom was well stocked including plush towels. Charming hotel with huge wooden doors & windows that open. Absoutely perfect location!
Saturday brunch buffet in the beautiful Garden Court included a waiter that was exceptionally attentive to all our needs including our 3 grandchildren. We are seasoned travelers & place this hotel at the top of our list when we return for Chinese New Year next year!

review.title: Lovely ambience, lovely stay.
review.reviewText:
I have stayed in several different San Francisco hotels and this is my favorite. A direct trip in from the airport on the BART made access easy. It is also located an easy walk between my client's office in the financial area by Embarcadero and an evening walk to Union Square. The room and bath were large compared to most city hotels. I think I most appreciated the quiet of the rooms despite the hotel's location on busy Market Street.
The food at the bistro-style casual restuarant was excellent though the service was slow.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Very convenient place to enjoy downtown SF/China town/Union square. Indoor pool is great but Jacuzzi was so tiny to fit may be 6 people max. When we went to the pool, there were 4 people in the jacuzzi and we, four, were not able to join them because there was not enough space. Room was clean but it was also small... Since we were at 6th floor with nice view of city, we fortunately did not hear much noise from busy streets. Kids liked the nutcrackers that was displayed at in side of hotel's entrance. Will sure go back to this hotel next time.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay at the Palace. Great location- along the BART and right in the middle of the financial district. Lobby and dining room are simply opulent, if over priced. Room was clean and as advertised...very comfortable.

review.title: A Grand Old Lady of a Hotel.
review.reviewText: Arrival was 'interesting' as there was a city-wide protest occuring with hotel workers and this evening the Palace had been selected as the site to protest. While loud and somewhat distracting we considered it a part of life in the city. The Hotel staff were wonderful, quite courteous and friendly. Check in was quick and easy. Loved the "feel" of the Palace as soon as we walked in the door. The "old world charm" was quite comforting. Its location just off Market St was perfect for us. Bus and Trolley service to various areas of the city were "right there". Walking distance to Union Square and all the shopping one could want. Historic Ferry Building within sight of Market st. entrance. The breakfast buffet was great! A good selection of foods, pastries and fruits. Dinner at the Hotel was very good as well as the service. An after dinner stroll along Market St. made for a very pleasant evening. Our 2 night stay was all too short. Would we return? You bet!

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: We had a weekend getaway and enjoy the stay. The hotel is walking distance to many shopping areas including Chinatown. Walgreens are at every other block.

review.title: PALACE HOTEL IS DIVINE!
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel because it was near a conference I attended. It was a pure pleasure. The staff, the room, fitness center, location and the decor were all impeccable. The only downfall of the Palace Hotel is the Bar. Menu is uninspiring, service is uninspiring, not worth your time or money. Fortunately, there are several great dining spots within walking distance. Another great feature is that this hotel is right at a BART stop. I was at my hotel within 30 minutes of landing. For price, convenience, comfort...the Palace Hotel can't be beat. Its my new SF hotel.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace hotel is a beautiful old hotel. The rooms were large and very comfortable. It was also nice and quiet. The large dining room was beautiful with the glass ceiling. The food seemed a little overpriced but it is the City afterall. We were able to walk from the hotel to the theater with no problems. The only complaint I have is that we were charged $48.00 /day to park. I wish we would have known that ahead of time. Seemed a little outrageous! Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Excellent downtown hotel.
review.reviewText: Would stay there again if I wanted to be in the downtown area. Close to fishermens wharf and walking distance to chinatown.

review.title: San Francisco Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: This historical hotel in the heart of San Francisco was a VERY nice. I would recommend this classic hotel highly.

review.title: A wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: Everything about The Plaza exceeded our expectations. The staff and service were terrific. Enjoyed The Garden Court and Pied Piper bar. Very convenient location. Would definitely stay there again when traveling to San Francisco.

review.title: Best service anywhere.
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel is so wonderful. From the doormen to the concierge...just fabulous. Nice sized double double room, nicely appointed. (Free internet would be good though).

review.title: Great Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Have stayed there before and enjoyed it. It has a very good feeling and service is great. The room I had was a Jr Suite and it was lovely. My daughter had a deluxe King room and it too was good. We live in Napa and came to stay overnight for a performance. Was a fun trip.

review.title: Posh hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We chose the hotel for the central location and because there was good price discount. No complaints. We caught the train from the airport and the undergound station is right outside the hotel door ! We did not eat in the hotel but rather used it as a base for exploring other eating places and sights. The room was very nice (no view) and the staff helpful. We used the pool and sauna which were also good.

review.title: FANTASTIC CONCIERGE
review.reviewText:
After my initial dissatisfaction with the hotel (re check in). I soon forgot about it. This hotel is fabulous. I have stayed at many many 4 and 5 star hotels and this was is ranked up there. I liked how it was understated yet elegant.

Also, the concierge was absolutely fantastic.

review.title: nice hotel but service could be better.
review.reviewText: we enjoyed our stay, nice rooms, clean place and covenience location. one thing that really disappointed me was the fact that after we left i called (10 minutes after check out) the Lost and Found Department as i left behing my camera charger, my telephone charger and my blue-tooth device but the reseponse i received was quite surprising. The lady who answered the phone promised to call me back as soon as possible, this never happened. The next day i called again and denied speaking with me the day before as asked her why she did not call. once again i explained that i had left those items in my room, she once again asked for telephone number and premised to call me back in a few minutes, the call never came through. A few hours later i called back ask with update on her call back to which she replied that was extremely busy and that she did not have time to look into it. i just gave up, very disappointing way of handling a guest request regardless of the items left behind. This type of behavior/customer service influence greatly on selecting a hotel. One of the facts i check when selecting a hotel is people's reviews and comments, this influence me greatly on my decision on selecting a hotel. People who travel for pleasure expects to have best of times and not encounter this type of customer service on services we pay for. Although it is a great place i would not stay there again.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: Palace Hotel is very centrally located and right beside BART station so travel from airport is very easy and reasonable. All staff were very friendly and in particular conscierge were most helpful in helping book great day trip and sort out some flight issues. Japanese Restaurant (part of hotel building) is excellent and very comfortable for solo traveller.

review.title: Best Martini in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel was all it was advertised to be and more. The staff were very friendly, especially Joel, the bar tender in the Pied Piper, he made a great martini and introduced us to the Gimlet made with Cucumber Vodka. Now we just have to find the Vodka back home!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Super charming, comfortable but small rooms, great bar, great ambiance, nice staff, good packages (check out the Hockey weekend for two!). Didn't try the restaurant but the menu looked good.

review.title: Bay Area Brilliance
review.reviewText:
This is a stunning hotel in one of the best cities in the world. Best of all, there are free guided tours of the hotel with knowledgeable guides who show you a lot of the 'behind the scenes' rooms etc. and finishing with a superb lunch. When coupled with Expedia's fantastic prices, you cannot go wrong!
Great location - walking distance to Union square and the Embarcadero (Pier 39 about half an hour's walk). Right next to main transport links too.
Highly recommend using Caltrain to watch San Jose Sharks at HP Pavilion and SF 49ers at Candlestick Park for all you sports fans.
Pier 39 has superb restaurants esp. for seafood - Fog Harbour and Crab House are really impressive. Try Cioppino, Dungeness Crab, Seafood platter, Roasted Garlic crab, Killer crab...the list goes on.

review.title: A nice, quiet hotel
review.reviewText:
The Palace Hotel is in a great location and because it was built back when walls had some real substance the rooms are very quiet. We chose The Palace because of the indoor pool which turned out to be a disappointment for the kids. It is very small and was quite cold. The hotel is listed as pet friendly but the high, non-refundable pet charge is really not too friendly. Fortunately there are some coffee shops nearby as there is no in-room coffee and the room service charges are extremely high. There is a very lovely restaurant off the lobby which we had hoped to enjoy but the only option for breakfast is the buffet which is a bit much if one only wants coffee and toast.
If you are looking for a hotel with lovely turn of the century decor and nice, quiet rooms The Palace is a great alternative to the hotels on the hill.

review.title: Will stay again!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very classy and elegant...the bed is very comfortable...Super location...next to the BART station. The hotel concierge is extremely patient and helpful...took time to answer the recommend the places to go see and dine. And, they even called the restaurant for us so that we will get a table during X'mas day.

The only thing I'm not really happy about is that when we checked in, there is a complimentary water bottle in the room...however, during the following days of our stay, no free water is given, not sure what's the reason...

review.title: Bonnie's Best Bet!
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel was everything I expected from a major landmark in San Francisco. The restaurants were gorgeous, food was wonderful (espcially at their Japanese styled restaurant). The Pied Piper Bar was very comfortable and the bar staff were extremely nice. The hotel was everything I expected for a luxury hotel. The location was outstanding and within easy walking distance of China Town, and the cable car stop was right outside the door making it easy and highly affordable to get to Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. I will definitely return to the Palace!

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Arrival went smoothly, room was comfortable. Upon returning in the early evening of day two the room had not been serviced. When calling Housekeeping they informed me that I had displayed "Do Not Disturb" sign on door. This was definately not the case. Housekeeping and Room service attended within 15 minutes we found situation intrusive. Check out was fine.

review.title: Great historical San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great rates for such a nice historical hotel in San Francisco, everything is perfect!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was top class, everything was fantastic - location, room. Hotel is close to sights and public transport.

review.title: pretty good stay
review.reviewText: I had a very nice room. It was comfortable and clean, with a nice tv. Too bad there is no longer mini bars in hotel rooms, it was missed. There was no view, but the room was so nice it didn't matter. I was on the third floor and had a bigger room, so that was the trade off. My friends on the 8th floor had a great view. The bed was great and the tv was nice. The towels weren't as soft or large as I would have liked and I expected more quality in the towels for the price of the room. The car park service was terrible -- we had to wait about 30 minutes for our car to be returned, and it came at a heavy price. If you can find a nearby carpark, it will be a lot faster.

review.title: Service and room not worth the money
review.reviewText: Beautiful 1st floor in good location. Rooms were not worth the price. Parking $50/day and slow internet at $20/day in addition to daily room rate.

review.title: It is a Palace
review.reviewText:
The Palace Hotel was great. It is old & historic but very well maintained. The services were wonderful, conceirge & doorman always helpful providing directions & advise on where to eat, things to do..
Did not eat in the hotel restaurants, they were very expensive, but lots of good restaurants in the area.
Good location with easy access to public transit.
This is right in the downtown core, so it's close to everything, the only down side is that there are lots of street people these days.
For the price, it was a great deal.

review.title: The most beautiful hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Palace is lovely, the dining room stunning, the location ideal, and Maxfield's bar a gem. We stay there whenever we can.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful

review.title: Upscale, Convenient
review.reviewText: We stayed in a suite as this was my husband's 50th birthday and it was very nice. Maybe not as plush as I'd pictured, but still very nice, and keep in mind this is an historic hotel so amenities are not as modern. Always cleaned no matter what time of day we left. The bar is very nice, but extremely expensive ($14 for one small cocktail). We also thought from the photos that the pool was rooftop. It was actually on the 4th floor of a middle building, so it did have a glass ceiling, but it wasn't on the 9th floor. The internet was expense ($7.99/hour) and parking was a whopping $50/day. Very convenient and safe location. There were tons of stores and only a few blocks from the cable car turnaround and China town, so ideally located.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel - wouldn't hesitate to go back
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay there and found the interior of the hotel (especially the atrium dining room) beautiful. The room was clean and comfortable, not overly large but we spent alot of time enjoying this lovely city and not siting in our room. Very friendly staff and a superb location for walking everywhere. We had a drink one night in the hotel bar and found it too expensive but there are many other places to have a drink other than there. Same as for breakfast...just get on Market St. for a better selection at a better price. A word to the wise, if you are planning to take a tour to Alcatraz inquire and book your ticket as soon as you get to San Francisco. We put it off to the day before we left thinking that it was off season and we were not able to secure a place. Oh well, next time because we will be back

review.title: Not impressed, I truely expected more
review.reviewText: With all the history and reputation the Palace Hotel in San Francisco was a huge letdown. Our room was small, situated directly over the main entrance so was noisy all night and day, the paint on the 14' ceiling was peeling. But my biggest regret, the pool and spa were unusable, at least to my health standards.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is celebrating 100 years and it looks it. This hotel needs major upgrades. The pub was fine, but the bartender couldn't get a simple like Rhum and Ginger (what we got was something I've never heard of) which cost $13. a drink, and they closed at 10 pm. The hotel has NO vending machine, so if you are thirsty or want something to snack on you have to order room service (a pop is $5 plus a $5 service charge for room service). The garden room restaurant is amazing to sit in, but the food way too expensive. On our last night there the hotel staff went on Strike in the middle on the night, keeping all guests awake throughout the night. Would stay at a more modern hotel next time.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Palace hotel is in the perfect location. Short walking distance to the heart of San Francisco. Located near Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf. Very convenient access to BART station (literally right outside hotel doors) which takes you directly to San Francisco International Airport. The hotel is older, but very elegant and well maintained. Some of the rooms are a bit small. Only downside, do not eat at the hotel's restaurants as they are very expensive. The upside is that there are numerous restaurants, pubs and bakeries within a few blocks of the hotel. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great location, close to union square
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco. It is a five minute walk to Union Square. The neighbourhood is safe, and filled with restaurants and shops. I chose this hotel because of the convienence to the Bart system. The stop closest to the Hotel is Montgomery, which is steps away from the hotel. The hotel itself is very grand with a beautiful lobby. The hotel room itself was lovely as well, with nice high ceiling and furnishings. The bed was comfortable. The only complaint I had was the cleanliness of the washroom, the floor looked dirty.
