As well, the walls are pretty thin, I could hear a child throwing a tantrum above me, as well as hear people conversing while walking down the hall. But that is to be expected with an older hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel in the future, because of its proximity to the Bart system and Union Square. Check out Pasta Bene on Kearny street, awesome food and staff!

review.title: Felt like kings & queens (not drag)
review.reviewText: Shear Opulence. Beautiful foyer/lobby. Nice little Sushi Restaurant attached to hotel. The hotel main restaurant looks fantastic but we didn't eat there so i can't comment on the food. Very close to high end shopping, tour bus start, transport system. Loved it!!

review.title: classic hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 6 days,a big suprise when we walked up the stairs from the bart station,the hotel entrance is right there.Good central location,walking distance to most spots,union sq..chinatown...etc.We skipped buffet breakfast and opted for mels diner2 blocks away,dont bother with dennys diner,not in the same league.Room had no tea or coffee facilities,a bit behind the times,although if you want a cup of warm expresso 5.30 am in lobby.we stayed on 4 th floor,walls not the thickest,we could hear a lady close by laughing at 2am.turned on shower in bathroom ,force nearly shot me through aforementioned wall,great pressure great shower.staff a delight,nice hotel.

review.title: Classic SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Palace Hotel is centrally located to shopping in Union Square and the Ferry Building. The service was really great here-- everyone was very helpful and willing to offer help where they could. I've been to afternoon tea at this hotel and the area where tea is served is one of the most beautiful hotel areas that I have ever been in. My biggest complaint is that I felt like the beds were not upgraded. Being part of the Starwood luxury collection, I had high expectations for a fabulous bed. The beds, instead, felt a little springy. Overall, it was a nice hotel and I had a pleasant stay.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is a San Francisco fixture. It was supposed to be the "Titanic" of hotels until 1906...it did burn, though. But, it was rebuilt and is very elegant. The service staff is excellent and always puts your needs first. Although it is older with lots of charm, if you want brand spanking new and shiny, this is not your place. The location is good - close to all forms of SF transportation. We had a corner suite which had lots of windows. The views are only of other buildings though - can't see the bay or anything. All in all a pleasant stay and we would consider going back on another trip.

review.title: would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: loved this hotel! so close to everything we wanted to do, union square, fisherman's wharf. The BART station was right outside the side entrance which was great since we didn't rent a vehicle. Took it everywhere, even to Oakland to see a ball game. The room was lovely and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Would recommend it to anybody.

review.title: Technology Disaster
review.reviewText: I can stay at any Days Inn and get easy, free wireless internet from my room or anywhere in the hotel. The Palace in-room materials give you no information on the internet. When you inquire, you find it is very expensive in your room but free in the lobby with a password. I then had to ask two people and call IT support to get a password that worked for me. And the lobby is full of people with laptops. It is the 21st century!!

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: very intresting ration price/services, very good location, quite

review.title: In the End, Everything We Could've Hoped For
review.reviewText: Our stay was everything we could have hoped for--great rooms, excellent service, convenient location. Although there were some initial missteps with the room assignments for my family, the hotel staff quickly and politely gave us new rooms. Moreover, the entire staff--to a one--was notably pleasant, efficient, responsive. The rooms themselves were immaculate, comfortable, and pleasant, classy without being pretentious or trendy. The sizes varied quite a lot. The street-facing handicapped room was enormous, but kind of noisy (even for noise-hardened New Yorkers like us). Some of the bathrooms had fancier showers than others, but all were very nice. We enjoyed the indoor pool, but the room was freezing and the Jacuzzi was a bit rundown.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: Its Great and Grand, in the heart of the CityCenter. Can't imagin a better place to stay in SanFrancisco.

review.title: Excellent luxury hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: If you like a European style hotel, this is the one for you. Beautiful chandeliers, mirrored ballrooms, and painted ceilings are some of the highlights. The location was fantastic: close to Union Square and 2 blocks away from the best shopping. Overall - a wonderful experience! Would book again!

review.title: One of San Fransico's historic gems
review.reviewText: Elegent,100 year old Hotel that has maintained it's original status as a grande hotel

review.title: Superb Value
review.reviewText: Great place to stay.The staff are excellent.Breakfast is expensive,I had mine in a bakery round the corner.

review.title: Everything perfect but...
review.reviewText: The location was ideal; the room was excellent; the shower was great; the pool was fun; the price was right. However, the evening noise level from the neighbouring room was much too high for a hotel of this category. Suggest you ask specifically for a quiet room. Will go back next trip and do that.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 4 days and was definitely not disappointed with the room as it was clean and very comfortable, with ample room to move about. The hotel is in a great location and I would certainly recommend the Palace to all visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is lovely. +Great access to BART & Muni. However, my 9-year old daughter did not like having to walk past the crazies & beggers on Mission st. Pool atrium is great. Free coffee in lobbey in am.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Perfect for a romantic getaway! Visit Sonoma Valley for a day in wine country.

review.title: Palace Oppulance
review.reviewText: This is a Grand Hotel - no kidding. It's also right at the Montgomery Bart stop, so no need to rent a car. My only beef is the intermittant lobby wireless. I really think a hotel like this should spring for wireless in all rooms. The hotel is perfect 1910 style and reminded me of the sets in the Titanic movie. It is unbeleivably comfortable and we slept very well. Coffee is available in the lobby until 8:30 am and there is a magnificent, if expensive breakfast in the Courtyard. Also, there is a pool at the Palace which is rare in San Fran hotels. We love this hotel! I look forward to staying there again for our next trip.

review.title: Grand old San Francisco tradition
review.reviewText: The Palace is still gracious and lovely.The appointments in the room were very nice and the bedding luxurious. Room was clean and the air conditioner worked quietly and efficiently. We had to use the air cond. because the windows, although they do open, only allow about 3 inches of space. Also keep in mind that The Palace sits at Market and New Montgomery and it's always noisy so next time I will request an inside room. The Garden Court buffet was excellent, if not quite so sumptuous as it once was. All the staff, from concierge to waiters to parking valets were attentive and extremely helpful. Our last stay was for four nights. We'll be back soon.

review.title: Palace: A Dowager Who Has Been Maintained Beautifully
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful old hotel with wide hallways and big rooms with high ceilings. It is well located and well maintained. There are no daily newspapers delivered to one's door (maybe you can pay for this service?) and no semblance of security in terms of access to the hotel elevators and no in-room coffee service. But it is close to everything, including BART, Starbucks, streetcar, etc. and very clean.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel was the first stop on our holiday. Located above the BART system, it was an easy connection from the airport. The service was efficient. The room was spacious and clean. Location great for the first time travelers to San Francisco. We would go back to stay anytime!

review.title: A typical high star hotel with little personality
review.reviewText: This hotel lives up to it's name. It is palatial in the communnal areas and in size. We can't fault the hotel service, especially the concierge - who aptly dealt with four customers at once! However, the gym receptionist didn't understand very much English, which was frustrating. Our room was next to the elevator area which meant we were often disturbed by the voices of people coming in and out of the lift during the night. The swimming pool was too cold to use, but the spa was warm enough. The gym was also adequate. As the hotel is so huge we simply felt part of the rat race and not a valued customer. If you like large, ostentatious hotels - this is the place for you. If you prefer personal service - pick somewhere else.

review.title: Classic Hotel
review.reviewText: It's a great hotel, we stayed for 6 nights recently. Cannot fault the cleanliness. Reception was helpful in relocating to a more brighter room on the front section of the hotel. The rooms are not as sound-proof, so was disturbed by next door fro the last 3 nights of our stay. Very central so great place if you aresight-seeing. The concierge service is great for arranging local tours. Definitely recommend. Oh loved the swimming pool and jacuzzi on the 4th floor (though wasn't sign posted so did not locate it until our last night).

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is conveniently located by the Montgomery Street Bart and Muni stations. The service and facilities at the Palace were 1st class all the way. We enjoyed the tour of the hotel. We were close to Union Square, Chinatown and the financial area without the scourge of Tenderloin.

review.title: Classic !
review.reviewText: This hotel is located very closed to union square and Bart. It is so convenient for tourists who want to spend time in downtown and main attractions of San Francisco. The hotel is classic. The room is clean and quiet. service is also very nice. I will stay here again if I go to SF.

review.title: a classic, nice, with quality - yet expensive
review.reviewText: had a great stay. centrally located to everything. lots of shopping near by, and restaurants. there is also a great bar around the corner called Daves which has cheap prices and good food. I would recommend this to all travellers. the only reason i gave the hotel a 4/5 on overall satisfaction is because room service and food was over priced. you cant go wrong with this place.

review.title: Simply The Best.
review.reviewText: Everything perfect all the time. Congratulations!

review.title: Beautiful hotel!! Can't wait to go back!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. It was luxurious, clean, beautiful, the staff was very helpful and always friendly. The food was top quality although expensive. A first class experience all the way around. And the location was perfect, right in the middle of everything. Our room had cement walls, so it was always quiet. Besides the occassional horn honk or siren from the street below, the room was silent and relaxing. That was very impressive to me. We stayed in a Junior Suite on the 5th floor.

review.title: Ease and Comfort
review.reviewText: Very comfortable rooms, beautiful pool. Missed coffee in the morning as weekdays it is only served till 8:30 and there is no in room coffee pot. The location was fantastic to get around to all the sights and shoppping easily. The BART drops you off literally in front of the hotel from the airport and all of the major bus/streetcars/cablecars run within a block or 2.

review.title: Loved it! Loved! Loved it!
review.reviewText: Absolutely loved this hotel primarily because of the beauty and character. The smell of the roses when you walk in the entrance is marvelous. The staff is incredible and we loved the location. Too bad the hot tub isn't bigger and the restaurant prices aren't lower but those are minor things. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: As Good as It Gets
review.reviewText: Sumptuous in every respect. Wonderfully located for sightseeing, shopping, dining etc. Could have spent all my time happily in this hotel as it is an oasis of comfort.

review.title: Clean & comfortable room, great location
review.reviewText: Will stay here again (see review title). The pool & workout room were nice, all equipment worked fine. Sauna was great too.

review.title: Awesome. hotel, awesome location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. so close to union square, and all the great shopping!!!!! Great hospitable service and tourist info from concierge, couldn't help you enough!!! Rooms big and immaculate. Definitely would stay here again!!!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel was fantastic! All staff we spoke with were very knowledgable and willing to help!

review.title: Prime Location, Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace is a beautiful hotel, transit super close, we absolutly loved staying here. The staff were very friendly, the fitness room is one of the best I've seen in a hotel. The hottub could use replacing, but the atrium pool is beautiful. We stayed for a week and would definitly go back again.

review.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: A fine historical hotel with updated luxury, the Carriage Room remains beautiful and the historical bar and drinks are fabulous. Location right downtown, it is convenient to many City attractions on foot and to public transportation. Though the valet parking was convenient, it was expensive at $48/day, as was in-room wireless service.

review.title: Palace Hotel-Decent, Many Nice Features
review.reviewText: Room was small. Charge for internet hook-up in room was $16.99. This is outrageous when many less expensive hotels offer it for free. Parking charge of $48 per day was competitive for the Union Square San Francisco area. Hotel is clean and very well maintained. Free Wi-Fi was available in lobby.

review.title: What a great hotel!
review.reviewText: My wife and I just came back from our first trip to San Francisco. It was also our 25th anniversary. We had high hopes for this hotel and they were met and exceeded. What a great hotel. It was picture perfect and I can't say enough good about the staff. We honestly have nothing but praise for this wonderful hotel. When we go back to SF there is no doubt where we will stay.

review.title: Nice older hotel.
review.reviewText: Our room overlooked the inside of the building so their was no view whatsoever. The room was simple, high ceilings, no frills. Nice TV ....4.oo water unless you asked the maid for one. The bathroom had some heavy wooden blinds that you couldn't lift. The shower doubled as a small bath. Bathroom very small. The mural in the bar was impressive. Too pricey to eat. Close to Bart station. In the business district so absolutely nothing to eat Sunday morning except Starbucks.

review.title: A delightful stay!
review.reviewText: Three nights in this luxury hotel spoiled us. Great friendly service, and very comfortable beds. Every morning, concierge needed some extra help, so plan to wait in line to ask your questions and get directions. Very knowledgeable and patient. Although the breakfast was pricey, food was delicious and fresh.

review.title: a great Hotel.
review.reviewText: The perfect balance of old and classy with all the necessities new and funtional without being cheap and tacky

review.title: Had a good time but could have been much better with better service
review.reviewText: Service at this luxury hitel is way below comparable standards. For example, our rooms were not made up by 6 pm the first day of our stay. We had to call management to get them made up. What is also disappointing is the quality of food. Despite the exellent architecture and ambiance of the hotel, the food itself (buffet breakfast) was rather bad. Everything was cooked with a very sweet butter that left a bad taste in your mouth. With better service (they seem to be understaffed) and better food service, this hotel can be a jewel!! Bad we staill had a great time.

review.title: Palatial!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. I took the advice of other reviewers and upgraded to a room overlooking Market St. Well worth the extra. Spacious, airy room with a very comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. The state of the public areas was very high too - the lounge is a gorgeous froth of grandeur. Wish we could have afforded to have eaten there. My partner really appreciated his daily swim in the great swimming followed by padding down to the lobby in his dressing gown for a complimentary cup of great coffee from the lobby. His idea of heaven! Bless! The only niggle was the concierge service. Maya was fantastic and went the extra mile but the rest of the concierge desk were unhelpful, sarcastic and grumpy.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: Our Palace stay was a wonderful experience. The location was convenient, facilities were wonderful, the room comfortable, and the hotel staff were very helpful. We look forward to our next stay.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying at the palace. The bar was a fun spot and the room was good. We would stay again.

review.title: Pleasant but be warned
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine but the rooms are dated. It is centrally located and extremely convenient for public transportation. There was no fridge, nor was there a tea/coffee maker in the room. The walls are paper thin and our room wasn't cleaned properly on one day. The biggest shock was the breakfast charge. $31 US for a buffet that was mediocre. Nothing could be made to order and the selection was small. Having said that, what was there was excellent. The staff were pleasant and helpful and I would go back but try to find somewhere else to eat breakfast. The little breakfast places close by sold nothing but fast food so would need to venture a bit further afield.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel was a lovely example of old style charm with modern plumbing, electric etc. Perfectly located in San Francisco and the staff was friendly and helpful. Rank right up there wuth the very best.

review.title: Nice but needs facelit
review.reviewText: Elegant hotel but time for some paint as you can see the wear and tear. Rooms are comfortable and clean but bathroom too small no counter space. If an overall facelit is done this hotel will be excellent.

review.title: Lovely elegance
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed every minute.. and the free hotel tour was very delightful with history notes. Liked the garden restaurant in the beautiful glass domed main room, and got a kick out of seeing the tops of buildings through another glass dome as I swam and jacuzzied on the 4th floor. Great location for getting the big city feeling with many charming galleries, bookstores, shops, inexpensive eating cafes right outside. Lovely room, cheerful staff...Great place!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located in SF Financial District, walking distance from Mall and Union Square shopping and AT&T Ballpark. "Market View" leaves a little to be disired, but still a very nice hotel for a very fair rate.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel with a lot of history. I would definetly recommend this hotel. Great location - close to downtown shopping and tourist attractions.

review.title: Beautifully Renovated Historical Jewel
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located near Union Square and great shopping and dining, yet is quiet and dignified. It is well maintained and elegant. Our room was spacious and nicely decorated with traditional furnishings. The Maxfield Parrish mural in the bar and the beautiful public spaces were a special treat that only a landmark building can offer.

review.title: The Best
review.reviewText: Everything you would expect in a Luxury Hotel, plus a lot of interesting and fun San Francisco history. Take the hotel tour put on by the Library as it's fascinating. The hotel itself is beautiful.

review.title: Palace Hotel A+ World-class Hotel
review.reviewText: I always stay at the Palace Hotel when i'am in San Francisco. Great service, Amazing staff. Great location in the city. A+ Quality,Clean and Comfortable.

review.title: Beautiful Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful. I normally don't really care about old buildings, but this hotel was built in the 1800's and recently remodeled while keeping all of the architectural detail that made it great in the first place! We were right in the middle of the city--close to everything and able to get to public transportation very easily also. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms very spacious and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a beautiful spot in a beautiful city like San Francisco! Check it out!

review.title: Loved this palace, uh, place!
review.reviewText: We had such fun, the hotel room was fabulous and the Pied Piper bar was very user friendly. The public transportation is right outside the door with easy access to all areas.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location, with lots of different restaurants nearby. We liked the free "coffee bar" available each morning in the lobby, and the checkout process was very quick!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: beware of long distance calls from room. posted prices are totally bogus!

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Palace Hotel. The staff was friendly and helped us with booking tours during our stay. Our room was clean. The location is great for shopping and is a 15 minute cable car ride from Fisherman's Wharf. The Palace seemed to cater more to adults and business travelers as there were limited activities for children. I would stay there again provided my children were not with me.

review.title: Impressive at First, But A Little Rundown
review.reviewText: The Good: The lobby and dining room are very impressive and very picture-worthy. The rooms are nice enough and clean. We really appreciated the workout facilities, the free morning coffee and apples. The Bad: The pool was dirty. We were disappointed that the hottub and sauna were not working. They claimed that a guest had damaged the equipment and parts had been ordered. I asked for a discount and the manager said they couldn't be held responsible for a guest's actions. They said that they had an agreement with the W (two blocks away) and that we could use their facilities which we did, but this was hardly as convenient. We skipped the $35/person breakfast. See my Traveler's tip. We were disappointed that in-room internet cost money ($15/day if I remember correctly).

review.title: Not what it was cracked up to be...
review.reviewText: The Palace was a nice all round hotel. Conveniently located, and a classy higher-end hotel... but not much else to write home about. Issues we had with this hotel include: (1) questionable stain on one of the bed pillows (2) in-room internet did not work properly, and the hotel claimed that the charges would be removed from the bill, but they ended up charging for it anyway (3)small flood in the hall outside of the room (4) hotel seems to nickel and dime you for everything... including replenishing the mini shampoo and conditioners in the room.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: Excellent stay at hotel. Wonderful room, a real treat. 5 mins from Union Square but far away not to be too close. Could hear some road traffic as we had a Market view room...do not really need this view as out and about all day long. Jacuzzi and Sauna were lovely and pool a good size. Breakfast in hotel was scrummy, bit pricey at $28 each, but did endulge on our last day, fabulous breakfast buffet.Concierge were exceptionally helpful, they made our 10 day trip very enjoyable 10/10 there.

review.title: This Iconic San Francisco Hotel Really Delivers
review.reviewText: This is my first stay at The Palace Hotel, San Francisco. I have been in the public rooms before, particularly the Garden Court (one of the most beautiful dining rooms on the planet, I believe) and the magical Maxfield's Pied Piper bar. The great transverse promenade features many historical artifacts from the Hotel's 100+ years. It is worth stopping to see them all. Our room was very clean and the two standard size beds were extra comfy! The bathroom was clean and "full service", as well. My only off-note is that the toilet tank had a very slight, very slow leak which caused a bit of a "puddle" on the bathroom floor. I reported it to the front desk and it was handled immediately! Overall, this hotel is a San Francisco Icon on every level. The location on Market Street next to the Montgomery Street BART/Muni station & "F-Line" stop (vintage street cars) is a huge plus. You can walk everywhere within the nearby Union Square, SOMA, Embarcadero areas. The hotel is very convenient. SFMOMA is right around the block! Stay here, if you get the chance. You won't be disappointed!

review.title: What does it take to get service and help at the Palace Hotel?
review.reviewText: We decided to spend our 30th anniversary at the Palace Hotel because of past wonderful memories. There were so many incidences lacking customer service. First, the t.v. didn't work. We called 2x before "the engineer" came 2 hrs. later to tell us a plug needs to be wiggled. Second, we paid the internet fee (which we didn't mind). I called to ask if we could plug in another computer to the cable without paying another fee and was told yes. When we plugged in the other it said we had to pay another fee. $40. a night for internet is excessive. Next, the sink was plugged up to overflowing. I called to have them unplug it and told them that we had reservations to go to dinner. No one came. I went to the front desk upset about the lack of response and their reply was that the hotel was full. Someone came while we were at dinner and left wet towels on the floor. That night a sorry note with a coupon for a free breakfast was placed under our door. The next evening we called for a wine bottle-opener 2x within 2 hrs. and no one came. I finally went to the hotel bar where the bartender gave me the opener and two wine glasses to replace the plastic ones in room. 4 hours later someone knocked with the bottle-opener! The service was deplorable and unresponsive. The staff answering questions was uneducated about how things work in the rooms. It felt like we were staying at a $50. budget hotel.

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Grand old hotel with convenient location - walkable to Ferry Bldg, Union Sq., Museum district (wear very comfortable shoes).

review.title: Great hotel at expedias great price with airfare
review.reviewText: They should provide coffee all morning in the lobby instead of just a couple of hours. Nice free bottled water in room. Pool should be open until 11pm for vacationers...open later in morning instead.

review.title: Beautiful older hotel
review.reviewText: We had a very comfortable stay. While our needs were modest, they were easily and pleasantly met by the staff. We would stay there again and would recommend it to our adult friends.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was great. Location was perfect for Union Square, Ferry Building and other spots. I requested early check-in (noon) and they were more than happy to accommodate me. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Always wanted to stay at The Palace Hotel!
review.reviewText: I have been to San Francisco many times on business, but never had the opportunity to experience the Palace Hotel, which is why we decided to stay there for a recent vacation. Thanks to Expedia, we obtained an incredible price break on the room. The location of the Palace is great (you can take BART from the airport), the rooms are nice, the indoor pool was a wonderful experience and you can walk to nearby restaurants, shops and the cable car turn-around, which will take you to various spots in the city, as well as Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: First Class All The Way
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel was outstanding, service was excellent.Try the Japanese Resturant, very good and the Pied Piper Bar excellent as well.We were both very happy we chose this hotel for our last night in San Fransico.

review.title: Impressive & Enjoyable!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed the location and amenities this hotel offered. Right in the heart of the Financial District and walking distance to an incredible amount of fun and activities, this hotel offered great service. We strongly recommend this place to anybody looking for great location and service.

review.title: Good experience except for the Concierges
review.reviewText: A true SF hotel. A Beautiful and glamorous icon. The staff was exceptional except for both the female and male concierges. No one was there except for me and I spent several minutes waiting before either even acknowledged me. The women then sent us to a restaurant which was the total opposite of what we were looking for. Not good!

review.title: Fabulous hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful location and accommodations. A bit pricey, but worth it.

review.title: Excellent Place to Stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were fairly spacious, and the bathroom was nice and large. The hotel itself is beautifully restored and in a great location. Easy to get around the city from there. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay a great one. They were always eager to help or give advice and cabs were lined up in front to take you anywhere you wanted. Overall a great experience.

review.title: birthday stay
review.reviewText: i have always wanted to stay at this hotel since the first time i walked into it about 12 years ago when i lived in sf. i have since moved from sf to los angeles and decided to go back to sf for my birthday. i was extremely pleased that i received such a great rate. even better when i checked in they upgraded my room without even asking or saying it was my birthday. the room was very spacious and comfortable. the only negative was on the first night i had drinks at the pied piper bar and they allow you to go back to your room with your drinks if you want so i did but the next day when it was cleaned they did not take the glasses out. i checked in on a saturday night so the glasses were still in my room on monday when i checked out. other than that it is a very beautiful hotel that is rich with history.

review.title: Great time at the Palace
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our recent stay at the Palace Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel was beautiful, and the location was very convenient. The room was a bit stuffy the first night, but after we reset the thermostat we were comfortable.

review.title: Perfect for a weekend getaway
review.reviewText: One of the BEST in SF for children...After checking in, we hit the pool and spa where my son proved he is still part fish!

review.title: Nice place- service not so good
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. It was beautiful. The room was small, but charming and comfortable. The room service was expensive.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The Staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was large and very nice. We cannot wait to stay there again!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: This was our first time staying at the Palace. Everything was wonderful. Our room was gorgeous and very clean. The pool was great for the kids. And all of the staff was very courteous. Will go back again!

review.title: Much more than expected
review.reviewText: Excelent in terms of arquitecture, lobby, service overall and room service. They showed their touch of class, when I complained about an extremely noisy neighbor, and next day they apologized sending a letter and a tray with wounderful wine, cheeses and fruit. Dont miss this hotel, elegant,spacious, a piece of San Francisco history. Best Location: close to Union Square,Westfield Mall, Shops, dinning, Museums, Cable car,BART.

review.title: Lovely.
review.reviewText: There is nothing like sipping a martini and nibbling a cheese plate under a Maxfield Parrish mural. The mahogany wood and plush carpets pulled together the effect of the Victorian Era. Kudos to the glass ceiling pool. Good water pressure in the shower. Coffee is offered by the check-in desk during the morning. Easy walk to the AT&T ball park - but do NOT stop into O'Neill's before the game. Overall, the hotel was great!

review.title: Nice pool
review.reviewText: Nice pool and jacuzzi on rooftop and good size room.

review.title: Lived up to our expectations!
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the Sheraton Palace! We arrived on Bart which had a station right outside the Hotel. The only issue we had on our three night stay was that the room we had on the top floor was extremely noisy. It sounded like it was a very noisy air conditioning unit. We asked to be moved and Miriam at the front desk was very helpful and gracious. We had breakfast in the Garden Court restaurant and the service and food were excellent.The indoor pool looked beautiful and inviting. The location is perfect and it is within walking distance of many attractions...Union Square, Chinatown, the Farmers Market at the Ferry Building etc.

review.title: Wonderful hotel,wonderful location
review.reviewText: This hotel is fantastic. It has a beautiful pool and the rooms are clean, roomy and gorgeous. Also, it is located near Union Square and the Ferry Building. Also, I left my coat in the closet and they were very responsive in sending it to me.I'll definitely stay here everytime I go to SF.

review.title: A Step Back in Time
review.reviewText: Hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco, providing quick walking access to all the major shopping chains, start of the Market/Powell cable car station and many bars/restaurants within the vincinity. Inside the hotel it is like stepping back in time... large and high ceilinged corridors, unobtrusive staff (but available when you require them), lovely pool in an atrium area on the 4th floor giving the feeling of actually being outdoors and a bar/eating area that gives the ambience of a private clubhouse. Rooms were excellent with a fridge to stock yourself rather than with overpriced in-house drinks/snacks etc... Would definately recommend to anyone taking a break or on business in San Francisco. Would not hesitate to go back to this hotel again.

review.title: One of San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: This hotel has been well taken care of. The Garden Room is beautiful and a wonderful place to have morning coffee. It is within walking distance to a number of attractions. If you don't like to walk Bart is right outside the door. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Luxury for a great price
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is beautiful, vintage looking, but completely renovated. It was a great stay and I am booking it again for my next business meeting in San Francisco! I would love for them to consider free wireless internet as that is fast becoming the norm for business travelers.

review.title: Awsome Character Hotel Truely Magnificant
review.reviewText: If you want to experience the grace and luxury of a truely historic hotel. The Palace is definitely the place to stay. All well situated to business district and shopping. All round perfect place to stay as the rates are low for the quality of the accomodations

review.title: Grand, older hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace is located ajacent to the Montgomery BART station so couldn't be more convenient when going to or from SFO. Rooms are relatively small but the high ceilings help make them more attractive. The atrium courtyard is a special place for brunch or just dining in general as is the wood paneled bar and dining room nearby. A wonderful older hotel that hasn't lost its charm--and, at the Expedia price, a great value. Also close to Moscone Convention Center, the Warf area and Financial district, Union Square.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: I love the Palace where I always feel like a Princess. My favorite is swimming in the pool, looking up at the skyline. Being indoors, the pool is enjoyable even when the weather is cool.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful. Location is perfect, spa, pool and hot tub excellent. Food very good but expensive.

review.title: Brilliantly situated
review.reviewText: Hotel: grand public rooms, bedrooms rather bland but perfectly adequate. Brilliantly positioned for China Town, restaurants, shops, museums and best of all a $5.35 train ride direct from the airport almost to the hotel's door.

review.title: It's all about location...
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel while hosting a guest who had never visited SF. We were a little disappointed with the size of the room/bathroom. I wasn't surprised considering I've stayed at other historic hotels in the area and had the same experience. The hotel is beautiful and is within walking distance to many sites. You will also save plenty on cab fare as it is centrally located to many attractions. The number one reason why I chose this hotel was because it was so close to Union Square. If you are a shopper, this is the place for you!

review.title: Extremely happy with the Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to San Francisco for a long getaway weekend. We chose the Palace Hotel based on star rating, price and reviews of this hotel and couldn't have more pleased with our choice. The hotel was very beautiful, clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend it.

review.title: Better is available
review.reviewText: The Hotel was nice but... We were looking for true luxury and this hotel was'nt it. The pool was nice. The service was truly great. But I wanted more and for the price I expected more; better linens, turn down service, flowers and brand name bath and beauty products.

review.title: ok- just not for breakfast
review.reviewText: the hotel was nice, bed very comfortable and quiet, just the breakfast was substadnard as far as quality and help.

review.title: Central Location close to Union Square and Public Transport
review.reviewText: Take BART from the airport and get off at Montgomery Station. When you go up to the street the Palace is right there. The dining room is one of the most elegant you can imagine. Gym and pool are on the forth floor and the staff is exceptionally friendly and thoughtful. We look forward to our next visit.

review.title: great hotel- very centrally located
review.reviewText: The location was great. the bart is right there. the hotel is beautiful. if you like new high tech then this is not the place for you.

review.title: Look forward to going back
review.reviewText: Check-in takes awhile but the hotel is gorgeous. The bar is nice and you are close to Union Square and the Embarcadero. The gym is always busy so you may have to wait for a machine but great equipment.

review.title: Historic hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed here for Valentine's Day and were very pleased. The room and bed were very comfortable and the bath nicely appointed. High ceilings, historic details, beautiful bar, and proximity to BART/MUNI were a plus. Sunday brunch was a bit steep so we skipped that, but other than that the hotel was a great value.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Great room and friendly service. Really enjoyed our stay and would love to go back.

review.title: Comfy old school hotel
review.reviewText: Except for not getting the room type I had booked online, our stay was just what I'd hoped for: very luxurious feeling yet also kid-friendly.

review.title: Excellent Location & Service
review.reviewText: This hotel comes loaded with character and service. Room was spacious, well laid out and comfortable. No in room coffee maker but the complimentary coffee in the lobby is excellent. Great shopping and restaurants all within walking distance.

review.title: Doing a Lap of Elegance
review.reviewText: This year for our annual weekend visit to San Francisco, my fiance and to stay in the historic Palace Hotel. The room was large with high ceilings and quiet for an older, city hotel. It is close to Union Square and a 15 minute walk to the ball park. The main draw though is the "palatial" garden court. Worth a visit to see even if you are not staying here. Also visit the Pied Piper bar to learn about the huge painting. But personally my favorite is the indoor, sky lit pool and sauna. So nice to have an swim followed by a sauna!

review.title: Nice, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Good for business meetings with the suite with the extra parlor

review.title: Not what we expected
review.reviewText: Overall a decent place but not on par with high end New York City Hotels No mini bar in room,heat did not work,un- friendly staff Good location though

review.title: Palace Review
review.reviewText: Size and layout of room made my stay very comfortable. The location was convenient to local attractions without the noise and traffic of Union Square.

review.title: Yucky Room
review.reviewText: I got one of those "in the middle of being renovated" rooms. Nice bed, nice linens, nice TV--gross carpet, bathtub, and bathroom floor.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco and was extremely happy with the Palace Hotel. It is a real gem of a hotel with a great atrium dining area and pool. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located a few blocks from Union Square where all the shopping is and also the F line for the Trolley to Fisherman's Wharf. The Trolley and Muni's (buses)are only $1.50 and you get a 3 hour transfer and is very easy to get around all over San Francisco with them. Go to the Zoo, take the Blue and Gold Fleet at Pier 39 for a 1 1/2 hour cruise of the Bay and walk down Castro St for a real feel of the locals of San Francisco. Great city.

review.title: Great comfort in a great location
review.reviewText: On a family trip we had 3 rooms and all were well-appointed and comfortable. It's a very short walk to Union Square. We would definitely stay here again without hesitation. The only negative thing is the parking cost, but that is the case anywhere in the city, and here you have in/out privileges and can retrieve items from the car.

review.title: Size of room smaller than expected
review.reviewText: The room size was a little smaller than most hotels but it had everything you wanted. Found that the maids left bottled water (meant to be provided) one day but not the other two days, would have thought they would have paid attention to this type of detail. At times there appeared not to be enough people on the front desk so there could be quite a wait. Overall a beautiful hotel.

review.title: First Class Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with extremely helpful staff. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The name 'Palace' is very fitting for this hotel, we had a wonderful stay.

review.title: An elegant and luxurious hotel.
review.reviewText: The buildihg itself is worth a visit- they just do not build them like this any more. Viennese crystal chanderliers, beautiful glass ceilings etc.,etc...It is a privilege to be there. Free coffee, tea and apples in the morning help to start the day easily.

review.title: A very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: A lovely hotel in the financial district. A good base for public transport and shopping. Also within walking distance to Fishermans Wharf (for the more energetic). All the hotel staff were nice and helpful. Excellent housekeeping. Room service was prompt and efficient.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Confortable stay. Great location.

review.title: good location!
review.reviewText: Except for taxi to reach the entrance. most beautiful center court.

review.title: Fantastic hotel in most convenient location
review.reviewText: We just came back from our holiday and stayed at Palace Hotel in San Francisco for 4 days. Its a fantastic hotel build in 1860s and have this marvelous building with a traditional interior however the rooms are equipped with all the modern equipment you can ask for. The staff and the concierge are extremely helpful in guiding, booking tickets, restaurants and transport. The hotel has the most fantastic location with tram stop right in front of it. You can walk few mins to the main shopping area and huge choice of restaurants and bars. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Classic
review.reviewText: Classic Hotel in S.F.

review.title: Palace says it all!
review.reviewText: WhenI stayed in this hotel about 20 years ago, it was shabby, rooms were small. Now, it is fabulous! It has been restored to its old glamor. The service was impeccable. Expedia gave me the best deal, bar none!

review.title: love this hotel
review.reviewText: would defantly stay here again location fantastic i have a back and hip problem but i could walk to most places from this hotel as it is on the flat also great getting from and to the airport on the train as it stops right outside hotel and the train fare is less than six dollars cant wait to go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: A great blend of old and new. Room was very comfortable and the hotel bar, The Pied Piper, was great.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. It is, in the true sense, a "classic" hotel. The only downside was that the breakfast was very, very expensive. It was good but expensive.

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: I think you can get a better experience and service at the Ritz close by for a similar price. Likewise the W Hotel in the same area is cheaper and has similar service. Great hotel just overpriced for the offerings.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and in a good location.

review.title: Outstanding service
review.reviewText: This hotel had staff that would run to open the front doors for me, and each staff would always acknowledge me.

review.title: Great Place and Location for Biz or Shopping
review.reviewText: Easy check in / out and room is comfortable but for a LUXURY hotel the towels are a bit rough. They should repalce the linens and towels.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Nice pool, very clean rooms and bathrooms. We could hear doors slamming from the floor below us but other then that it was a very pleasant stay. Bart is VERY conveniently located out the side entrance of the hotel. Cable cars a short walk.

review.title: The Palace
review.reviewText: The Palace is in a great location, great rooms also. However, the prices in the diningroom are outrageous. Breakfast buffet is 28 $$ US. That is not acceptable for a family of four, yet alone two people. Consequently, we never had breakfast there at all. Too bad really, but I would be a fool to pay that regardless of surroundings. Dinner in the diningroom wasn't all that great. The oysters we ordered were sent back..they were not fresh. My chicken dinner was not cooked enough either and very rubbery. Huge price for what we got. Never ate there more than the one time. Try eating up by Union Square, more bang for your buck there.

review.title: Good Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Got this room as a last minute deal. Very good location. Lots of weddings going on all weekend so lobby gets really busy but you can see why couples go there to be married. Good gym and pool.

review.title: San Francisco Classic
review.reviewText: Traditional, Dependable, & Elegant.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: Good place to hang out.Great bar and fantastic service. A bit expensive at full price but they are giving some discounts this fall and winter.

review.title: The Palace is Perfect
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I loved this hotel. It is an older hotel with large hallways, paneling in the rooms and thick walls. It was absolutely beautiful with a great ambiance. I also loved the location - twenty minutes (walking) to the Embacadero, five minutes to Union Square and lots of great small restaurants to choose from. My girlfriend and I would definitely stay again!

review.title: totally deserves its luxury landmark image !
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful, historic hotel where I got a junior suite at a very affordable rate while attending a wedding there. Every aspect was wonderful- the beds were incredibly comfortable, the food- room service and restaurants was superb, and all service from check in, to room service, concierge, check out was impeccable. And it was a beautiful setting for a wedding. If you get an affordable package I recommend it not just as a place to stay but as a world class hotel experience.

review.title: recommend for San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: Easy check in and out. The room was very comfortable, nice linens and decor and quiet. I love the high ceilings. The good coffee in reception area was a nice touch.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Very efficient. Extremely good, if pricey, breakfast.

review.title: we love the palace.
review.reviewText: we adore the palace, use the ammenities and have a blast, the concierge will do everything for you, make reservations at really great steak houses, answer all your questions and they never forget us.....this hotel has the kindest and most awesome staff. always ready with a map, and a warm greeting, they have our loyalty, we love the city of san francisco and could never imagine staying anywhere but the palace.....we love the palace. dan and allyson in seattle.

review.title: Wonderful old hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel has lots of character. High ceilings and elegant details. Very convenient location directly on BART making it easy to go to and from the airport. Two or three blocks from Union Square and a short walk to the Museum of Modern Art.

review.title: Wonderful at first, disappointing during the night.
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 2 nights. On the first night I had a visitor who I spent the night with. We talked and laughed a lot. At some point the guy in the room next door started knocking on the door that can join the 2 rooms as apparently he thought that we were too loud. We were only talking and laughing a bit, but not playing music or having the TV on loud or anything. I don't quite understand why they use these adjoining rooms when they don't have to as the hotel is a huge place with many rooms that may not be like that. Otherwise it's a very decent place for relatively or temporarily rich people. Excellent room service, but very expensive food.

review.title: Lovely experience
review.reviewText: Good location (though late night dining locations were limited). Magnificent entry & main hall. Nice room (no views). Excellent staff.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is central to shopping, restaurants and tourist activities. The room and hotel is in excellent condition and the staff were friendly. I would definitely reccomend this hotel.

review.title: A taste of old world opulence and gentility.
review.reviewText: This landmark hotel, the largest and most luxurious when it opened in 1875, welcomed us to that old luxury and warmth. From the hotel doorman, valet, and bellman, who converged about our car on arrival, the service was smooth and well-oiled. The room was tasteful, the bed extremely comfortable. Maxfield Parrish's mural in the Pied Piper Bar provided an extraordinary setting for drinks. Breakfast in the beautiful Garden Court restaurant, with its domed ceiling, elevated our spirits. SF MOMA and Union Square were but a walk from the door. The Palace is the best hotel we experienced in San Francisco. We shall return.

review.title: Palace Hotel Labor Day 2008
review.reviewText: Great location, you don't need a rental car to stay here, great access to everything. Fly into SFO take Bart to Montgomery St. station. The entrance to Place Hotel is right as you come up the steps onto Market St. from the Bart station. Take Muni to the Wharf, Haight & AT&T Park. Union Square, Embarcadaro, Ferry Teminal & Chinatown several blocks walking.

review.title: A well cared for and loved hotel...
review.reviewText: The Palace is a treasure for San Franciscians.....I was pleased to return there and find the rooms clean and well cared for...the food in the restaurants was good, and well served. The hotel is easy walking to the Moscone Center, where we were attending a convention, and also easy walking to shopping and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel, and would be happy to stay there again.

review.title: Beautifully Restored Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel but, it is beautiful, very clean, and in a great location. The staff is helpful and the pool/sauna/spa facilities (included) are clean and well maintained. Great water pressure in the shower, (hey, that's important to me; it may be to you also.) The Pied Piper bar is the best hotel bar I've been to in a long time and the multi-million dollar Pied Piper painting above the bar is a must see. Oh, and the Sunday brunch is absolutely exquisite and a real treat, (but pricey at $65 per person)! It was a fun, unique place to stay if you want to get away from the chain hotels.

review.title: Take a step back...To a different space in time...
review.reviewText: I'll make this, short and sweet. The staff, from the front desk to housekeeping was fantastic. Every amenity was promply delivered with a smile and professionalism. Stay here and you will not be disappointed (I got a great deal w/ expedia, i'm not receiving any comp.) One word to sum up my stay, Wonderful!

review.title: New West Coast Home
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean and in a very convenient location for a leisurely stay in San Francisco.

review.title: A great option and perfectly placed for all the sights!
review.reviewText: The Palace is conveniently located so that you can enjoy all the major sights either on foot, by cable car, or using the BART. It is extremely easy to reach from SFO (adjacent to Montgomery stop) so you won't need a taxi (but you might need one on the way back to transport all your shopping). We found the hotel absolutely ideal and preferably placed to The Hilton where we had stayed on an earlier visit. The staff are very friendly, the Pied Piper bar is an excellent and buzzing venue in the evening, and it is slightly apart from Union Square etc which makes it a much more peaceful night. The rooms are very comfortable (we got a free upgrade as we obviously looked totally tired from the flight), and the spa and pool complex an added bonus. Stay at the Palace while you can, as rumour has it that it is due for a major refurbishment shortly, involving an additional 67 floors being added....

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This is a great location and a lovely hotel. Rooms and beds a a little small for a family of four but definitely recommended

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend Palace Hotel. It has great downtown location just steps from the BART station (their subway). You can get from the San Francisco International to the hotel for 30 minutes. The hotel and the rooms were clean. I found out that I have an allergy to the detergent they wash their linen with and requested our sheets not to be treated with chemicals and indeed they did it! Great place to stay! I highly recommend it! The hotel was cheap and fabulous at the same time.

review.title: Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: This place was awesome! Extremely friendly and courteous front desk. Concierge was great at helping us find great places to eat and things to do. It's located minutes from Chinatown and the B.A.R.T is directly outside the hotel, so we got on at the airport and off directly outside our hotel! Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance.

review.title: Met Expectations
review.reviewText: Check-in/out was flawless. Comfortable room. Great location in the financial district. BART stop is less than a minute walk from the hotel.

review.title: Beautiful with excellent location
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The pool is wonderful, the rooms are well appointed and clean and the garden court dining room is amazing! The hotel is right next to a BART station, a few blocks from the Cable Car Turntable at Powell and is right between the financial district and downtown shopping. It is only two flat (no hills) blocks to Westfield Center Mall and a few more to Union Square. China Town is an easy walk as well. Fantastic!

review.title: Nice place...
review.reviewText: *We had a nice stay, check-in was easy and the rooms are nice. King-size bed was nice and the room was large. The bathroom was average but nice. No view from the room that we were in that goes along with the expedia deal. The pool and the whirlpool were on the small size but were indoors. There is plenty of small stores and shops close by, and Union square is just a short walk away.

review.title: Nice, but...
review.reviewText: a few things were disappointing...no coffee maker or mini bar in room. However, service was excellent and very accomodating.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: mind that on sunday the breakfast is not available after 9.45!!!

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at this hotel. Check-in was a little slow, but check-out was a breeze, and the concierge was very knowledgeable. The location was top-notch, close to everything including a BART entrance. We never even had to rent a car! The hotel is beautiful and ornate. The elevators are a little small, but the bellmen are always ready to help. The rooms are spacious for San Francisco and the fixtures are baroque. I prefer bigger pillows, but the beds are comfortable. I would stay here again, in fact it would be my first choice.

review.title: very impressive-classy
review.reviewText: hotel,staff,and overall service was top notch

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Nice room, efficient maid service, fridge in room useful, complementary water each day and coffee/tea in reception area first thing in the morning. Elegant dining room area. Breakfast excellent but not cheap.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: Arrived tired from a long flight and were pleased to be greeted by pleasant staff. This was our first hotel on a 6 week trip with teenagers and we were very impressed.Our stay was great especially the pool and spa which we used after days of exploring the city. Very kid friendly.Fresh coffee in reception every morning too. Would go back.

review.title: Great Price Great Location
review.reviewText: This a great hotel with a great location. Very helpful staff!

review.title: Very good, but...
review.reviewText: I am a blue collar worker who enjoys a bit of luxury while I am on vacation. This was exactly that. The hotel employees were more than helpful and our room was good. However, you should know that this hotel lacks some of the things that I as a amatuer traveler take for granted. There are no soda machines in the building, and since it is located in the business district the stores in the area close early. Not a big problem, but still a problem. The pool closes at 10:00 PM, which I am sure is pretty standard, but if you are looking for a romantic get away you may need to upgrade the room a bit. Overall I would say that if you were alone on business this is the hotel for you, but if you have children or are newlyweds I would search a bit more.

review.title: Classic and good downtown location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, good services and very nice location close to Union Square and Chinatown. We traveled in July and stayed four nights, asked for connecting rooms and they gave us an upgrade to deluxe rooms. Spacious rooms and clean. Just perfect !! Definately will return. Recommend.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!
review.reviewText: Incredibly beautiful and spacious hotel. Once getting off the underground public transportation system (BART)and walking up the stairs, the hotel was right there.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the hotel service. All hotel staff was very helpful and polite. They were able to help with reservations, resturant suggestions and more. The morning complimentary coffee bar was also appreciated.

review.title: Great Hotel except for thin walls.
review.reviewText: Very impressive hotel. Great location. Unfortunately, walls seem paper thin, so that conversations in next rooms were clearly heard. Take a pair of ear plugs.

review.title: Outstanding San Fran Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I traveled to San Francisco for our 5th anniversary. My wife was 3 months pregnant and got very ill on the plane and the shuttle to the hotel. When we arrived to The Palace my wife was so weak she needed a wheelchair and hotel was on it! They were awesome, they even brought a magnificent cheese/fruit tray and soda and crackers to our room for free. I can't say enough good things about the place. We ate breakfast there although it was pricey the buffet was the most elegant breakfast I ever had so much so that we ate there again on our last morning. The location for site seeing is superb, btw, when you arrive in the SFO don't pay $$ for a taxi or super shuttle instead take the BART train from the airport to the Montgomery stop, walk up the stairs and there you are and it's $5! You can walk to all the piers and Chinatown easily from the hotel. Top notch!

review.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: A beautiful, historic hotel, completely updated. Rooms had great TVs, refrigerators, blow dryers, just about everything you need. And you are exactly FIVE steps from the entry to the Montgomery Muni/BART station. The only bad thing? Everytime I stay here, my Giants lose the baseball game.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is great located but the beds were very soft and the rooms need a remodelation and the cleaness of the rooms could be improved, it is not bad but an improvemend would make the hotel a great hotel.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: outstanding, great view and great service

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Very nice, good value for the money

review.title: Beautiful Hotel with History
review.reviewText: I wouldn't change a thing ... it was beautiful, elegant, good value for the money, right in the middle of everything San Francisco.

review.title: NIce hotel in nice area
review.reviewText: Hotel was only two blocks from Union square and 4 from CAble cars. I was very accessable to everything. Walgreens was near by for misc. things and starbucks right next store. There was not a lot of frils with the hotel but it did the everything was nice, would definitely go back.

review.title: Excellent location and beautiful
review.reviewText: Very good and we would go back

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Overall good service, but bed was really hard, not comfortable at all. Good for a weekend stay, but I think for the price you could find something cheaper. Good location.

review.title: A great experience
review.reviewText: Great experience in this hotel stay. Perfect condition for a very old construction. Great service, And excellent for convention. Very near from Union Square and Blumingdales shopping mall.

review.title: Overpriced and lack of service
review.reviewText: We arrived early and asked when we could check in to the hotel. The front desk person (and I use the work loosely) got very defensive and said he did not know. We just wanted to know whether to wait or go out and he was rude and unpleasant so we just left. My wife and daughter's manicure was a disaster. The lady was very rough and unpleasant. When asked for a french manicure she said there was no way she could do one in 45 minutes. We paid a premium for a lousy experience. To top things off, the toilet got clogged. For the money we spent, it would have been nice to be treated like we were in a Palace rather than a Motel 6. You could go to a lot nicer place for less money.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: I was warned that the rooms were small, but I found them very comfortable, not too small at all. The location is awesome, within walking distance of ferries, Fisherman's wharf, shopping, and the Bart.

review.title: Excellent place
review.reviewText: I especially enjoyed the sauna.

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: Beautiful turn of the century elegance and impeccable service. It's not cheap, nor is it overpriced compared to other high quality San Freancisico hotels. Maxfield's steakhouse was excellent and the afternoon tea was a very special experience. We will stay there next time we visit the city.

review.title: the best customer service ever
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a category by itself for caring customer service. My mother became unexpectedly ill. In SF, there was only one hotel for me, where I knew I would feel at home during very stressful times. My mother passed away while I was there, and everyone at the hotel was caring and compassionate. Forget the high rise impersonal office tower hotels and stick with the high quality, old-fashioned top of the line service.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace was a great place to stay. We walked everywhere. You can walk to Fisherman's wharf, china town, shopping, cable car museum, the Giant's game, alcatraz tour. They are long walks, but very doable. There is also a street car route right in front of the hotel that will get you to most of those places. The food in the hotel was a bit expensive.

review.title: The Palace Hotel is a truly beautiful building
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is beautiful and elegant and a reminder of luxury hotel of a past era. It's locatation is very convenient to get to from San Francisco airport, using the BART train. There is a Bart station just outside the hotel. The hotel is in the financial district of the city and therefore very convenient for the shops/cinemaa etc. It is easy to walk around the city and there are plenty of other ways of getting around. We found it too expensive to eat at the hotel but there is an endless choice of places to eat throughout the city. If you want to stay in affordable luxury, The Palace Hotel is for you. The only complaint I have is that the staff were not very helpful about making telephone calls from the hotel. The advice we were given cost us dearly for making a toll free phone call. However the doorman let us use his phone for free. I would certainly recommend this hotel to couples but given it's distance from the more child friendly areas like Fisherman's Wharf it is probably not as suitable for children.

review.title: Excellent Service + Great Deal = Fab Trip!
review.reviewText: Arrived a little past ten thirty and requested a change from my originally booked two double beds to a king size; front desk was extremely helpful and polite. Upon entering room, however, I discovered that the people next door were VERY loud. Went downstairs to request another room change, this time on the fourth floor. People at front desk were very understanding and accommodating. Fourth floor (coincentally, where pool and spa are) is very nice and quiet (room faces the courtyard, and minimized noise coming from Market and Montgomery streets). Room itself was spacious, bathroom was spotless, amenities were nice. However, I didn't get a robe as said in room description. Puzzling. Hotel staff VERY nice, and always greeted you with a smile or hello. Location can't be beat, as it is on direct line of major MUNI and BART routes. One thing I wish the Palace would change is their regular cable line to WiFi. Overall, a delightful, relaxing stay that I would recommend to leisure and business travelers.

review.title: Unbelievable
review.reviewText: I cannot beleive the rate we were able to get for the hotel. It had outsanding style, unfortunately we were so busy we didn't fully get to enjoy all the amenities.

review.title: Pure enjoyment
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic getaway weekend at the Palace Hotel. Our room was lovely and very comfortable, and we enjoyed a fabulous, unhurried dinner at Maxfields. The herbed biscuits were absolutely yummy and the service was first-rate. We ordered room service for breakfast on Sunday morning, and it arrived--hot and delicious--right on time.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. Great concierge staff. Food is too high priced, but there are enough breakfast places within walking distance. Great area of town, too.

review.title: I didn't want leave
review.reviewText: I loved my room - mega tall ceilings, the front desk clerk was super nice and even gave me a room upgrade after I gave him a cough drop due to an impromptu coughing attack. The poor guy! I think the shower was the best I've ever tried - even better than home and the bed had nice quality sheets and matress was perfect. I loved it. The hotel held onto my suitcase after I checked out for the day so I could explore the city without my baggage. I ordered a huge honkin' breakfast and it was cooked to perfection. The coffee was good. Best stay I've had in ages. Everyone on the staff said "hello"!

review.title: elegant hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel,lots of history.Would recomend it to anybody,close to chinatown and mass transit.We enjoyed our stay very much.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and a good location. The only issue we had were the thin walls. We could hear someone snoring in the next room.

review.title: will always go back tot he same place.
review.reviewText: Everything was great. It can be too big and overwhelming if you are use dto small boutique hotels. parking is super expensive- $50 a day adn expedia should have told us this.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and conveniently located. The only shortcomings were that there was no coffee pot in the room (for my husband) and that internet access was not included. Even the use of the hotel's business center had a cover charge.

review.title: Delighted and impressed
review.reviewText: We were ready for the hotel not to live up to the PR pics but it did! The Palace hotel more than lived up to our expectations and we were delighted and impressed with it

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Small overpriced room. Looked bigger in the pictures. Breakfast buffet was overpriced and mediocre. The Pool was fantastic.

review.title: location is fantastic
review.reviewText: This is the perfect hotel for someone who is visiting for the first time or any time. The location is perfect for all of the means of transportation.(subway, cable car, and buses. Not to mention that shopping is great.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The lobby, ballrooms, restaurant and bar are very pretty. The valets and bellmen were very pleasant. The front desk help was slow and not particularly pleasant. The rooms are old but recently painted, very nicely decorated and very comfortable. The hotel is nicely situated. I would go back without hesitation

review.title: Fantastic hotel and a great location
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel has a gorgeous lobby, a great bar (The Pied Piper), and a very nice pool area. We really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Wonderful renovation!
review.reviewText: When we selected The Palace from the Expedia site, we thought we would be staying in an elegant comfortable hotel. The expereince far surpassed our expectations...and we are not easily impressed. The hotel was immaculate, the service was excellent, and the renovation was really beautiful..old world charm in fresh, well appointed surroundings!

review.title: Fantastic!
review.reviewText: When I saw that the Palace was a 4 star hotel at a 2 star price I was skeptical but when I arrived I was surprised to see that the hotel was even more beautiful than the pictures. The room was more than great with a large flat panel tv, a bed that somehow fit my soft bed preference and my boyfriends firm bed preference, and the bathroom feels nothing like the average hotel bathroom with lots of charm. Two plush robes in the armoire were a nice touch. The spa was also very nice, we went early morning and also at around 8:30 pm, neither time were there more than 4 people in the 3 lane lap pool. Everyone is so nice! The restaraunts are very expensive, although we did have room service which was top quality. You can find complimentary coffee and apples in both the lobby and spa in the mornings. The female concierge was wonderful taking her time to help each time I came to ask a question. As for the location, you are less than a 10 minute walk from everything, including the trolly to take you to Fisherman's wharf. If you want to take BART to the hotel from the SA airport, ask where the platform is and take a shuttle from there where you will ride to the "yellow line" and then take it to Montgomery St., then walk across the street and check-in! WONDERFUL!

review.title: Classic San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Palace hotel is a true classic historical hotel that has been updated with all of the modern fetures in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: Classic old hotel; gorgeous garden court dining room! Definitely would go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a classic!!! We heard it's going to be renovated and turned into a "modern" skyscraper, but we're so hoping it doesn't. There are far too few beautiful classics like this one. Rooms are very nice; people at hotel very friendly and helpful! Concierge desk great help and offers terrific tips!!! It's conveniently located and be sure to eat at the Garden Court Room; it's beautiful and reminds you of the Plaza in NYC. Ask for Gerrard Planet for private tours; he's terrific!!!

review.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL!
review.reviewText: I could not have asked for a better experience at this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and the accomodations were superb. Wonderful experience and I will definitely stay at this hotel everytime I come to San Francisco.

review.title: Would do it again!
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel. Rental cars, plenth of places to eat and shop right there. Very clean and quiet. They let us check in 4 hours early. Be aware that they do charge you to use the little shampoo & lotion samples($1.00 each). They did supply hair dryer and iron (no charge). It was nice to have a pool, hot tub, workout room & spa on site. Not that we really used it. I wouldn't eat @ the hotel, overpriced. Plenty of places around the corner. However when people said 2 blocks it usually meant 2 blocks one way and then another.

review.title: extremely pleasant staff makes extremely pleasant guests.
review.reviewText: we had the best stay in a hotel in our entire lives....everything was wonderful and everyone and we mean any and everyone treated us with grace and the pride shows among the staff. the whole hotel felt as if nothing was a burden. all of our requests were met with a resounding positive attitude. we will never stay anywhere but the palace ever again....this is the palace and this is the place to stay. dan and allyson k.

review.title: Swanky
review.reviewText: Loved it.

review.title: A great spot to attack San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Our first time staying there. Great access to shopping, trolley cars, BART, museums, and Moscone Centre. A very classy and regal place. Excellent massage and spa experience. Maxfield's restaurant was absolutely delicious. Would highly recommend to travelers going to San Fran and wanting to experience the "heart of the city".

review.title: Great atmosphere and close to cultural sites!
review.reviewText: Great location with bart stoping at Montgomery. The only problem I encountered was when it came time to confirm by flight and the computer was down. The help desk was not going to go online and told me to try later. But room service and the quality of the room was fantastic.

review.title: Elegant and central hotel
review.reviewText: Pros: - Beautiful dining area, didn't manage to go fro Brunch on Sunday due to my friend not feeling well, but by all accounts it's worth trying once. The surroundings are very pleasant. - Very central for tourists. - Muni stop right outside the Maxfields/bar restaurant exit. - Cable car stop very close as well. - Very pleasant service from the staff. - Let us check-in 3 hours early and 4 hours later, very accommodating. - Free pastries/coffee in the morning, by the lifts/reception desk (didn't use though!) - Free bottled water. Cons: - Not very much wardrobe space in our double bedroom. They really should put in an extra hanging wardrobe as there's more than ample space for one. - As another review noted, the sound proofing isn't that great in the rooms, bring ear plugs (get the wax ones, cuts out any noise), didn't spoil my stay but it may do if you're sensitive to noise.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location and beautiful hotel. Very convenient if you want to walk around San Francisco

review.title: Stately, Beautiful, Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The Palace is a stately, beautifully-kept hotel that recalls the Victorian era, with high ceilings and a domed restaurant on the main floor. My room was clean, well- and recently decorated and comfortable. Complimentary fresh fruit is always available in the lobby, with coffee offered every morning. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat! It's close to mass transit, SoMa, shopping, the Wharf. I'd certainly stay there again.

review.title: Convenient place to stay
review.reviewText: If you want to stay closer to the city and shopping areas, this is an ideal place to stay. We enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi, sauna and the fitness club in the late afternoon in the hotel. The hotel's location is also very close to most of the touristy places that you may want to go such as Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge (Park), Crookedest St (Lombard St), Fisherman's Wharf, Napa Valley...etc.

review.title: The name says it all!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary, and all I can say is wow. This building is a palace on the inside.
