The rooms were a little on the small side compared to newer hotels...but the very high ceilings(12+feet)made it feel bigger.They have like 3 resturants and a bar in the hotel also..a little pricey but very good food...very large selection of wine as well. We took public transportation everywhere and it worked out perfect with this location in downtown. there was a trolly/bus stop right in front of the hotel that took you to just about every hotspot in san fran. There is also a Rapid transit station half a block away that takes you too and from the airport...also around to the other side of the bay.You can buy a 3day pass for $18 that covers all the bus,trolly and cable car rides(great deal)! Overall we were very pleased with this hotel and their services and we will definately stay at the Palace if we return to San Fran!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and nice fitness area. Very modern. Good restaurants at the hotel but kind of pricy. Beautiful hotel and rooms. We had a room with two beds and my only complaint about this hotel is that the double beds were kind of small small and the parking fee. Next time we should get queen or king beds. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: We spent two nights there. The staff was friendly. Location is awesome. There was a starbucks very nearby. Only problem we faced was the day we we checked in they gave us keys to a used room. It was quickly corrected though. Stay was comfortable the room was amazing. Their concierge service was awesome. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is visiting SFO.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel!

review.title: Would Stay Any Day!
review.reviewText: Awesome pool, awesome room, awesome staff! Everyone who works at this hotel is helpful, friendly and make a stay at the Palace hotel unforgetable. The rooms are big and are cleaned extremely well. Loved it.

review.title: A delightful surprise.
review.reviewText: If you wish to capture some of the splendor of an early 20th century hotel this is the ticket. The rooms had an understated elegance, with considerable attention being given to small details with respect to amenities, appointments and general maintenance. The staff were as efficient as they were obliging; they greatly contributed to making you feel welcome and comfortable.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel's age is showing, mold in bathroom, toilet ran all night, I asked at the front desk for repair and nothing was done. Breakfast runs about $80 with tip. Valet parking is $48/day. Bar was disappointing, however the Pied Piper painting is worth seeing.

review.title: Felt like I landed in the lap of Luxury
review.reviewText: Outstanding service, warm, helpful staff, very comfortable room.

review.title: Very Basic
review.reviewText: Excellent room - very comfortable and clean - no complaints.

review.title: Great Historic Hotel
review.reviewText: What a beautiful hotel with a long history. The service and food were excellent!

review.title: An elegant hotel.....
review.reviewText: We have long wanted to stay at the Palace, since we lived in San Francisco for several years and often visited the Pied Piper lounge. The room was a perfect size; the bed comfortable, and the decor lovely. We enjoyed the stay very much (plus, it's got the perfect location), and visitng the Pied Piper as guests made it even more special.

review.title: Very Pleasant
review.reviewText: For the most part we were very pleased. However, the room was a bit cramped. But that could be because we are used to staying in a suite with the kids. But since it was just my husband and I, we downgraded. But the hotel staff was so great and friendly. They definitely went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. So I would definitely recommend this for a nice little getaway!

review.title: Excellent Hotel and Location
review.reviewText: Hotel and location were great. Hotel entrance is directly at the BART station so commute from and to the airport could not be simpler. Rooms were quite large and clean, staff was extremely friendly. Keeping on of the rooms until 3pm on check-out day was not an issue.

review.title: Will definately visit again!
review.reviewText: Old world charm with all the comforts of a modern hotel. Great location, walking distance to excellent restaurants, great shopping and all the attractions in the union square district.

review.title: Great location with historic charm
review.reviewText: Great old property located just next to the Bart Montgomery St. Station. staff was helpful and the hotel was clean and convenient. I generally prefer a more modern decor, but the Palace was priced right and is in a great location. The rooms are pretty small, but we didn't mind that. Maxfields bar in the Palace is a great spot to have a drink.

review.title: Outstanding Hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed we were treated to wonderful experience at The Palace Hotel. This Historic Hotel was Outstanding & we're definitely looking forward to returning again.

review.title: Quality Hotel, So-So Location
review.reviewText: A friend and I stayed at the Palace Hotel for a weekend getaway. We were greeted at the door by a friendly and open staff and were welcomed into a beautiful hotel. I had been to the Palace before for dinner and cocktails, but had never stayed there. Our room was more than adequate; comfortable beds, a window that opened, and a nice bathroom (good lighting & water pressure, etc.) Everything about the hotel itself is top notch. However, the location is the only downside. It's only a few long blocks from Union Square, but I always felt a bit guarded when leaving the hotel at night. There are many tourists and people walking about, but there were also many vocal & belligerent homeless people directly outside the hotel. So, walk with a purpose and stay focused. Otherwise, the hotel is lovely and your stay there should be more than pleasant.

review.title: Gorgeous old hotel.
review.reviewText: We loved our stay here. It's close to everything downtown and the BART stop is just across the street so we had a straight shot from the airport and didn't need to bother with a rental care. Highly recommended!

review.title: A Grand Hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace is a grand old hotel with all the modern amenities. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, will go back and will recommend highly to friends and family.

review.title: San Fran Hotels
review.reviewText: Great touch to a romantic get-away.

review.title: First Time in San Fran
review.reviewText: It was our first trip to SF and we loved it. We parked the car and either walked or took public transport everywhere. Great location and the nicest place we have ever stayed. I can't think of staying anywhere else next time we visit.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at this Hotel was a very enjoyable experience. Extremely clean and quiet, service was great. Fantastic restaurant in the Hotel as well. The location was excellent, we took the subway from the airport,walked up the steps from the subway stop and were literally at the door to the Hotel.

review.title: Superb!
review.reviewText: Very accommodating,no stuffiness for such a well-appointed hotel. Staff pleasant and helpful.Convenient for public transport.

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel! The staff is extremely courteous and the customer service was excellent.

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently enjoyed a visit to San Francisco and a stay at the Palace. The hotel is comfortable, with an air of age we find pleasing. The central dining loggia is elegant, but a bit too expensive for more than one meal there. We found ourselves scouting the neighborhood for places to eat breakfast. There are many small bakeries or cafes, but it was a bit inconvenient to have to go out. The location was great for us - easy to walk to the Ferry Building and the waterfront, the shops, and to the start of cable cars. It is also right on Market, with access to the underground and to many bus lines. With the help of a good map, we were able to walk, dine, and experience the San Francisco we had anticipated.

review.title: palace
review.reviewText: Very nice suite, very friendly and competent staff. Bathroom smaller than expected for a suite

review.title: Excelent place to Stay
review.reviewText: Definitively The Palace Hotel is one of the best hotels in SF, its an excellent place to stay. Value for Money

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, courteous employees, great amenities. Definitely a top hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Look no further for class ,style ,comfort and best of all LOCATION
review.reviewText: The Palace was indeed a palace very friendly staff The room small but never needed anything.The bed was perfect! and the shower and and water pressure was very good for being on the 7th floor. The fridge was not cooling in our room and when I called a repair man and he was up within 10 minnutes and fixed the problem. The spa was a small slice of heaven and under a glass dome. Free for guests and herbal teas waiting for you. No need for a car We took the Bart from the airport and the station was right in front of our hotel.Plus the bus, the light rail and cable cars all stopped in front of our hotel! We were within blocks of chinatown, union square and the Pier.. The best location hands down!

review.title: Expected more
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel but expected more amenities and service for a luxury hotel. No coffee pot in room, no wine glasses, beds/pillows were not very comfy, no turn down service, desk and chair but no other chairs. No tub in bathroom. Hot tub down one day. Service was indifferent. Room was good size and the lobby area is very beautiful. Good location. Just expected the little things to be taken care of in a luxury hotel. Have to say we were disappointed.

review.title: U MUST STAY HERE!!!
review.reviewText: THE PALACE HOTEL WAS THE BEST EVER. LUX ALL THE WAY.. FROM THE POSH BEDS TO THE COMFY ROBES TO THE BIG WINDOW THAT OPENS FOR FRESH AIR. I CANT SAY ENOUGH.. PERFECTLY LOCATED IN THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT EVERYTHING IS NEAR BY.. THE STAFF TRIP OVER THEMSELVES TO MAKE YOUR STAY SO ENJOYABLE!! THERE IS A MINI FRIDGE THAT KICKS BUT.. THE POOL IS SMALL BUT GREAT VIEW.. U MUST GO TO THE PIED PIPER IN THE HOTEL.. OLD SCHOOL BEAUTIFUL!!! I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN...IN A HEART BEAT..MY FRIENDS AND I TRULY LEFT OUR HEARTS IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Beautiful indoor swimming pool highly recommend for people traveling with kids

review.title: Great All the Way Around
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Palace with my young nephews and my mother. The hotel worked so well for all of us. The location was convenient. The staff was helpful and very good with kids. Room Service and Housekeeping responded to special requests quickly. The kids loved the indoor pool. Breakfast in the Garden Court is fabulous. And, the most compelling part - one of the kids left his handheld computer game system at the hotel when we left. The staff put the item safe in Lost & Found, ready to return to us.

review.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else!
review.reviewText: The common areas are beautiful - and the rooms spacious and well maintained. The pool area is as nice as the pictures. Much better location than the other 4* hotels. Thought the consierge, bell staff and front desk were completely helpful.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I recomend this hotel,its very well located, everything very near. Hotel staff i very polite and answer all questions you may have.

review.title: Nice Old Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location! Beds/Bedding not the greatest but for the price, nice old hotel!

review.title: Great Central Location
review.reviewText: The location was central to great shopping and restaurants. It was only a 15 minute walk to waterfront. The hotel is a historical landmark, and as such the rooms have an antiquated look and feel. Our room was clean and had a new plasma t.v. with a view of the city. The hotel staff were friendly and polite. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Great hotel,great location. Would love to stay there again when in San Francisco!

review.title: Loved our trip!!!!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a very centralized area; everything is within your reach and all of the transportation is nearby. Will definitely stay there again!!! If going to SFO International Airport, just take the Bart train (about 20 min) to Montgomery street and you are about 10 paces away from your hotel.

review.title: Beautiful, could use a few touches.
review.reviewText: Beautiful room and hotel. Expect to wait a while if you need anything sent up to your room. No microwave was an inconvenience. Friendly employee's and worth the price.

review.title: Love it
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to San Fran for a 4 day getaway. The hotel was wonderful. While the room wasn't extremely large, it was very warm and welcoming. The bed felt like heaven after a busy day sightseeing. The restaurant was delicious for dinner. We had more food then we could eat and each item was fantastic. The only problem we had with the hotel was not the most welcoming concierge staff we have ever met. The materials they provided, though, helped guide our stay through the city for a very enjoyable San Francisco trip!

review.title: Fantastic hotel!
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel! Easy to get to the cable cars and the F line. The Garden room for breakfast is breathtaking!!!

review.title: okay
review.reviewText: Not worth the room upgrade. The hotel was impressive.

review.title: wonderful time
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Room was large enough and very comfortable. We asked for a courtyard room, so there was no street noise. People and Service lovely. Great coffee in the morning downstairs. Old SF atmosphere. Dinner at the Bar better the expected. For location, quality, and ambience, price was excellent.

review.title: Totally Impressed!!!
review.reviewText: Great place! I will recommend the Palace to all of my friends. The Sunday Brunch in the Garden Court was fabulous.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Good Location, with in walking distance to Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: great place to stay - close to conf center and union square. Terrific staff

review.title: Beyond great
review.reviewText: From the instant the doorman greets you until they hail you a taxi to leave, the hotel was superb. It was beyong our expectation! Rooms are very European. Location is perfect for tourists. Our only complaint....... the breakfast buffet is way overpriced, especially when it comes to a couple of teenage girls that don't eat very much. $30 for a bowl of oatmeal is excessive. However, there are many cool breakfast joints within walking distance.

review.title: We love this hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I try to stay here whenever we jaunt over to San Francisco. The staff is always more than willing to help, the rooms are extremely clean, and the beds are very comfortable. They also have an enclosed pool and hot tub which are fun. Their main ballroom is open in the mornings for breakfast and is just beautiful- stained glass ceiling circa 1900. Just beautiful. Only one minor complaint- the walls are fairly thin so you can hear louder guests in the hallways. But other than that, this hotel is wonderful.

review.title: feel like back in 1912 at San Franisco
review.reviewText: I love this hotel ! like back in old SF time! 1912

review.title: All extras very expensive.
review.reviewText: Overall, I was disappointed. I thought the price for a suite in San Francisco was fairly reasonable, but ANYTHING additional was extremely expensive. Extra person in room $48/day, parking $48/day. Very posh and exorbitantly priced Sunday brunch, advertised with continually flowing champagne. It was good, but aloof inattentive service, one refill of champagne that we had to flag down the waiter and ask for. The suite was nice, but well worn. Stain on a chair, cracked sink, wobbly bed post. Not what was expected for a luxury hotel. I had always wanted to stay there, so I did, but will not be going back.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The walls were a bit thin and we could hear our neighbours, but it is an older hotel and it was expected. We had a great time in San Francisco and really enjoyed our stay at the Palace. We would recommend it - very close to everything and right on the BART and Streetcar line. A beautiful building and worth the stay!

review.title: wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: friendly staff,great location, hotel in great condition. What more could you want???

review.title: Would definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: Historic hotel, close to transit, great service

review.title: Awesome Hotel! Excellent Service, Clean and Uniquely San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This hotel is wonderful! Everyone from the bellman to check in staff were extremely nice and helpful. Most importantly, the Palace Hotel is close to Union Square and transportation is right outside the door - literally. Easy access to bus routes, street cars and the subway. If you are looking for a hotel in a good location which is close to transportation and is clean and uniquely San Francisco, this IS IT! We will definately stay here on our next visit.

review.title: Great Old World Charm
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an elegant and comfortable hotel steeped in history and charm, this is the place for you. Great location. Close to BART, Cable Cars, and Union Square. It is very old, so the rooms are a bit on the small side, but stil very nice.

review.title: Lovely, but noisy old hotel
review.reviewText: I go to San Francisco each year to Christmas shop with my college roomates. We typically try to stay in one of the smaller historic hotels surrounding Union Square, and over the years have stayed in many of the properties in San Francisco. The Palace is a beautiful old building with a gorgeous lobby. The rooms are large and comfortable, but lack any unique charm. There is no coffee available in the room, and no CD or DVD player, though there was a nice big plasma TV. Though the hotel has exorbinant fees for parking, and trivial amenities like rollaway beds, access to the beautiful indoor pool was a particular treat, and the spa was delightful.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Great location, newly renovated and affordable too. Really enjoyed the flat screen plasma TV in the room. Excellent restaurant recommendations by the hotel concierge.

review.title: Very nice hotel and close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: A water pipe kept making noises in our room. I reported it, and it went away at night. but returned in the morning. Very annoying. Otherwise the hotel is very nice and the rooms are very comfortable.

review.title: Good San Francisco location
review.reviewText: You could not ask for a better location for shopping and sight seeing in the "CITY". But the rates makes you quiver unless you can get a package like the one we got with Expedia. The package was exceptional. We'll definately do it again.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Very,very good location(BART),One of the better hotels,but four stars are one star too many!!!Plenty room for improvement on all fronts,but my guess is,that management is not doing its very best and it is visible,if one take a closer look!THANK YOU!

review.title: Comfort in a friendly environment
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived every person at the hotel was friendly and eager to meet our needs. We did our Christmas shopping and neither the bellman or the valet groaned at the sight of 15+ bags. Would go back anytime for any reason.

review.title: Generally great...
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel is great. Location is good. Garden court is beautiful (especially for the Sunday brunch). If you want a treat, opt for the drivers with the towncars or limos instead of a cab for your dinner destination, etc. The doorman and driver are terrific! Only downside is the bed; mattress was a little too soft.

review.title: Old School Hotel w/ Modern Ammenities
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with 'Old School' feel. Everything inside had a very older, classic theme to it, but still had all you needed for a very comfortable stay. A little on the expensive side for sure, but would be great for a one or two night getaway..........

review.title: Beautiful & Small
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and well taken care of. We were there for a wedding at the hotel & were very impressed with the food (& drink!). We also took advantage of the Sunday brunch which was excellent. Only downer was the size of the room -and lack of adequate reading light. We also liked the close accesss to great shopping & restaurants.

review.title: great rooms for business meetings
review.reviewText: I booked 4 suites on expedia. they were large and spacious and were great for having meetings in the room with up to 8 people. I had a few problems with them refilling the minibar as they only do it once a day, throwing away some packaging that was no where near a wastebasket and also had a problem with a wake up call that never happened, but the staff really tried to make up for these issues. All in all, I would highly recommend it for business and the food in the dining room was delicious. Apparently the japanese restaurant was not great, but I didn't try it first hand....the other restaurants were fantastic.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: I would definitely recommend staying at this fine hotel - it combines the best of both worlds in terms of all the modern day conveniences with the distinct charm of a fine old hotel, the way they used to be. And for a special splurge, the Sunday brunch in their beautiful dining area just off the lobby is fabulous!! We'll definitely be staying there again when next we visit lovely San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: I highly recommend the Palace Hotel. They upgraded us to a junior suite and we didn't even ask for it. This beautifully restorted hotel has lots of character and class.

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: The Palace is a beautiful hotel. We were extremely happy with the room and especially how quiet the hotel was for being on such a busy street. The location is great because you are within walking distance to shopping, great restaurants, and the ball park. We will stay here every time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel exceeded my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel to be exactly as pictured. Lots of historic charm, with all necessary amenities. Brunch at the Garden Court restaurant, although expensive, was very good, in a beautiful setting. It was a joy to return to the room in the evenings after tons of walking and sightseeing. The location of the hotel was very good as well. I would definitely stay there again if I returned to San Francisco.

review.title: Quuiet Elegant Hotel in central Location
review.reviewText: We have tried other hotels and find that the Palace is the ideal place for us. Quiet, great beds, professional staff and exquisite dinning room. We look forward to our next stay.

review.title: Nice place, we were very happy
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, beautiful lobby area. Fairly large rooms for a downtown hotel, nicely furnished, comfortable and clean. Really convenient access to both BART and streetcars to Fisherman's Wharf. We had dinner one night at Maxfield's, very good food and service. There are a couple "family-friendly" restaurants within walking distance. We used the pool area one afternoon which was great. Never had time to use the gym, although it looked very nice too. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Needs alot of improvement
review.reviewText: I stayed from August 26 to Sept 3 for Renal Board Review. Concierge staff was not friendly in 2 of 3 occassions. They were terse, abrupt and unwelcoming. TV was not flat screen. The Palace is suppose to be a Luxury Collection Hotel! Internet connection should be free. Connectivity is so essential to daily business and personal activity that to have additional charges per day is outrageous. This is the worst "luxury" hotel I've stayed in. I did not feel the luxury nor did I feel welcome.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel was gorgeous! Our room was very nice and clean. The bed was very comfy! The pool was pretty with the glass ceiling. The Garden Court breakfast buffet was expensive, but the room is amazing! Good location, right on Market St, which means it was easy to walk places. Good hotel for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon!

review.title: Exceeded my expectations.
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay at the Palace again.

review.title: A lovely old hotel
review.reviewText: My 12 yr old and I liked the location, on a holiday weekend the business district was quiet. We learned the bus routes quickly and found the 3 day pass was invaluable for hopping on and off. The Sunday brunch looked fabulous, but couldn't see spending $68 pp! We had air conditioning issues all 3 nights, and they were quick to come up and try to fix it, but to no avail. (It was warmer in the room than outside!) After visiting Fisherman's Wharf, I am glad we didn't stay there.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: very comfortable with pleasant fitness facilities and pool. Very grand hall for breakfasts etc.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great Downtown location.

review.title: very comfortable bed, can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The best bed I've slept in that was not at home.

review.title: Lovely, old world feel.
review.reviewText: Comfortable, nice size room (standard king) with a feature filled bathroom, also a good size (for San Francisco). High quality amenities, towels were average, but there were 2 warm and lovely bathrobes, a hairdryer and extra mirror in the bathroom (so you can see the back of your head!), a small refrigerator in the armoire. Only negatives were awful TV channels (guess I'm not used to commercial television anymore), poor choice of movies, and somewhat thin walls. But the overall ambience of the hotel, and the service staff were welcoming and well above average. BART station at the corner and despite a broken toe I could walk everywhere from here in short order.

review.title: Quiet Relaxation adjacent to public transport in central San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Palace is a quiet traditional old hotel wit many staff members that have been there for years. The most exquisite dinning room in town. Lovely for breakfast. Health spa and pool on fourth floor accessable from rooms without passing public areas. GREAT PLACE TO STAY !

review.title: Grand Hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace is one of the few Grand Dame's of US Hotels. The Palace Court, a pleasant mix of restaurant and Lobby, is a must see when coming to San Francisco. The rooms are on the cozy side, but with functional deluxe bathrooms. The hallways are big enough to bowl or rollerbade through I would not reccommend trying that. Overall the hotel stay was a great experience.

review.title: Very happy!
review.reviewText: Only stayed 1 night before picking up motorhome but found hotel itself to be very beautiful with comfortable rooms. No coffee making facilities in the rooms but coffee freely available in take-away cups in the foyer.Lovely pool a real bonus.Great central location but quiet in the evening in surrounding area - more lively down on Fisherman's Wharf. Garden Court stunning and well worth seeing - but too expensive for us even for breakfast!Not much experience of contact with the staff due to our short stay but those we met were friendly, and the lady at the pool/spa/fitness centre was a real gem and could not have been more helpful.Overall a fantastic experience in lovely surroundings for a short stay.

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel is truly a luxury experience. The staff was friendly as well as very professional and accommodating to requests. I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved it and will go back next time we are in San Francisco.

review.title: gym
review.reviewText: the gym really needs to be upgraded, but the pool is beautiful.

review.title: In the heart of the city -- with all the noise
review.reviewText: Pros: Incredibly conveniently located next to Union Square, right by the Montgomery St Muni and BART, and a block from a Powell cable car turn around. The bed was deliciously comfortable and room was beautiful. We were able to check in quite early on the day of check-in -- 10am! The price was very reasonable. Cons: As others noted, it was noisy. Living in a city ourselves, we were used to the all-night sirens, etc., but even for us the noise on Market Street was noticeable. Particularly on Friday evening street performers set up with a microphone directly outside the hotel on Market. The room and bathroom were both quite small -- this isn't surprising given the age of the hotel. Additionally, it's age makes it not the hotel for great views -- it only has 8 stories. Although it was listed as a 4 star hotel, the level of service felt like a 2.5 or 3 star hotel. The staff we had contact with were pleasant, but not overly solicitous or helpful. All in all, we wouldn't be opposed to staying there again, but we would likely prefer to try out a different hotel the next time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Would Return
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel room was comfortable and well appointed. Great location! I would definitely return!

review.title: One of San Francisco's gems.
review.reviewText: The Palace is one of SF hotel gems. Elegant dining, high quality in service and rooms.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful Garden Dining Room, good service for breakfast. A little too leisurely for a fast breakfast before work. Second floor room was very nice (deluxe with King bed), but A/C needed to be turned down to 65 to be comfortable. A room window opened to a roof in a central area (a hold-over from pre-A/C days,) and I'm sure it could have been opened by a potential burglar. from another room.

review.title: Tall Ceilings
review.reviewText: Old style luxury hotel rooms - which means a bit bare-bones for today, but really high ceilings and the suite is really quite big. The dining room is amazing. Good overall value for a highish end place. Pillows not so good. Bed OK.

review.title: A beautiful and regal hotel that was great value
review.reviewText: Once the most lavish and luxurious hotel in San Francisco, it still holds its own with more modern and expensive hotels in terms of facilities and quality. In an excellent location for the business and cultural centre of the City, it is also only a 10 minute F-Train ride from Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. The indoor pool was bid enough for recreational use, as well as more physical activity, whilst the range of spa activities was excellent. The decor was resplendent, yet modestly under-stated, giving the air of a country mansion at its magnificent best. My family and I loved it and would not think twice about staying again.

review.title: Felt like I was a real big deal.
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing at first glance. The dining area was gorgeous and so was the lounge. I felt like I had spent more money on the hotel than I did. What oa great trip. Even got to see Barry Bonds hit #754. Thanx Expedia.

review.title: A Top End Well Run Hotel
review.reviewText: Arrived on a busy Friday afternoon and found our room ready and sparkling clean. Front desk, bellman, valet were very friendly and not the least bit snooty - - surprising considering the quality of the hotel. This is not just a luxury hotel with ground floor beauty and "so-so" rooms. It was exquisite from top to bottom. Only negative was overnight parking charge. However, Bellman was upfront about the charges and much less expensive parking was just around the corner. We will definitely return.

review.title: The very best in all our travels!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Despite others previous reviews, our dining experiences were perfection and most highly recommended!

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The room was small but comfortable

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The beds were as comfortable as any we've ever slept in, the room was charming, the dining room lovely, the location ideal - all in all a great hotel. The only criticism - we were on the second floor and band playing at a Saturday night wedding might as well have been in our room. I'd advise taking a room on a higher floor, or at least away from the ballroom.

review.title: Great location and classy atmosphere
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Palace for our first time in San Francisco. It turned out to be a very classy and comfortable hotel. It was also centrally located. We were right around the corner from transit and Union Square (amazing shopping). I would stay there again.

review.title: excellent an francisco hotel
review.reviewText: The Palace is a very comfortable hotel, with large, tastefully decorated rooms. We hads asked for a quiet room and got one. Service was consistently helpful. The one drawback was the once-famous Garden Court Restaurant. It's still beautiful but the food was surprisingly poor. Of course there are plenty of other restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great choice - will return!
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all downtown shopping, lots of small restaurants, BART, cable car, all other transit. Restaurant & bar were expensive but excellent, perhaps to try at least once! Room was luxurious and comfortable. Our only complaint was a running toilet & bathroom fan. We obtained an early check-in and late check-out with no problem. All staff were helpful and always available. We will definitely return.

review.title: Huge Dissapointment
review.reviewText: I have always wanted to stay at this hotel. I live in the Bay Area but had to be in San Francisco on business. I took this opportunity to stay at this hotel. The service and frendliness of the hotel is great and was really surprised at how wonderful the staff treated it's guests. However, when I stay in a hotel of this calibour I expect the room to be in prestine condition. The opposite was true. The carpets were dirty, the bathroom sink was cracked, the bed and pillows were lumpy, dingy bathroom. This place was a huge disapointment for a luxury collection hotel.

review.title: Great hotel - shame about the walls!
review.reviewText: We had planned a night out in the city, and the Palace hotel is in a great location. The staff were friendly and very helpful - especially the garage manager. The room was clean, spacious, well decorated and nicely equipped. The only problem is that the soundproofing is very poor for a hotel of this class. Our neighbours in the next room were involved in some kind of domestic discussion (albeit in moderate tones), but unfortunately we could hear every word. Likewise later in the evening people in the halls, returning from a good night out, were all too audible in our room.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had qualms about finding our way around San Francisco but the mass transportation system is awesome up there. It also helped that from SFO airport, the Palace Hotel is literally right on the Montgomery exit. The hotel is definitely exquisite. The rooms were a bit smaller than I anticipated but the space was quite comfortable and the high ceilings made it seem more spacious. They provide you robes in your room which are quite comfortable to lounge around in and the beds were definitely nice. The pool wasn't as impressive as pictured but the fact that it's indoors is definitely a plus since it's cold in San Fran. I suggest checking out Lefty O'Douls Piano Bar near Union Square for cheap hearty food and a fun yet laid back atmosphere. Even though some can reason out that one does not spend too much time in a their hotel room in a city that offers so much outside, checking into a hotel that one is truly satisfied and impressed with help sets the spirit of the whole trip. I loved San Francisco--it truly is an amazing city.

review.title: charming hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is the bomb. The old sun room and old charm really makes it a wonderful experience. The staff was very helpful and coutious. The service was excellent.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, the staff was great and helful. However the only draw back was the parking was not mentioned to be $48 a day which we felt was steep, but maybe not for the city and we are just not used to it. But if you were staying at a hotel I wuld figure the parking would be included.

review.title: Excellence at it's best!
review.reviewText: I will be staying at this hotel again the next time I am in San Francisco. The hotel staff is very attentive to detail and I was very impressed with the dining hall. It is a truly inspiring roomfull of early 19th century design. AAA+++
review.userLocation: Where the wind sweeps the plains...

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in great location with interesting history.

review.title: Great 4-star hotel in the Union square area
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights, in a two-twins room (they have no two-queen bed rooms). First they offered us quite a small room, I asked to change to a bigger one as we had our kid with us. The second room was very spacious. The hotel is very classy, clean and the location is excellent, right in the Union Square district. The sports facilities were 5-Star, I liked the indoor pool very much. The dining hall with the glass roof is fenomenal! A lot of people come just to take a picture. If I am in SF again, I'm staying only in the Palace!

review.title: One night not enough
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent one night at the Palace in June '07. Room was a standard looking into the interior shaft of the hotel. Not overly large but nice high ceilings and BIG windows that opened. The bed was comfortable and bathroom roomy. No tub, though, shower only. Great service and drinks at the bar. We were looking forward to the Sunday brunch but put off by the price.

review.title: best in class hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: this is a real nice hotel, very well maintaned, old classic style and beautiful. location is the best. most of the sightseeing points you have in walking distance or can use the street car, which is not only cheap but an attraction.

review.title: good service, bland rooms
review.reviewText: service was absolutely perfect and it couldn't have been better. the rooms were very clean, but they were old, and bland and very boring. the bathroom is also right next to the bed. noise was minimal except for the large heavy doors shutting. the pool and whirlpool were nice, although not spectacular. overall a nice stay. it was rather dull from a room perspective but excellent in service. great location, right next to the Montgomery bart stop.

review.title: Expected More
review.reviewText: I have stayed at other hotels in the hotel chain before, but this was my first at the Palace Hotel. I guess compared with my other experiences, it felt a little lacking. I know that the hotel is older, but did it need to feel that way? Actually, while the room was clean it did have a smell to it. I didn't want to bother with switching since they seemed to be pretty full for the day that I was there and it wasn't bad enough, but still... The bathroom was clean, but I found the sink to be really small. A part of the Luxury Collection? It didn't leave me with that impression.

review.title: Don't miss the Palace
review.reviewText: Great location on Market Street- at the Montgomery Street Bart Station. We walked everywhere - Union Square is about 6 blocks away. The room was clean, spacious and the bed, with ironed linens, was great. The bathroom was large and newly redone. The staff was helpful, the concierge was wonderful and Maxfield's, the hotel bar, was friendly, comfortable, and housed an original Maxfield Parrish painting. The history of the hotel is delightful and made it fun to stay in a hotel that could boast "The largest hotel in the world" in the 1870's. We will definitely return to the Palace.

review.title: Good Place to Sleep - Eat Somewhere Else
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel is impressive with its lobby and elegant dining room. Our room was typical for San Francisco, a bit small. The bed was very comfortable but we heard hallway voices from time to time. I don't recommend eating in the hotel dining room...very expensive Sunday brunch. The location is good; only a few blooks from Union Square. BART is across the street.

review.title: worth every penny
review.reviewText: Overall the stay at this hotel was a great experience. Definitely worth every penny if you are looking to be spoiled. Location is super convenient whether driving or taking public transportation around the city. Valet is pricey but not unreasonable and they even leave 2 cold water bottles for you for your trip, a very nice touch. The only two cons were: 1. when my fiancée and I checked in, the person at front desk was extremely snotty. He would not even look at us while he was greeting or checking us in. 2. There was something wrong with the air conditioner in our room and it kept making metal scrapping noise every time the air turned on. We would have switched rooms, but we were only there one night and it was too much hassle to do anything.

review.title: One of San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: Older San Francisco Hotel that was and remains one of the best and deserves every star. The service, quality, and condition are excellent. On top of that, the early 20th century architecture is stunning. While not cheap, the price was reasonable for the city and the quality.

review.title: Very Enjoyable
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. We were a bit disappointed by the room service quality but my 8 year old daughter enjoyed the kids menu. The location is fabulous and the beds are very comfortable. We slept great.

review.title: Classic
review.reviewText: Great place to stay and a very helpful and nice staff. Would stay there again.

review.title: Satisfied Customer
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with this hotel. The rooms we comfortable and clean. Not overly spacious but decent size for a San Fran hotel. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially the concierge. Location was nice as it's very close to Market st. for those city walks. If you are a spa person, the Spa was ok. I expected more to be offered but the staff still did a nice job. So good infact that I got 2 massages. I Would return to this hotel as it made me feel comfortable and not closed in to a small space like some other hotels I've stayed in San Fran.

review.title: Felt like royalty
review.reviewText: This beautifully renovated old hotel met all of our expectaitons. I'd recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Room was a tad on the small side, and that's pretty much there is on the "con" side. Other than that, the Palace is exactly like its name implies--very nice and grand throughout. Me and my wife particularly enjoyed the use of the swimming pool, sauna, pool, and gym--very relaxing stay!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The Palace Hotel was fantastic on every count. The room was great, the historic, sunny lobby was beautiful, the pub was great fun, the location was perfect. There was even a lap pool (indoor!), Jacuzzi and gym. We're going back again and again!

review.title: Excellent value in 5-star hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed here on New Year's Eve 2006. We have chosen it over other 5-star hotels based on reputation, facilities and location. We were able to book our room at almost one half the cost of other 5-star properties available that night. We have not used any of the other services at the hotel but were extremely happy with the room and the check -in / check out service. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: You owe it to yourself
review.reviewText: The Palace lives up to its name. Try to be there on a Sunday morning so you can enjoy the champagne-included brunch served in the Garden Room -- sushi, dim sum, seafood of all kinds, regular breakfast fare, crepes, omelettes, deli sandwiches and a dessert table that will blow you away. Our room was a little smaller than what you may find elsewhere, but the ceilings are quite high so there was no feeling of being cramped. The room was finished beautifully -- it is obvious you're not in a pre-fab cube on the outskirts of Cleveland. Public transportation just steps away, and an excellent concierge too. Starbucks, etc. right up Market St. Spend a little extra, you won't regret it. Ignore the people who are whining about room service prices. Why would you eat in your room in San Francisco? Sheesh!

review.title: The best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was our 30th Anniversary and the Palace Hotel made us feel like Kings and Queens. Great time.

review.title: The palace!
review.reviewText: We had an amazing price through expedia (we usually don't stay in high class hotel) and this stay at the Palace was royal! The hotel restaurant was great and the place itself is just famous!

review.title: A Classic Hotel in the middle of SF
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I stayed here for only one night, and we loved it. She especially loved the classic decor in our room, and the grand dining room, which is supposedly the most elegant dining room in SF. We will definately be returning to this hotel.

review.title: Will be regular guests
review.reviewText: Great service, comfy beds.

review.title: Frequent Guest
review.reviewText: Overall, great business hotel, but a bit pricey.

review.title: Affordable elegance
review.reviewText: Great location, great architecture, nicely restored. We got a reasonable price through Expedia for the room, but note the services (valet parking, room service, restaurants in the hotel) tend toward the same high costs one would find at an expensive hotel.

review.title: The Palace is just that
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights in July 06, everything about the hotel was top notch. No view to speak of, which is often the case in historic hotels. Very quiet; could not hear any noise from ajoining rooms nor from outside (in spite of it's being downtown). Great location, take the Bart from the hotel, the stop is right in front of the hotel. Great location expecially during weekend; no crowds. Pool was beautiful, staff excellent, room well appointed and very clean. Will return on my next visit to SF.

review.title: The Palace is a palace!
review.reviewText: This is a great old hotel which have been renovated to accomodate the pickiest of travelers with the ambiance of the early 1900's with the modernization of the 21st century without loosing its charm.

review.title: Everything You Hope For!
review.reviewText: This was our selection for a mother/daughter overnight. It was magnificent! The staff was wonderful and helpful. The room was immaculate and extremely comfortable. Everything possible to make us comfortable was there. The beds were luxurious with very soft sheets. We were off the street with a quiet inner courtyard. We were close enough to walk to Chinatown and Union Square. We spent our time talking and shopping. Then we had a delicious Sunday breakfast, with attentive waiter, and yummy goodies in every catagory - cheese blintzes and sticky buns!!! Then we hopped on BART at the corner and I went to SFO while she went home to the East Bay. Very memorable! Hope to repeat it again soon. This historic hotel is the best!!

review.title: Absolutely Wonderful!
review.reviewText: I really felt like I was a princess staying at a real palace. The history and beauty of the hotel was amazing. I would recomend it to everyone.

review.title: Palace hotel
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel, but there was a high school prom with loud music on friday night. Someone pulled the fire alarm.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, very friendly and helpful staff, enjoyable bar. Location was great with easy access to public transportation.

review.title: Palace Hotel
review.reviewText: this is one of San Francisco's traditional historical hotels, it is worthy of a five star rating

review.title: We enjoyed the Palace
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Palace.

review.title: Comfort & Convenience in San Fran with Old World Charm
review.reviewText: I selected the Palace Hotel based upon one dinner in their Maxfield's restaurant. I wasn't disappointed in the accommodations. It was comfortable, clean, elegant and centrally located to both Union Square and downtown.

review.title: The lobby's Palm Court is stunning.
review.reviewText: We were there for business and stayed through the weekend. Very comfortable and well appointed king-bed room with high ceiling and small but not tight floor space. Nice bathroom, great shower. The exhaust fan stays on until late at night so it was quite chilly in there. Attentive service. Breakfast arrived on time. Nice lap pool and un-crowded gym. Convenient location. Good public transportation.

review.title: 5 star hotel
review.reviewText: Glamorous, old wordly, lovely truly one of San Francisco's finest.

review.title: Easy to get to from airport
review.reviewText: Very comfortable old style luxury hotel. Dinning room is absolutely lovely and the food is tops.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, so-so service
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are beautiful and the room service was excellent. However, the bartenders/waiters in the only open bar for late night eating were very unfriendly and, in fact, acted as if we did not exist half the time. Besides that fact, the hotel was in a great location and the rooms were nice. If you aren't looking for exceptional service, then I recommend the hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The Palace is San Francisco's "Grand Dame". Exquisite in every sense of the word. The food is excellent, the service outstanding and the environment unbeatable. It's proximity to everything makes the stay even better. You can walk with ease to every major location.

review.title: Extremely noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are old not properly sound proofed. The doors slam shut so hard that the whole hallway rattles when people go in and out of their rooms. I was constantly woken up by the sound of doors slaming shut. And to top that off the last day I was woken up at 6:00 am by the sound of the alarm in the adjacant room.

review.title: very elegant hotel
review.reviewText: Only complaints: water temperature of indoor pool could have been warmer. Pool temp said 80 degrees but it clearly was colder. Room had no music players or TV music, only a clock radio

review.title: My Lovely Palace...
review.reviewText: I felt like I really was in a Palace the minute we stepped into the hotel from New Market street.  "Luxe" would be a great word to describe my surroundings.  The room was elegant with plush, regal bedding.  The modern fixtures, full length mirrors and ammenities in the bathroom were a nice touch.  The hotel has a Day Spa to relax at, and fresh coffee in the lobby each morning.  The knowledgable concierge identified a some fantastic restaurants within walking distance or a short cab ride.  Great overall SF location!  And a price that didn't kill a Queen's budget.
